story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are Sally Davis and Ruth Torjussen, two local mums who are opening the first Play Cafe to incorporate play-pods for children aged 0- 4 years. We are opening on Portland Road in West Hove/ Portslade. We are opening the cafe with inter-changeable Play Pods designed specifically for babies and pre-school children which is something that has not been seen in any other cafe within the Brighton and Hove area. Our Play Cafe will be putting the needs of the parents and children first. We will offer free storytime & singing sessions, mini softplay, secure entry, bumbo's, high chairs, baby change, birthday party hire, Wi-Fi and a community notice board,   We are committed to opening a space where  parents and children  are at the heart of the business, serving yummy food and drinks; excellent coffee, tea, smoothies, sandwiches, soups, cakes and pastries. This will be a Play Cafe like no other, dedicated to local families.
What is a Play Cafe?
A play cafe is a cafe which is tailored to the needs of young children (0-4yrs) and their families.  The cafe will be set out with soft play spaces and a selection of activities for toddlers and pre-school children. We are open to all ideas and we'll actively encourage feedback from our customers. The play cafe will also be available to host birthday parties for children under the age of 5 years and parent group meet-ups at selected hours. 
Who Are We?
Sally currently runs Whizz Bang Pop Children's Entertainment and Theatre. She writes and directs children's plays and has over 11 years of experience in entertaining little ones.  She has two boys aged 1 and 5 years and understands the needs of busy parents. Ruth is a local film-maker, she has 2 grown-up sons and has extensive experience in childcare.  Both have been residents of Brighton for over 18 years and they love the community feel within the local areas, something which they aim to promote at Small Talk Play Cafe. They know only too well the perils of attempting to keep a little one quiet whilst sitting in a cafe. They are both passionate about creating a new type of cafe at the heart of the parent community.
Your Support Means SO MUCH
By supporting this campaign you will be helping to generate a warm and welcoming space for all children and parents (and grannies, grandads, carers, aunts and uncles and friends). The cafe will be informed by what the local community wants and by backing this campaign you can feel part of the foundations of the business and the idea.  Please ask yourself if having a play cafe in this area would enhance your life. Take a look at what we will provide and then please see if you are tempted by any of amazing rewards that you can get from supporting our new business.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise  a minimum of £4,000, which would help purchase the play-pods and play modules for our local toddlers and pre-schoolers to play in as well as some of the other costs of setting up a cafe.

For our customers aged 0-4yrs we would like to offer:

  • Soft Play Pods
    Innovative and inter-changeable soft play created especially for small spaces. These have not been seen in other local cafe. Designed and manufactured exclusively in the UK, meeting all safety requirements, easy to clean and maintain.
  • Chill Out Area
    Comfy sofas, children's books, magazine's, free Wi-Fi.
  • Secure entry
    Gated doorway for extra safety
  • Birthday Parties
    Private hire for birthday parties (at selected times only).
  • Group Time
    Story time, singing classes and group activities provided for free.
  • Child Friendly Essentials
    High chairs, Bumbo's, baby change, messy clothes basket

For Grown-ups we will be able to offer: 

  • Great coffee, tea, smoothies
  • Yummy food and snacks
  • Healthy options of soups and supergreens smoothies
  • Child portions on all food options
  • Free Wifi
  • Friendly, caring staff
  • Children's play equipment maintained & cleaned to the highest standard
  • A great space for private hire parties and classes (selected times)

The perks we offer range from privilege cards to super deluxe children's birthday party packages. There is something for everyone, please take a look and contribute if you can. All help is much appreciated. 

The Impact
We believe this cafe will make a real difference to the lives of families with young children in Hove, West Hove and Portslade. The fact that local people will have contributed to its launch will make it even more special.  We have both run successful businesses in the past and now want the chance to create a beautiful and inviting new space for families to visit.


Risks & Challenges
Sally and Ruth are natural entrepreneurs and can't wait to get stuck in to the hard work of ensuring this cafe provides a fantastic experience for local families. In the case that we don't meet our target, we will use the money that is raised to open the project and to buy the best toys we can to get the cafe up and running. We will return later to raise whatever further money is required to buy further equipment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a look through our amazing perks and contribute to our cafe in whatever way you can. We would really appreciate all social media divas helping us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook and any other social media outlet.
Thank you so much, can't wait to meet you all!! Xxxxxx 
Sally Davis and Ruth Torjussen

story:
Pizza and stuff has delicious, simple pizza. Over the pass few year we have been doing small sells here and there for love of making pizza. Lately our pizza has been getting popular and the demand for them has increased,  My partner and I have decided to extend our business and went to look for funding or a loan and we came across Indiegogo. The money we ask for will help us get to where we want to be, we have loyal customers and a lot of support from our Family and Friends. 

The business will help with the local economy, create a few more jobs that this community doesn't have much of. The welfare rate here is high and I would like to contribute cheaper meals for everyone, making deals on certian days, so everyone can enjoy our food.

With your help I can jump start my business, help create jobs and start making excellent food for my people.

story:
We have a vision that all children can enjoy play experiences together and children with special needs feel as included as any other child.

A place for children and parents of all abilities

For the growing number of children and parents with disabilities in our area, including those with sensory deficits, most playgrounds aren't fully inclusive or can't accommodate their needs. With your support, the Inspiration Playground will become the Eastside's destination playground for active and inclusive outdoor fun — a wonderful place of PLAY FOR ALL.

Why is this so important for our community?

By fostering an environment where diversity is respected and valued, inclusive play also gives able-bodied children the opportunity to experience children with different abilities as equals, teaching the vital lessons of compassion, awareness and acceptance.

Be a part of the Inspiration Playground...Forever!

Add your name to the whimsical design elements of the Inspiration Playground fence.  You can also honor family or friends, commemorate an occasion or share an inspiring quote.  Go it alone or go in on an engraving with a group of friends and family!   Visit our PERKS section on the right to make your gift a legacy that will live on at the Inspiration Playground.

      Quantities are limited-reserve yours today!

       

             

         

         

                 

Does your company have a matching gifts program?  Use our search tool to find out!  You can link directly to your company's matching gift program from our Double the Donation site.  What an easy way to double the impact of your gift!

By fostering an environment where diversity is respected and valued, inclusive play also gives able-bodied children the opportunity to experience children with different abilities as equals, teaching the vital lessons of compassion, awareness and acceptance.

Play for kids..and the kid-at-heart

Playing with kids builds a bond that will last forever.  It lets them know that they are loved and appreciated and opens the door for sharing problems and concerns when the need arises.  The Inspiration Playground will also be a place where differently abled parents can get in on the fun and special bonding that comes with play.

FAQ

What is an INCLUSIVE playground?  What will we build together?

An inclusive playground is not only accessible, but encourages and enables people of ALL abilities to engage with one another. In addition to ramps, accessible swings and play panels, Inspiration Playground will have sensory walls, a quiet Sensory Garden, water play, splash Pads, and more.  Together we will build a destination playground with

    • Barrier-free surfacing materials, inclusive and challenging play environments, sensory experiences that engage all five senses, and family gathering spaces that will make it one of the most innovative outdoor venues in the Northwest.
    • Design elements that address the autistic spectrum including enclosed spaces, which provide an area to regulate their sensory systems after a time of high sensory input, perimeter pathways and other safety features. 
    • Conveniently located, enhanced and accessible family restroom facilities.
    • A Sensory Garden that will engage all the senses as visitors interact with its colorful scented plantings, playful sound features, and hands-on tactile elements.

The City has committed early dollars to the project and will oversee construction and maintenance of the playground once built—assuring donors of the lasting value and legacy of their investment.

$250,000-Is that enough to fund this incredible idea?

Not quite.  Through generous donations, grants and money from the City of Bellevue, we have raised $3.8M of our $5.5M goal.  We are looking for help from you, our community, to raise the additional funds by launching this Indiegogo campaign.  In addition to helping us fund this amazing project, this campaign will:

  • Raise awareness about the project by promoting it to a wider audience.
  • Give the community a personal connection to the project and the chance to be a part of its success.
  • Give people an opportunity to act on their values in a meaningful way by making a statement:  "I want my world to be inclusive."

Is my donation Tax Deductible?  What if I sponsor a fence item?

Yes.  The Bellevue Rotary Club is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization (Federal Tax ID 91-1501333).  Donations are tax deductible. 

When you sponsor a leaf, animal or flower, your payment does not entitle you to receive these items, but rather is a charitable contribution to the Bellevue Rotary Club Inspiration Playground. For each contribution, an engraved item will be placed on the Honor Wall. As any benefits in return for the contribution are considered "incidental," the full amount of your contribution is deductible for federal tax purposes.  Donors will  be emailed a receipt for their donation from FirstGiving.

How do I tell you what I want written on my Inspiration Playground fence item?

We are going to collect this information from backers during the campaign.

Are there any rules I should know about?

Discriminatory or inappropriate messages will not be permitted.  The Bellevue Rotary Club is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization and reserves the right of refusal of any order found to be inappropriate or in violation of the Bellevue Rotary Club policies, directives, or guidelines.

How else can I help?

Please help us spread the word!  Tell your family and friends about us and share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR NEW CAMPAGN ON BETTERPLACE.ORG


Short Summary

  • We are Victor and Max (19 and 20), we are two second year International Relations students in the Netherlands.
  • Since the second world war, the world has not experienced such a high amount of refugees, whether they are internally displaced or forced out of their country, they all lost their homes. Once they’ve arrived in the supposed “safe heaven” of Europe, many obstacles still hamper their escape.
  • Having passively followed the crises for too long we decided to actively help and assist the refugees in any way possible.
  • We will travel to Budapest in our semester holidays (28th of October- 8th of November) from where we will continue our journey by car to specific areas in need of imminent help. In these areas we will supply basic necessities such as nutrition, hygiene products and phone charging possibilities.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Having already covered the cost for travel and accommodation, we hope to receive donations in any size to finance the costs of the supplies.
  • We will publish daily video logs and interviews on a portal in hope to raise further awareness to this international crisis. We hope to aid refugees as much as possible to make their rigorous journeys more feasible.
  • Further we want to give the refugees a voice, in order to fight xenophobia. By interviewing them, posting their stories on our website (www.refugeesvoice.com) we want to create a stage for them to narrate their stories to the population. This way we will create understanding for their situation and generate a more welcome feeling.
The Impact
  • Crisis’ like these should not go unnoticed! We cannot wait any longer for these harsh politics to change, as there are tens of thousands of people in political limbo waiting near borders all over Europe.
  • This is why we’ve decided to act and help on the field, to supply as well as enable these people to get their stories out. Overlooking the diverse national identities, ethnicities and races in this world, we all have one thing in common; being human. We feel entitled and responsible to aid and support wherever possible, and with your donation you will actively help the refugees.

Risks & Challenges

  • There are no risks, all your money will be directly converted into aid for the refugees. In order to create maximum transparency we will publish receipts of everything we are buying for the refugees on http://refugeesvoice.com/receipts/.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to donate, feel free to share this campaign.

story:
Hello my name is Teosha Bentley from Las Vegas, Nevada.

I' am the older sister of Tierra Bentley on the obituary posted. I know this is kind of strange to ask for money on a campaign website but my family and I need all the HELP we can possibly get. In June 2013 my sister, who was an average 17 year old passed away from an unexpected death due to an allergic reaction to amoxicilin. Unfortunately to this day we have yet to pay for her head stone as we are not a family of a great financial status. I am asking for a donation with a goal of $5000.00, anything will do so that we can pay for her headstone so when we go to visit we are not just looking at a temporary plaque with a piece of paper with her name typed a crossed the top. Please any little thing that anyone could graciously give would make me so happy. It is coming up on two years, I miss my sister dearly and the last thing I want is to see a headstone placed on her grave. 
Thank You in Advance, 
Anything is most certainly APPRECIATED
- TEOSHA BENTLEY

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jezabelle Von Jane. I have produced over 200 shows on two different continents. I hold ownership of two different traveling troupes and have been a traveling entertainer and producer  for hire in the realms of Burlesque, vaudeville, production and costume design since 1998. Devoted mother to three and loving wife, I have raised my family in the entertainment buisness and love this life completely. 

Last year I was fortunate to fall, quite literally, in the lap of an incredible woman and BHOF named LEGEND Gabriella Maze. Finding that our personalities, our same stiletto size  and our unstoppable attitudes were the same, we  weaved a bond unlike any other before. From our friendship  I began to learn about the sisterhood that exists between Legends. Comparing our entertainment histories and stories, I was awakened to the realm that exists within the bonds shared by these brilliant legends. Gabriella taught me of their bond and  I began to gain knowledge unfounded in the wealth of this incredible woman and the women who graced the stages before me. The word Legend molded to take on more depth in my heart than just a title. Legends and their views towards the uprising of new coming performers inspired me. I become privy to the love and adoration these Titans have for our community. It got me to thinking......

Stepping into my producer heels I asked Gabby, "As a Legend, what do you want to see our community grow towards?" "What would you, if anything, want to leave behind to others who look up to you and your Legend sisters?" Gabby responded with her all knowing wisdom and sarcastic way "I wanna show people who the hell we are"

The "what if discussion' soon ensued. What if a Legend took on a new protege every year? What if we created an all inclusive Gala  competition for protege hosted and judged  by Legends? What if we were capable of paying Legends to showcase themselves in a light as a performer and a mentor. What if others in the community had the opportunity to share a stage with a Titan in addition to gaining one on one experience never before obtainable.


These questions were answered when Gabriella and myself decided to run with our ideas to her fellow sister Legends. Together with the Icons of Burlesque, we developed a hybrid of festival and performance gala in which chosen champions handpicked by the Legends themselves would compete for the ONLY TITLE IN EXISTANCE GIVEN BY BURLESQUE LEGENDS themselves.


  • What is the GOLDEN LEGENDS CHAMPION CHALLENGE: 

Golden Legends Champion Challenge stands for Glitter, Life , Community and Courage. This is an event giving a platform for Legends to mentor an entertainer from our community. This is an opportunity to become intimate with Glitter Icons that paved the way for our art form.  

This unique event unites a Legend with a chosen protege. Each protege are primed and mentored by their Legend to make ready an act to use in competition against other legends hand picked protege. 


Entertainers chosen as protege will be competing to receive a title, certificate of excellence signed by all Legends, prizes and a paid returning performance the following year. IN ADDITION, EACH LEGEND WILL PRESENT THE WINNER WITH AN HEIRLOOM AT THE CEREMONY. A cash prize will be awarded to the Legend who mentored the Winner.

There will be 10 chosen protege. Seven competing for Champion and three alternate protege to replace the original protege in the event they can not compete. 

Title and prizes will be given for the Crowned champion, runner up and Producers Pick.

WHAT WE NEED 

WELL…..MONEY

Each Legend will require transportation and board, as well as each protege. We have crunched the numbers and are looking at a grand total of $18,000. 

The Legends are coming from each side of our country (and one from Canada). We are wanting to provide roundtrip airfare/gas, the weekend  stay for free as well as that of the protege. In addition we are hoping to pay each Legend 500 for their time and their performance. 

This call to action is requesting that you give any amount you can to support the very first Golden Legends Champion Challenge and help us to set an example in  the festival circuit. This is also an attempt to find better solutions than just "discounted" hotel rooms for the overwhelming costs to entertainers that participate in these events. Countless hours have been spent trying to keep budgets low and still be accommodating to our most prized women in our industry. Each Legend has taken a severe cut in their asking performance pay to make this wonderful idea a reality. 

Please help us be the change we want to see in the industry and give the opportunity to leave more than a signed picture from a Legend in the hands of the next in line for stiletto fitting. 

We are holding multiple fundraisers but here only can you win personalized gifts for your generosity from the Legends themselves!



Risks & Challenges

As with every event, we face challenges of seat filling, volunteering and production. Without the funds raised this project will be pushed back another year. 

I have dedicated my attention to every detail of this event and without our communities help I alone can not make this happen. Join myself and your honored Legends in making a first of its kind idea become reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Please share this to as many people as you can. Contact Jezabelle Von Jane for volunteer opportunities! Anything you can offer from graphic design skills to moral boosting posts are lovingly appreciated!
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Jezabelle Von Jane. I have produced over 200 shows on two different continents. I hold ownership of two different traveling troupes and have been a traveling entertainer and producer  for hire in the realms of Burlesque, vaudeville, production and costume design since 1998. Devoted mother to three and loving wife, I have raised my family in the entertainment buisness and love this life completely. 
Last year I was fortunate to fall, quite literally, in the lap of an incredible woman and BHOF named LEGEND Gabriella Maze. Finding that our personalities, our same stiletto size  and our unstoppable attitudes were the same, we  weaved a bond unlike any other before. From our friendship  I began to learn about the sisterhood that exists between Legends. Comparing our entertainment histories and stories, I was awakened to the realm that exists within the bonds shared by these brilliant legends. Gabriella taught me of their bond and  I began to gain knowledge unfounded in the wealth of this incredible woman and the women who graced the stages before me. The word Legend molded to take on more depth in my heart than just a title. Legends and their views towards the uprising of new coming performers inspired me. I become privy to the love and adoration these Titans have for our community. It got me to thinking......
Stepping into my producer heels I asked Gabby, "As a Legend, what do you want to see our community grow towards?" "What would you, if anything, want to leave behind to others who look up to you and your Legend sisters?" Gabby responded with her all knowing wisdom and sarcastic way "I wanna show people who the hell we are"
The "what if discussion' soon ensued. What if a Legend took on a new protege every year? What if we created an all inclusive Gala  competition for protege hosted and judged  by Legends? What if we were capable of paying Legends to showcase themselves in a light as a performer and a mentor. What if others in the community had the opportunity to share a stage with a Titan in addition to gaining one on one experience never before obtainable.

These questions were answered when Gabriella and myself decided to run with our ideas to her fellow sister Legends. Together with the Icons of Burlesque, we developed a hybrid of festival and performance gala in which chosen champions handpicked by the Legends themselves would compete for the ONLY TITLE IN EXISTANCE GIVEN BY BURLESQUE LEGENDS themselves.




What is the GOLDEN LEGENDS CHAMPION CHALLENGE: 

Golden Legends Champion Challenge stands for Glitter, Life , Community and Courage. This is an event giving a platform for Legends to mentor an entertainer from our community. This is an opportunity to become intimate with Glitter Icons that paved the way for our art form.  
This unique event unites a Legend with a chosen protege. Each protege are primed and mentored by their Legend to make ready an act to use in competition against other legends hand picked protege. 
Entertainers chosen as protege will be competing to receive a title, certificate of excellence signed by all Legends, prizes and a paid returning performance the following year. IN ADDITION, EACH LEGEND WILL PRESENT THE WINNER WITH AN HEIRLOOM AT THE CEREMONY. A cash prize will be awarded to the Legend who mentored the Winner.
There will be 10 chosen protege. Seven competing for Champion and three alternate protege to replace the original protege in the event they can not compete. 
Title and prizes will be given for the Crowned champion, runner up and Producers Pick.
WHAT WE NEED 
WELL…..MONEY
Each Legend will require transportation and board, as well as each protege. We have crunched the numbers and are looking at a grand total of $18,000. 
The Legends are coming from each side of our country (and one from Canada). We are wanting to provide roundtrip airfare/gas, the weekend  stay for free as well as that of the protege. In addition we are hoping to pay each Legend 500 for their time and their performance. 
This call to action is requesting that you give any amount you can to support the very first Golden Legends Champion Challenge and help us to set an example in  the festival circuit. This is also an attempt to find better solutions than just "discounted" hotel rooms for the overwhelming costs to entertainers that participate in these events. Countless hours have been spent trying to keep budgets low and still be accommodating to our most prized women in our industry. Each Legend has taken a severe cut in their asking performance pay to make this wonderful idea a reality. 
Please help us be the change we want to see in the industry and give the opportunity to leave more than a signed picture from a Legend in the hands of the next in line for stiletto fitting. 
We are holding multiple fundraisers but here only can you win personalized gifts for your generosity from the Legends themselves!

       Risks & Challenges As with every event, we face challenges of seat filling, volunteering and production. Without the funds raised this project will be pushed back another year. 
I have dedicated my attention to every detail of this event and without our communities help I alone can not make this happen. Join myself and your honored Legends in making a first of its kind idea become reality.   Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Please share this to as many people as you can. Contact Jezabelle Von Jane for volunteer opportunities! Anything you can offer from graphic design skills to moral boosting posts are lovingly appreciated!

story:
Recently I've committed to playing poker more and more. Ever sense I've started playing it was my LIFE goal to play in a WSOP event. Here's my chance with your help it could be possible.

I'm looking for $2500 total in donations that would cover the 2 events I have my eye on.Event #8 on May 19th with a $580 buy in and of course the MAIN EVENT on May 22nd with a $1675 buy in .

Any donation is amazing and greatly appricated!!

MY credentials: So far in my career in poker I am in the green (made a profit) but at small stakes tournaments and cash games (100-500 buy-in 2/5NL) I have logged over 1000+ hrs in live tournament and  cash games. Unfortunately I live in NY currently and there are strict online gambling laws is place so it is difficult to near  impossible  for me to get online experience under belt . Never the less I do not let it put a damper on my dream.  I attend a lot of tournaments at local casinos and local underground games and do quiet well. I log about 20hrs of live poker every week. I am confident in myself as a disciplined profitable poker player.

I am very thankful for your time and am looking forward to your donations and possably sponsorship. Thank you very much!!!!

story:
Hello,

My name is Jesse and I am currently looking to start offer a new service in the Bloomington, IL area.  When I became a father I learned how much waste is involved in raising a baby.  This ranges from packaging and disposable diapers to cleaning products and whats inside those diapers.  Initially, I considered this the cost of the joy, my daughter, I was helping to raise.  Over time my wife and I began to wonder what we could do to reduce or manage the amount of waste we produced.  I previously lived in the nearby town of Pontiac and the local landfill there was always a constant reminder of how much we as people throw out.
My Story
Our family switched to cloth diapers fairly early on and we learned some very unexpected things.  We learned that cloth diapers did not significantly change the cost of keeping our baby happy and healthy.  The cost actually went down after the initial investment.  I began to wonder why this was an uncommon practice.  As I spread word around, I noticed most people did not realize that cloth diapers had any real benefits.  Many people expected the costs and workload to go up, and cleanliness to go down.  It was at this time I decided I needed to act.  That is why I am here now, I would like your help to make my local area healthier and happier for babies while also reducing the cost and waste associated with raising a baby.

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to acquire $3000. With this initial investment I will be able to finance some low interest SBA loans to get initial stock and material needed. What I need most to get this venture is a car for pickups and deliveries, a new washer with hookups, initial stock of diapers and other sundries like soap, and finally all the odds and ends that come up in bureaucracy like licenses, permits, and acknowledgements.  

Our business plan is to start by offering diapers and accessories needed to provide for a child for about 4 days at a time and we will pick up the dirty and deliver fresh on that schedule twice weekly. At that we would charge $60 for a month. This would also include diaper liners, pail liners, and other odds and ends as needed with access to our webpage which will have a community forum on it to help anyone with questions. 

This is about helping parents and our community

I will be offering my hard learned lessons as a parent who used cloth diapers to mothers and fathers who want to try but aren't sure they have the knowledge necessary to properly care for the diapers and your child. This service would provide fresh clean diapers twice a week to customers.  Our service is meant to offer a lower cost green opportunity that takes the waste and work out of cloth diapers. The great thing about the way we are setting up our service is that each child will be set up with their own set up diapers for their contract. This is also a great way to try different diapers to see what you like and which styles you don't care for as much.  In addition to the actual service work we do and the products we offer, I also hope to raise awareness and a community to help parents with questions and concerns around responsibly raising our children.  I hope that parents using our service can come to us with questions or look to each other and come up with even more ideas to help our children grow up while offering them a better world in the future.

This is a new challenge

I am just starting out as an entrepreneur. Starting a business is filled with risk and doubt. Your help will provide me the funding needed to start a business.  You will also help me mitigate the risks of starting a business while raising my own child. This will allow me to focus more on the people I work with, and for, so we can all benefit.

Even if you can't donate money

Thats ok! If you think this is a worthwhile project, please help spread the word locally to parents who might like my service.  I am also looking for potential customers so I can start building our customer base and spread the word.  If you are not local, I strongly recommend you look into cloth diapering or others who might provide the service in your area.  And if you already offer this service in another area, feel free to contact me and we can compare notes.

story:
... This Indiegogo Campaign is a funding attempt to launch the Santa Patrol Network. Every gift of $30 or more will be rewarded with a minimum of a one year membership to the Santa Patrol Network when it begins early summer of 2015 (subject to background check). This Network will be established to bring the story of the Santa Patrol to life. I am presently instituting a Headquarters in which to operate the Network with plans to eventually form a Non-Profit subdivision that would encourage young children and adults to become authors and artists. I formed the idea of the Santa Patrol several years ago while trying to write a book myself.

... Ever since my creation of the Santa Patrol, I had the dream of building it into a world wide icon that would extend the magic of Santa for both young and old alike. Several recent life-events triggered the reality that the time is NOW. I am Not getting any younger and the adventure can not begin without me. This is your invitation to be part of that experience, so that the exploit can live long after I begin blazing the trail.

... The biggest boost to push this project past it's goal would be for my supporters to not only contribute, but to also share Santa Patrol's fundraising attempt with everyone that they know. To encourage sharing, I have set up bonus gifts for EVERYONE that becomes a contributor when the campaign reaches and or surpasses the Campaign Goal (details at end).

... The Santa Patrol concept was created at the time I began writing a children's book. That book is still being developed.  So far, the concept has only been brought to the Christmas community through those Santas that have been involved with the Santa Patrol vehicle decal (see campaign photo). I first brought the Santa Patrol concept into the public phase three years ago through my Santa community. Although, the 'Santa Patrol Car' actually does not belong to Santa (in our 'story'), it belongs to the Elves checking on the children in the town that Santa is visiting. It works well as a visual explanation as to why Santa does not have the sleigh and reindeer with him... the fact is: Santa and reindeer can only fly on Christmas Eve. It has become a popular prop for many professional Santas... especially those that do home visits.

... In the yet to be completed story, the Santa Patrol was to be Elves and Helpers... and Children that may have jumped across the belief in Santa to becoming a collaborator in keeping Santa's Spirit alive. The Santa Patrol Network will advance the story past a fantasy on paper into the real world of fun and imagination... members become part of Santa's team of helpers which make it possible to keep Santa's Christmas Spirit alive longer and stronger for children in their world.

... I have already produced several props and signature items that I and fellow Santas have used to present the Santa Patrol image in our Santa visits... most are copyrighted and "Santa Patrol" is in the process of becoming a registered Trademark. Your Santa Patrol membership entitles you to discounts ranging from 10-20% on the purchase of available items. All members will have a background check done on them before they will have access to group participation (Note: If you have a felony on your record or are a sex offender, your membership will be denied and no refund offered). As a Santa, I have ties to over 2000 other Santas in the USA alone... Members will have the confidence of knowing that the Santas in the Santa Patrol Network will be checked for offenses as well. Members will have the opportunity to share at events, in web groups, and through electronic notices. Get ready to fly with Santa as part of the Network to keep the Santa magic alive.

... The only hesitation a potential contributor should consider is: If they no longer believe in Santa, they may not cherish the joy a membership can bring... which happens to be the same regret that those that decide not to accept Santa Patrol's invitation as they will not have the chance to share that joy, either.

These additional Membership Gifts will be added if we met or exceed our Goal.

... If we reach our goal of Fifteen Thousand Dollars, all membership packages will include a bonus of some Santa Patrol tattoos... suppose that we double our goal ($30k), memberships will include a "Nice List Certificate", as well... if we surpass the campaign's by triple (45k), each member will get an exclusive North Pole Guest Pass ID in their membership package. If we meet or exceed our goal by over four times, Santa Patrol Members will be invited to a members only Celebration Event and if we exceed the goal into the six figures, I will have a 1st Anniversary Party for our Founding Members in 2016.  So, Keep Sharing to help build the Santa Patrol Membership into one of the largest Christmas organizations in the world.  Wouldn't it be great to start with one to two thousand Santa Patrol members as we embark on this adventure?

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

..... Our top four contributors at the Captain level or above, will form the members of our advisory committee (date of donation prevails to satisfy any ties). Of course these committee members must satisfy all the other requirements.

.... Note: All members are subject to our background check before being admitted.  Since the Santa Patrol Network members will be personally interacting with children, they must not have any felony abuse, child offences, or any other crimes that would basically keep them from getting a job working with children. In the case of a failed background check, the background check would be the only membership benefit that their membership would entitled to for their contribution.

story:
CRAFT IT FORWARD is a community event to raise awareness and give back through creativity.  By hand-crafting toys for young children in foster care in NYC, we can provide a source of joy and happiness for youth who have faced hardships early on in life.  These toys can also serve as an incredible tool to engage young children with their new foster families.


What We Need 

We need to raise money for art supplies in an effort to make 100 toys!!!

(Supply examples: Markers, t-shirts, paints, paint brushes, etc.)  

$10 - Materials for 1 toy for a foster child

$20 - Materials for 2 -3 toys

$50 - Buys enough materials to host a crafting day for 5 foster kids

$100 - Craft It Forward official event sponsor - will receive photos/updates of the impact donations have had with children in foster care.

If we have any left over materials, they will either be used in the next Craft It Forward event, or donated directly to The Children's Village foster center, our partner in this project.

Every little bit helps, so even if you can only make a small donation, I promise it will go a long way!


The Impact

With your help children living in foster care will receive creative and original toys to play with, bringing fun and joy to their lives.  Our hope is that each child gains an understanding of what it means to feel special, because for some this will be the first gift they have ever received. 
While some children in foster care are accepted into loving homes, many age out of the system without finding a permanent family.  By providing children with educational and fun toys, we hope to incite creativity and imagination through the joy of playing and learning.

story:
The Short and Sweet

Sweet Mary's Bakery began almost nine years ago, when in 2006, Akron-native Mary Fann's then boyfriend (and current husband), Justin Hospodarsky decided he just could not eat all of those delicious cookies all by himself. (He really, really tried.)  As Mary couldn't simply stop baking, what was the solution? Why to sell them, of course!

Starting out by baking out of the kitchen of an Akron church, then moving to the basement of an Akron restaurant, Sweet Mary's Bakery has come a long way! We've expanded our menu from cookies to include cakes, pies, muffins, quiche, rolls, and as Mary says "just about anything you can put in an oven".

Sweet Mary has more than outgrown the made-to-order business.

And now we're asking for your help to take us to the next level:

a Retail Bakery!

We already have the perfect location at 161 S. Main Street in the heart of downtown Akron, across from the amazing Civic Theater. We couldn't be more excited to bring a full bakery back to downtown, but here's the problem: it's expensive. Making lots of delicious goodies takes equipment, staff, and inventory, to name just a few.

While we already have a small business loan in process, as well as some pending grants from the City of Akron, we're just not quite there. Sweet Mary's Bakery wouldn't be what it is today if it weren't for the unwavering support of our families, friends, and clients, so now we're turning to you one more time. 


The Sweet (and not-so-sweet) Facts

We estimate our total Start-Up costs to be about $150,000. Whoa is right. Here's the breakdown:

Equipment, bakery cases, etc. $65,000.00
Rebuild & Design $25,000.00
Starting operating expenses, opening inventory, first month wages for staff,  everything else $60,000.00
Total!! $150,000.00
Our small business loan will pay for most of our start-up costs; the equipment, fixtures, permits, opening inventory, etc. The grants we're working on getting through the City of Akron will help pay for our design and rebuild costs, but not all of them. We need a little help to fill in the gaps and make sure we'll be able to keep things running smoothly. Your contribution would go toward some of our build-out and design costs, pre-opening salaries for our staff, and working capital to keep things running while we get situated.



Sweet Mary's - Downtown Akron's only Micro-Bakery

 
"So what exactly is a micro-bakery?" is a frequent question we're asked.  Most local bakeries fall under the category of "cakery", a retail food service shop that sells cakes, cupcakes, sometimes cookies and other related sweets.  By contrast, a "bakery", as we're defining it, sells those items plus pies, breads, muffins, scones, pastries, and a variety of other baked items, both savory and sweet. 

As a micro-bakery, Sweet Mary's Bakery will not only carry the variety of items mentioned above, but we will make everything fresh, from-scratch in small batches daily.  We'll be sourcing many of our ingredients from local farms and other local vendors so we can ensure you get a fresh, quality product every time and can support our community in the process. By operating as a micro-bakery, we're able to have a more versatile menu to highlight seasonal produce, and implement some feedback from you as well.  It also allows us some flexibility for your custom orders, including allergy and/or diet concerns.  So yes, we'll still have carrot cake with cream cheese frosting, frosted sugar cookies, pecan pie, and no-bake cookies; but we know you'll find some new loves in a savory breakfast muffin with bacon and cheddar, a spinach and feta handpie, or a toasted handmade bagel.

With hours from 7am - 2pm M-F, and 10am - 3pm on Saturdays, we'll be offering a variety of fresh baked menu items for breakfast and lunch that you can wash down with French pressed coffee ground fresh daily from Kent's own Bent Tree Coffee Roasters, a bottle of pop from Akron's own Norka Beverage Co., or some good old fashioned milk.  You'll also be able to stop by our Concession window in the Skywalk between the Law Building on South Main Street and the Municipal Building on South High Street, which will be open 7am-2pm M-F, and pick up a hot cup of coffee or a cold pop, and a treat to go with it.  For building tenants and their guests, we will also feature a pick-up window in the lobby of the Law building for quick on-the-go service.   And you can count on us to be open special hours for events at the Civic, lock 3, or along South Main Street!



Why We Need YOU

We are increasingly asked "When are you opening?!?!" and that's certainly a valid question.  So, our target opening date is June 15th  (we've been teasing you with "Spring 2015" all year, and we have until June 21st to make that happen! ;))

In order to meet that deadline we have a lot of work to do. The bakery isn't exactly eh-hem... "turn-key". Though we do have quite a bit of the funding in process, we need your help to turn it from drab to fab. The are so many odds and ends involved in the opening, and they all cost money and they all add up. (We've done the math!) What your money will go towards are the design and rebuild costs, including our new floor, a front display window, our awning and signage, patio tables and chairs (so you can sit outside and sip your morning coffee or tea and enjoy your slice of lemon meringue pie in the sunshine, as you should).  It will also go toward pre-opening salaries for our staff, so we can all get up to speed and ready to keep up with your voracious appetite for all things delicious, while providing you with fun and friendly customer service.  And finally, a little bit more of it will go toward working capital and operating expenses to keep our doors open while we get settled in and get the word out. 

We're so excited to participate in the revitalization of Downtown Akron, and to get you involved in it with us!  We don't want to just set-up shop downtown, we're laying down roots for a shop we hope to be a part of the downtown food scene for years to come.  Downtown already has a lot to offer, but it could be so much more. With recent successful additions to the area including the Nightlight Theater, Nuevo Modern Mexican, Akron Art Walks, and more, your investment in our future is an investment in the future of Akron, by supporting the rebirth of the downtown retail and food scene.

To thank you for your support, we have compiled a bunch of exciting reward options we think you'll really like. You'll have an opportunity to taste some of our goodies, sport some Sweet Mary's gear and show your Akron pride, try out some of the amazing Bent Tree Coffee that we'll be featuring, or even hang out with Sweet Mary and create your own specialty cake or pie! (Hugs included.) 


It Ain't Easy Being Sweet

It's no secret that the food business is a tough one. There are so many moving parts that unless they're all operating smoothly, things can go sour pretty quickly.  By starting out as a made-to-order business almost nine years ago, Sweet Mary's Bakery has been able to build up a loyal customer base (thank you!!), perfect our recipes and techniques, and solidify our vision.

We made the big mistakes early, like that three-tier baby shower cake for 35 people that could have fed 150 (Nicole, you know what I'm talking about), or underestimating the value of planning ahead for events, or charging $1 each for a cupcake to be competitive then discovering it costs me more than that to make one.  But the important point is that we've been there, we've done that and we've learned and improved. So now we're READY.

Without showing you all the spreadsheets (and there are spreadsheets. You have no idea.) it's hard to prove to you just how ready we are, unless you've been a customer of ours. 

We've participated in food fairs and other festivals across the area such at Ramp Up Peninsula, the Peninsula Food Fest, the Tribute to the Civic - 80's Party, provided desserts for local organizations like the Summit County Historical Society and the Akron Urban League as well as local restaurants like Edgar's and the Office Bistro.

The Team

Mary has attended a variety of local business classes through the SBDC, and  graduated in 2013 from the PMBA program through the Akron Urban League. She was also recently a member of the #Akron2Pittsburgh group of local leaders and business owners that toured Pittsburgh for a day to see how we can implement some of their successful tactics to strengthen our own downtown economy.  Mary has a professional background in Accounting and Bookkeeping, and has been baking from scratch for the last 20-25 years. 

Mary's mother and baking assistant, Patty, has a strong professional background in Human Resources and in addition to whipping you up some delicious goodies, she'll be using her professional expertise to help us build an amazing team.

The third member of the Sweet Mary's Team is Kellie Rizzo, whose expertise is in bread, cookies, all things yummy, and turning every frown upside down.


We'll be adding more names to this list soon, so stay tuned.....(but in the meantime, please donate and see below!)


Other Ways You Can Spread Some Sweetness

Not everyone has deep pockets, we get that (after all, we're asking for your help, aren't we?), but there are still so many ways you can help!

    • Use the IndieGoGo Share tools to share our campaign with friends and family who you think might donate to the cause.
    • Let everyone know that Sweet Mary's Bakery is coming to Downtown Akron!  Be obnoxious about it, it's perfectly ok; it's important information and they'll thank you later.
    • Volunteer to help! We'll be in need of people to help paint, lay flooring, carry heavy stuff, plus who knows what else!
    • Like our Facebook page and follow us on Instagram!
    • Want to work for Sweet Mary's Bakery? We're accepting resumes!! Check out our Careers page by clicking here.
    • Come visit us when we open! We'd love to see you and bake you something!

    Have other ideas? Email mary@sweetmarysbakery! We'd be delighted to see what you have in mind and love to talk to you about it! It'd be awfully sweet of you.
story_txt:
The Short and Sweet 

Sweet Mary's Bakery began almost nine years ago, when in 2006, 
Akron-native Mary Fann's then boyfriend (and current husband), Justin 
Hospodarsky decided he just could not eat all of those delicious 
cookies all by himself. (He really, really tried.)  As Mary 
couldn't simply stop baking, what was the solution? Why to sell them, of
 course! 
Starting out by baking out of the kitchen of an 
Akron church, then moving to the basement of an Akron restaurant, Sweet Mary's 
Bakery has come a long way! We've expanded our menu from cookies to include 
cakes, pies, muffins, quiche, rolls, and as Mary says "just about anything you
 can put in an oven". 
Sweet Mary has more than outgrown the made-to-order 
business.
And now we're asking for your help to take us to the next level: 

a Retail Bakery! 









We already have the perfect
 location at 161 S. Main Street in the heart of 
downtown Akron, across from the amazing Civic Theater. We couldn't be 
more excited to bring a full bakery back to downtown,
 but here's the problem: it's expensive. Making lots of delicious 
goodies takes equipment, staff, and inventory, to name just a few.
While we already have a small business loan in 
process, as well as some pending grants from the City of Akron, we're just
 not quite there. Sweet Mary's Bakery wouldn't be what it is today if it
 weren't for the unwavering support of our families, friends, and 
clients, so now we're turning to you one more time.  

 
The Sweet (and not-so-sweet) Facts
We estimate our total Start-Up costs to be about 
$150,000. Whoa is right. Here's the 
breakdown:





Equipment, bakery cases, etc.
$65,000.00


Rebuild & Design
$25,000.00


Starting operating expenses, opening inventory, first month wages for staff,  everything else
$60,000.00


Total!!
$150,000.00



Our small business loan will pay for most of our start-up costs; the equipment, fixtures, permits, opening inventory, etc. The grants we're working on getting through the City of Akron will help pay for our design and rebuild costs, but not all of them. We need a little help to fill in the gaps and make sure we'll be able to keep things running smoothly. Your contribution 
would go toward some of our build-out and design costs, pre-opening salaries for
 our staff, and working capital to keep things running while we get 
situated.

story:
Hello Everyone,


My name is Fabrice Serroen. I decided to create a distributorship company called Usofab. I was amazed about USA organic makeup industry. So I decided to import the number one French organic brand, already distributed in 30 countries, but not in the USA : COULEUR CARAMEL.

We have made some crazy deals for you :

  • If your are a woman you will know what i am talking about.
  • If your are a man, you may be a husband, a son, a father, a grand father, a son in law who wants to get redemption. In that case offer a deal for life to your loved ones.




The product is unbelievable. It is a professional makeup. We are partner of the "Cannes Film Festival", the official makeup for TV show such as "Dancing With The Stars", "Energy Music Awards". The feedback on the product is amazing.
 We believe that everyone should have the choice of wearing armless makeup at a reasonnable price.


I don't want to talk about all the studies made on the makeup. But we know now or should i say we don't know how it effects our skin, body, pragnant women...

Following are some of the chemicals commonly found in cosmetics and what they do to us.

Phthalates

Phthalates are a group of endocrine-disrupting chemicals that are found in cosmetics like nail polish and in synthetic fragrance—both perfumes and fragrance ingredients in other cosmetic products. Phthalate exposure has been linked to early puberty in girls, a risk factor for later-life breast cancer. Some phthalates also act as weak estrogens in cell culture systems.

Triclosan

Triclosan is used in antibacterial soaps, deodorants and toothpastes to limit the growth of bacteria and mold. The chemical, which is classified as a pesticide, can affect the body’s hormone systems—especially thyroid hormones, which regulate metabolism—and may disrupt normal breast development. Widespread use of triclosan may also contribute to bacterial resistance to antimicrobial agents.

1,4-dioxane

1,4-dioxane is not listed on ingredient labels. It is a petroleum-derived contaminant formed in the manufacture of shampoos, body wash, children’s bath products and other sudsing cosmetics. The International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) has ranked it as a possible carcinogen, and the National Toxicology Program (NTP) has identified it as a reasonably anticipated carcinogen.

Parabens

Parabens are a group of compounds widely used as an antifungal agent, preservative and antimicrobial in creams, lotions, ointments and other cosmetics, including underarm deodorants. They are absorbed through the skin and have been identified in biopsy samples from breast tumors.

Ethylene Oxide

Ethylene oxide is used to sterilize surgical instruments. It can also be a contaminant of personal care products such as shampoos and body washes, because it is used to buffer the harshness of some sudsing agents, and trace amounts can be left behind. It is classified as a known human carcinogen and is one of 51 chemicals that the National Toxicology Program (NTP) identifies as mammary carcinogens in animals.

1,3-butadiene

Shaving creams, spray sunscreens and foundations, and anti-fungal treatments that contain the propellant isobutene may be contaminated with the carcinogen 1,3-butadiene. Exposure occurs mainly through inhalation. This chemical has been found to increase mammary tumors in rodents. 

Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAHs)

Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) are a group of chemicals that occur naturally in coal, crude oil and gasoline. One of the more common PAHs is naphthalene. Some cosmetics and shampoos are made with coal tar and therefore may contain PAHs. They have been shown to increase risk for breast cancer.

Placental Extract

Placental extract is derived from human or animal placentas and is used in hair conditioners, shampoos and other grooming aids, particularly those marketed to women of color. The National Toxicology Program (NTP) has identified progesterone, the major hormonal contaminant in placental extracts, as a reasonably anticipated carcinogen.

Lead

Lead may be a contaminant in over 650 cosmetic products, including sunscreens, foundation, nail colors, lipsticks and whitening toothpaste. Lead is a proven neurotoxin, linked to learning, language and behavioral problems. It has also been linked to miscarriage, reduced fertility in men and women, and delays in puberty onset in girls.

Sunscreen

Many sunscreens contain chemicals that exert significant estrogenic activity, as measured by the increase in proliferation rates of human breast cancer cells in vitro. Studies show these chemicals are accumulating in wildlife and humans.




 WE ARE THE FUTUR OF THE MAKEUP INDUSTRY.


WE ARE INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED





Couleur Caramel Values

Respect

All our formulas are free from synthetic origin or oil derived ingredients as the long term effects on health of such products remain unknown.

We use, as often as possible, ingredients stemming from organic agriculture as we are convinced of their benefits for the skin. A large majority of our products is 100% natural.

Professional quality

We are constantly looking to improve the quality of our products, with the help of our Research & Development unit.

We create our products with pigment contents of professional standard, accessible to all. Furthermore, micronization provides an exceptionally thin and homogeneous texture.

We offer unique « all-in-one », natural, organic and mineral make-up,

Ethics for Humanity

We are always searching for specific channels that utilize Fair Trade materials where origin and traceability are guaranteed.

Our products are tested on volunteers and never on animals. We have been member of

One Voice association for years. This association is internationally known as a fervent protagonists of animal rights. 

We use organic active ingredients, thereby promoting the development of a different, much more environmentally friendly type of agriculture.

What about mentioning employment of the physically challenged people for manufacturing of the product.

Sustainable Development

In our global and alternative strategy, we put eco-conception first, both for our packaging and displays. Wherever possible we use recycled, and recyclable and biodegradable materials.

The cardboard of our packaging is produced by a Swedish company which implements reforestation and a non-polluting production program ensuring that forests are maintained and respected (FSC certification : Forest Stewardship Council).

Communication materials are printed according to Imprim’vert charter standards.

Certification

Meeting high standards of specification for integrity and quality is among our core values. Which is why, our make-up range has been the first to be granted Ecocert certification with Cosmebio label, One Voice Association, Cosmetic Bio, Qualité France labels.

                    




We also help to fight Cancer

Usofab will have at hart to support various US foundations


WHY WE NEED YOU


Our factories are in France and Italy. We need a 3 months  stock ahead of us to deliver our clients on time in case any issues happen. That also means the more clients we get, bigger our stock needs to be. We aim to be in 250 local stores by the end of 2017, that means a buffer stock of $500 000 .

We are seeking to raise $150.000 to be able to run our stock for the first  year.That will allow us to star the business and create the cash flow for the next 2 years.

The next step will be to introduce Couleur Caramel to the national main chains by 2018.


THE RISKS

  • Some main stores dealing with manufacturer only, in that case Couleur Caramel will deal with them for us
  • Important stock needed wich means that we can only grow according to the cash flow we can allow to the stock
  • Standart retailer agreement stipulating terms and conditions advantageous to retailers


THE STRENGHTS

  • Quality : professional make up
  • Packaging
  • Niche market with small companies as competitors
  • ability to create new label to enter different princing tier


WHERE WE ARE NOW

  • We are looking to rent our offices and warehouse in Los Angeles.
  • We have found  3 local chains ( 36 stores in total) to put our products on shelves in september.
  • We signed our sole distribution contract with Couleur Caramel.


NEXT STEP TO FULFILLMENT

  • We are looking to find our manufacturer for our  wooden diplay unit
  • we are working on our website to launch it in october




LET'S SEE THE PERKS TOGETHER




Your donation is significant for us and we want to share with you our love for natural and organic cosmetics by some insane deal: Usofab is offering you perks FOR LIFE !

Buy the Lifetime membership card and we'll give you a special VIP account with lifetime access to buy all the Couleur Caramel products,

Lock in this deal for as long as you live before we realize we've lost our minds.


You can choose from:

  


 Have a look at our price list to decide which deal suits you.  ( usd)

OUR MEN BODY CARE PRODUCTS : L'Atelier Des Délices


You have choosen? Great!




 more ( Boring) Details :


The market :

According to the organic monitor, net sales of natural and organic cosmetics in the USA exceeded $5 billion in 2012. $8 Billion net sales are foreseen for 2017 with a CAGR of 9.8% until 2020.
In fact, the distribution of natural and organic cosmetics is changing fast. The limited space assigned to non-food products limits the growth of natural supply. In parallel, retailers trend to be more and more selective with regard to their ranges of natural cosmetics. Leading retail chains, such as Whole Foods Market and PCC Natural Market, pay more and more attention to product formulas.


Background :

Fabrice Serroen with 10 years of experience running a company and many subcontractors, and 15 years selling products across France.
 Fabrice brings in extensive experience in the retail business as a succesful retailer and retail merchandiser for an upscale kitchen cabinet brand. As the first retailer in France for this exclusive manufacturer Fabrice quickly became the 4th largest retailer for this brand in Europe. His upbringing in a business family makes him a natural at a start-up business with honed skills in operations, sales, procurement and distribution.

I have the desire and an ambition to build a strong committed team around Usofab.inc.

use, as often as possible, ingredients stemming from organic
agriculture as we are convinced of their benefits for the skin. A large majority of our products is 100% natural.


Professional
quality



We
are constantly looking to improve the quality of our products, with
the help of our Research & Development unit.



We
create our products with pigment contents of professional standard,
accessible to all. Furthermore, micronization provides an
exceptionally thin and homogeneous texture.

We
offer unique « all-in-one », natural, organic and mineral make-up, 






Ethics
for Humanity




We
are always searching for specific channels that utilize Fair Trade
materials where origin and traceability are guaranteed.



Our
products are tested on volunteers and never on animals. We have been
member of  


One
Voice association for years. This association is internationally
known as a fervent protagonists of animal rights. 



We
use organic active ingredients, thereby promoting the development of
a different, much more environmentally friendly type of agriculture.



What
about mentioning employment of the physically challenged people for
manufacturing of the product.




Sustainable
Development



In
our global and alternative strategy, we put eco-conception first,
both for our packaging and displays. Wherever possible we use
recycled, and recyclable and biodegradable materials.



The
cardboard of our packaging is produced by a Swedish company which
implements reforestation and a non-polluting production program
ensuring that forests are maintained and respected (FSC certification
: Forest Stewardship Council).



Communication
materials are printed according to Imprim’vert charter standards.




Certification



Meeting
high standards of specification for integrity and quality is among
our core values. Which is why, our make-up range has been the first
to be granted Ecocert certification with Cosmebio label,
One Voice Association, Cosmetic Bio, Qualité France labels.
                     


We also help to fight Cancer


Usofab will have at hart to support various US foundations




WHY WE NEED YOU

Our factories are in France and Italy. We 
need a 3 months  stock ahead of us to deliver our clients on time in case any issues happen. 
That also means the more clients we get, bigger our stock needs
 to be. We aim to be in 250 local stores by the end of 2017, that means a
 buffer stock of $500 000 . 
We are seeking to raise $150.000 to be 
able to run our stock for the first  year.That will allow us to star the
 business and create the cash flow for the next 2 years.
The next step will be to introduce Couleur Caramel to the national main chains by 2018.

THE RISKS 


Some main stores dealing with manufacturer only, in that case Couleur Caramel will deal with them for us
Important stock needed wich means that we can only grow according to the cash flow we can allow to the stock
Standart retailer agreement stipulating terms and conditions advantageous to retailers



THE STRENGHTS

Quality : professional make up
Packaging
Niche market with small companies as competitors
ability to create new label to enter different princing tier



WHERE WE ARE NOW

We are looking to rent our offices and warehouse in Los Angeles.
We have found  3 local chains ( 36 stores in total) to put our products on shelves in september.
We signed our sole distribution contract with Couleur Caramel. 






NEXT STEP TO FULFILLMENT

We are looking to find our manufacturer for our  wooden diplay unit
we are working on our website to launch it in october







LET'S SEE THE PERKS TOGETHER

Your donation is significant for us and we want to share with you our love for natural and organic cosmetics by some insane deal: Usofab is offering you perks FOR LIFE !Buy the Lifetime membership card and we'll give you a
special VIP account with lifetime access to buy all the Couleur Caramel products,
Lock in this deal for as long as you live before we realize
we've lost our minds. 
You can choose from:  
 Have a look at our price list to decide which deal suits you.  ( usd)


OUR MEN BODY CARE PRODUCTS : L'Atelier Des Délices



You have choosen? Great!




 more ( Boring) Details :

The market : According to the organic monitor, net sales of natural and organic cosmetics in the USA exceeded $5 billion in 2012. $8 Billion net sales are foreseen for 2017 with a CAGR of 9.8% until 2020.In fact, the distribution of natural and organic cosmetics is changing fast. The limited space assigned to non-food products limits the growth of natural supply. In parallel, retailers trend to be more and more selective with regard to their ranges of natural cosmetics. Leading retail chains, such as Whole Foods Market and PCC Natural Market, pay more and more attention to product formulas.Background :
Fabrice Serroen with 10 years of experience running a company and many subcontractors, and 15 years selling products across France. Fabrice brings in extensive experience in the retail business as a succesful retailer and retail merchandiser for an upscale kitchen cabinet brand. As the first retailer in France for this exclusive manufacturer Fabrice quickly became the 4th largest retailer for this brand in Europe. His upbringing in a business family makes him a natural at a start-up business with honed skills in operations, sales, procurement and distribution. I have the desire and an ambition to build a strong committed team around Usofab.inc.

story:
Me, you and from Nanna 

Hello there everyone!

I'm Mariana, a 23 years old Marketing and Advertising student. My whole life was about watching my granny do all sorts of stuff by whether knitting, crochet and even cross stitch. I've always had a  very dear affection for my grandmother and she taught me everything i know today.

I developed a huge passion for knitting and crochet since the very first day i learned how to craft it. In highschool i've done a LOT of beanies and scarfs for my friends and fellow colleagues and now my best friend is pregnant i just can't stop doing baby clothes! :D

from Nanna is a homage to my granny and the sub brand from Nanna - with care is specialized in customized baby clothing and craddle accesorries. 

By supporting it, i'll give me a huge financial boost to buy some crafting materials that are a bit expensive and i can finally start my own business!


What from Nanna needs & What You Get

All of the funds i can raise will go towards :
  • Brand development : Marketing/P.R approach + Logo
Crafting materials such as : 
  • Cotton and Wool threads + Yarn
  • Crochet/Tricot/Sewing needles
  • Sewing machine
  • Fabrics
  • Clothing labels ( logo labels+ size labels )
  • Packaging of the product

As a thanking gift, for the first 25 supporters than donate 5euros to the project, you will get a pair of some fantastic baby booties and in case you don't have a baby you can also pick an  adult size beanie or a scarf of YOUR CHOICE!!  (please contact me, tell me your choice of gift and it's colours :D)

Thank you SO SO MUCH for supporting my project :D

If the goal is not reached, the priority are the crafting materials and then if i have enough, i can invest on the brand itself . 

Remember, if my project has touched you, and you would like to contribute in other ways than donating you can do so by sharing my campaign  with the indiegogo share tools!

To all of you, that have somehow supported from Nanna, i deeply appreciate it!

story:
Bonjour à tous et à toutes ;-)
Hi there!!


PERSONNALITÉ,

Je suis une maman active. J'ai du arrêter mes études très jeune afin de pouvoir élever ma fille. Beaucoup de difficultés professionnelles ainsi que personnelles ont suivi sans que je ne m'avoue vaincue. Aujourd'hui maman de 3 enfants je suis sur motivé a entreprendre pour prouver aux gens ce dont je suis capable.

I'm an active mom! I had to stop my study early to take care of my daughter. I had then to overcome many business and personal difficulty but i ever gave up!!! Nowadays I have 3 childrens, motivated to prove people and familly what I'm able to achieve!


TOPO,

Voila qui m’amène au projet de ma vie, le rachat de 7 gîtes à saint Martin d'Ardèche. Problème, je me lance seul et sans apport. Se projet est fait pour moi...,  j'essaie donc de trouver des solutions afin d'avoir le financement nécessaire, ainsi montrer toute ma motivation à mon banquier.

Femme d’extérieure, d’intérieure et très organisée. Les horaires de travail me permettront de continuer à m'occuper de mes enfants et être disponible pour eux  une bonne parti de l'hiver.

Here we are! I want to buy 7 holydays cottage in St Martin d'Ardèche (France). I need your help to raise found! Thanks to your help, showing at the same time my will to win to my banker.

As organized women, like all mom i guess ;-), working as hostess in those cottage will allow me to take care of my children during summer and winter as it is actually!

    SOUTIEN,

    J'ai besoin d'un financement de plus ou moins 10 000 euros (n'importe quelle montant sera le bien venu) pour constituer un apport afin d'obtenir mon prêt bancaire. La banque, malgré la reconnaissance d'un projet solide,  me bloque l’accès au crédit professionnel par manque d'apport. 

    My banker fixed the contribution at 10.000€ (11.000USD), it's a aim hard to reach as i start from 0€! But if I succeed, he will give me founds enough to buy the cottage! So HEEELP MEEEE ;-)

    ENTRAIDE,

    Vos dons seront décisifs pour mon avenir! Ils me permettrons non seulement d'obtenir mon prêt, un travail mais surtout un capital pour mes enfants.

    Dossier bancaire Tip Top, je suis prête sur tout les points et refuse de baisser les bras devant la première difficulté.

    Your help will be decisive for my future! It will permitt me to obtain my bank loan, a job, and especially a legacy for my children!

    ALEA,

      Comme je vous l'ai mentionné plus haut il s'agit pour moi d'un projet de vie. N'étant qu'au début, je suis consciente des obstacles que je vais rencontrer tout au long de cette aventure. Mon caractère tenace ne me fera pas lâcher !!!

      As I said before it is THE project of my life! As I just start, i guess i will encounters many difficult and I m not afraid for that because I treat it as an adventure a real life adventure! And I am tenacious, I won't give up!

      REMERCIEMENTS,

        Votre premier don : le temps que vous avez passez a lire mon projet. Pour cela un grand merci!

        Votre 2ème don : la propagation de mon projet dans votre entourage. Pour cela un énorme merci!

        Sans vous mon projet ne pourra pas voir le jour... ET NON, je trouverai d'autres solutions ;-)

        Afin de vous remercier plus encore, je vous inviterai avec plaisir a venir passer un séjour convivial chez nous en Ardèche.

        Grosses bises à tous et à toutes!

        à bientôt :-)

        Thanks for reading, to help me please share my project you can also donate! Without you this project will fail.... or not! I will find more solutions!! remeber: I won't give up!!
        I will also be glad to welcome you and introduce you to one of the best place in France!

        Kiss to all of you! thanks for your help.

        See you soon!

        Ingrid.

story:
B & N Laundry is a little company I started in 2013 when my husband's kidney failed.  Now less than 2 years later, we are a small company that's growing quickly.  Our products included Laundry Detergents, My famous Stain Stick and Wool Dryer Balls. 
In order to grow and keep up with demand, we need to enhance our production and marketing.  We need about $25,000 to assist in equipment such as a commercial shredder and dispensing machines.  We also need to enhance our marketing and build brand awareness.  
Your contribution will contribute to the growth of a company with endless potential. We have interest from major buyers in the natural products and boutique shopping arena. Our products are currently in 150 stores and we know how to deliver a great products to our consumers as promised.  We just need the ability to continue growing so that we can get our products on your favorite store shelf. 
If you can't contribute financially, another great way to contribute is by sharing our campaign and story.

story:
Help Fund XNA-Blade “the Architect of Workout Destruction”

My Story

XNA ERGOGENICS is proud to announce its newest supplement product - Blade. The Main Active ingredient(s) of Blade are all dosed at the clinical true amounts. Blade is Stim-free.

XNA ERGOGENICS uses NO Proprietary blends, NO Under-Dosed Key Ingredients, NO banned substances (WADA), NO harmful chemicals, NO fillers, and NO Hype!

The Impact

Blade by XNA ERGOGENICS is a new supplement aimed at Crossfit and MMA practitioners. Blade will be used to establish the launch to our future products.

What I Need & What You Get

The XNA ERGOGENICS crowdfunding launch is needed for us to satisfy our main investors that will want to see product sold, in stores, and online. Our crowdfunding campaign will help us gather the funds to allow us to pay for the first time production so we can meet the needs of the Investors.

Besides getting the investors to back our supplements, we also want to donate some funds back to Athletes in Wheelchairs and also would like to give one lucky person a certified Personal Training course that we will pay for.

Other Ways to Help

If you can't donate at this time, it doesn't mean that you can't help. Please share our campaign via social media, email and tell others to help spread the word about my campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Our:
Fackebook: http://goo.gl/poUPL3
Twitter: https://twitter.com/AmericanReapers
My name is Aaron Fogle, I am the founder of American Reapers Airsoft. At first we started out as a airsoft team in san diego untill most of the team moved away i moved to oklahoma. After about two years of being here i decided to start up my team again but also a store. We are not a normal Airsoft store we mainly deal with custom built guns.

A little back story about me and why i started this business. Born and raised in San Diego California i started playing airsoft when i was 15. After starting a team with my best friend my family moved to Oklahoma and i had to come with them. I dropped out of high school when i was 16 and got my GED a few months after that When i turned 17 i started going to my community college for Associate in Arts degree in criminal justice. Although i am graduating this year i still want to persue my dream of owning my business which Is halfway there, we have all the lisencing, permits and clientel we just need parts and supplies




This is my future setting up this custom shop and enjoying the sport with friends and family.

What We Need & What You Get

We are needing funds to help get new parts and special order items as well as supplies for our 3d printer where we print our own custom designs and products,

Here is a break down of cost and these are all rough estimates:

Parts/Gear sets/ Pistons/Springs/hand rails/ Inner barrels/ outer barrels/ batteries/ gearboxes/ hop ups/ and other interanls that are used for custom rifles $ 600-700

New 3d printer to add to our manufacturing line where we make custom parts $1500

Supplies for the printer $600

Advertising/marketing $200

Some of our work:

Custom Made GoPro 3 Rail Mount.

Custom Built VFC XCR rifle with high toruge motor/ high speed gears/ Upgrade pistion/head. Tightbore barrel

story:
This campaign has ended, and it was very successful! You can't tell it by the stats shown above, because many people purchased off site. We still have some of these amazing Sri Maha Bodhi seeds blessed by His Holiness the Dalai Lama left and can build you a custom mala to your exacting specifications. See our whole collection here on ETSY: 

https://www.etsy.com/shop/Mystic7Market

 

 

 

  • The ENLIGHTENMENT Mala:

 

The Bodhi Seed used to construct your Mala was collected from the revered Sri Maha Bodhi tree that stands in the midst of the Mahabodhi Temple in Bodh Gaya India, which is considered the MOST IMPORTANT of the Buddhist pilgrimage sites. The Sri Maha Bodhi Tree, planted in 288 BC, is a direct descendant of the original tree under which Siddhartha Guatama received his enlightenment 2500 years ago, becoming The Enlightened Buddha. David was carrying this Bodhi Seed Mala  when he received a hands-on blessing from His Holiness the Dalai Lama while in Sarnath or "Deer Park" India on January 14, 2011. Deer Park is one of the TOP FOUR Buddhist pilgrimage sites, being the location of Buddha's first Dharma teachings where he taught The Four Noble Truths, and it is considered the birthplace of the Buddhist Sangha.

 

Each of our numbered 108 Enlightenment Malas has one of these special Sri Maha Bodhi seeds integrated as the Guru (center) bead. Also included with each Enlightenment Mala will be a Certificate Of Authenticity.
