products that have helped disabled people, pregnant women, the elderly in order to make
their life a little easier. 
The objective of this campaign is to raise funds to produce GWM Water Systems® equipment.
Your collaboration and support will help me introduce GWM Water Systems® equipment in the market, and I will in return help others too.   A percentage of the funds received from this campaign will be donated to organizations that help people with cancer, an orphanage and a center that helps abused women.
 Your collaboration and support will be very valuable and will help others.
Thank you for your help. God Bless You.
   What We Need & What You Get 
I need $250.000
USD to introduce GWM Water Systems® product in the market. The funds will be
used to open an assembly facility and to pay for the production of the parts.  I have already done the entire molds to produce the parts, molds are ready to produce. The GWM Water Systems® equipment already passed the UL Laboratory test and this product is patented and it is registered mark.
We offer unique perks; all of them are made with special design, these perks are really nice and with a unique design. 
If the funds don't reach my entire goal, the funds received will be used for parts production and for donation.   The Impact This campaign has been created to ask your support to introduce the GWM Water Systems® equipment into the market and also to help others peoples, with your contribution this project will be possible and you can make disabled persons, pregnant women, the elderly and others have their life a little easier. With your contribution you can changes the life of many people. Your contribution really help.   Risks & Challenges  
Based on the actual progress of the project we are expecting very little issues or delays once the founding is completed. All the molds are already made. Our equipment already passed the test with UL laboratory, we are currently waiting for UL Laboratories do the final inspection in our facility, but we need the funds to open the facility. The final inspection could cause some delays on production if UL Laboratory have any requirements, normally every request placed by UL Laboratory becomes a priority for us and we resolve any issues within weeks   Other Ways You Can Help Everybody can help us with our campaign, if you cannot help with a contribution, You can help by sharing with all your friend and family our campaign, you can make some noise about our campaign and you can use the Indiegogo share tools!                 You and your help have a lot of value for us.

story:
The Plan

Jill's Place Cafe plans to be the first of its kind in Louisville to create a daily "Pay It Forward" environment that will consistently encourage random acts of kindness to flow throughout the community and beyond.  In addition to a free cup of coffee/other drink (along with the PIF card shown below) being given away to a different random customer each day, Jill's Place will also offer a small weekend venue to the many musicians, artists, crafts people, and others in the community who are striving to showcase their individual talents, affording them valuable exposure to a wider audience.

 

The NEED vs. the Donation CHALLENGE

The Need:

Funding a new business can be a daunting task.  As a result, I am attempting to raise the majority of the start-up dollars through fundraisers.  Having completed one Indiegogo campaign (where I raised enough to purchase the core item needed for the Cafe - the Kiosk), I continue on my quest to raise the additional funds needed to get the Cafe doors open.  I've set the goal for this second campaign at $5,000, but will certainly welcome any amount raised above and beyond that goal (if I should be so lucky).  All monies raised will continue to go toward the Cafe's start-up costs.

 The Challenge:

In keeping with the Cafe's "Pay It Forward" theme, for EVERY FIVE DOLLARS DONATED on this fundraiser, Jill's Place will donate ONE CUP of HOT CHOCOLATE to a local homeless shelter and/or provide it directly to the homeless on the street this winter (see my website for a volunteer sign-up sheet to help out with this).  This is YOUR opportunity to "Pay It Forward" by helping me help those in our community warm up just a little bit on a cold winter day/evening.  Are you up for the challenge?  If so, make your donation today.  If not, spread the word to your family and friends who might be.   Better yet, CHALLENGE THEM to match YOUR donation! 

 

 

  

The Goal

The goal is to open Jill's Place in July, 2015.    With YOUR HELP, I can not only meet the goal of having the Cafe fully operational in July, but can be on the streets/at the shelters "Paying It Forward" to possibly hundreds of the community's homeless this coming winter!  Even if you can only spare $1.00 - every little bit helps!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your donation, there are also several other ways you can help: 

  • LIKE and SHARE Jill's Place on Facebook and ask your friends to like and share it too (facebook.com/jillsplace2015).
  • SHARE the Jill's Place website and ask your friends to share it too (www.jillsplace2015.com).
  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN with your family, friends, business associates, etc. and ask them to share it too (http://igg.me/at/jillsplace).

Every contribution and share will get me that much closer to meeting my goal, so I TRULY APPRECIATE any and all help you can send my way!

 

Lastly

I just want to THANK EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU from the bottom of my heart for anything you can do to support me in this endeavor - whether that's making a donation, sharing one/all of my sites with your family/friends or just wishing me well. 

I truly hope to see you ALL walking through the doors of "Jill's Place" one day...just not all at the same time!  :-)

story:
THE BIRTH OF THE HIP BAR!

My health went on a not so exhilarating rollercoaster ride for many years. I dealt with tumors, cysts, adrenals dysfunction, thyroid issues, and a very rare “supposedly” incurable and disfiguring disease called Morphea. It took me almost losing all of my bodily/cognitive functions to start taking care of my overall health and taking it seriously. A few years ago I quit my corporate job, delved into a healthier lifestyle and began an intensive and full body cleanse that gradually cured me of my aliments, including the “incurable” Morphea.

This experience compelled me to help others with their health. I became a health coach and counseled people on how to establish better eating habits amongst other things. In the process I discovered that most people struggled with what I had struggled with when I began my health journey, overcoming sugar cravings. This led me to develop my own concoction of organic, sugar free, Dessert-Inspired smoothies. These smoothies were such a hit with my clients that I started selling them at my sister and her husband’s café, where they also sold successfully. With that the idea to launch The HIP Bar was born, a fun loving place dedicated to showing and educating everyone on how healthy living can be sustainable and delectable!

WHY HELP BRING THE HIP BAR TO INWOOD?

This smoothie/juice bar will be the first of its kind in the neighborhood and we are confident that so many people will benefit from having a new healthy alternative to eating and snacking in the neighborhood. Here’s why we’re unique:

We’ll offer one of a kind Dessert-Inspired & Specialty Smoothies that are:

- Highly Nutritional

-Organic/ All natural/locally farmed & sourced ingredients

- Sugar Free

We’ll offer Cold Press Juices instead of Regular Fresh Juices

- Retain more nutrients and for longer periods of time

We’ll be hosting Cultural Activities/Art Exhibits/Educational & Health Related Workshops

In addition we’ll offer a variety of vegan snacks and our bar will have the sit-in café vibe offering free Wi-Fi to our customers.  

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Months ago we signed a lease for the space where we plan on opening The HIP Bar, located in the very vibrant neighborhood of Inwood, NY, right in front of the Fort Tryon Park/The Cloisters. The space was a beauty salon for 30 plus years and had never been renovated. As soon as we had the keys in hand we began the work necessary to start the renovation project, which included fixing floors, walls, ceiling, upgrading bathroom etc. To our disappointment, the renovation plans came to a halt when the community organization backing our project suddenly cut funding. This is where you come in; your contributions can help bring the renovation project back to life and get The HIP Bar up and running.

Please donate and help us make this happen; and don’t’ forget to share our campaign with your friends, family, and networks.

Thank you for all of your support! We would be delighted to have you as a part of the HIP family!

story:
Hi,

We are Marco, Alessandro, Thomas and Giacomo and today we are shooting this video to present you a particular and very interesting project.

The project has started as a scholastic research to understand and analyze a growing phenomenon which lies at our heart : the crowdfunding.

This reality has allowed several tiny projects to take place.

Sure enough, there are some people like you who are willing to give even only one dollar to help someone.

So we have decided to add to our research this real project: and that’s why we are starting our crowdfunding campaign .

At this time here in Italy it’s winter  and the months between January and Mach are the coldest ones.

Since Milan is a big city, there is a strong homeless presence : lots of people fight against cold and hunger in order to survive day by day.

By looking around you, you can realize in few seconds the cruelty of this reality that most of the people ignore. An enormous amount of people live alone on the street and, in the hope to receive a coin, they have to spend their days sat on the sidewalk.

Moreover, these people are considered invisible from the rest of community because of the other citizens’ indifference.

In  Milan, as in most of the cities of the world, there are charity associations that have the willingness to help the homeless, but especially in this tough period they are not able to face this issue.

For these reasons, we have decided to be part of this situation, but in order to become more effective we need even your help, because only four people can’t bring any kind of help, but an entire community can change this situation.

Using the collected money, we will buy and bring food and blankets to the homeless.

To sum up, there is one important thing that you have to remember: the help of each of you can make the difference.

We believe that even our small project can become reality.

Thank you

Join our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Helpalifecrowfunding


What We Need & What You Get

  • We set our target to 5000 dollars but every dollar we are going to receive is going to be spend in food and goodness for the homeless
  • We have very interesting perks, even for one dollar! Check them out!
  • If we are not going to reach out goal all the money raised will be used to buy goodness for homeless. Every thing will be reported with a video!Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Give a buck, save a Life! 

That's our word.

 We think that a community can make the difference and with the help of each of you we will hep lots of people.

  • Give what you can afford, everything is gladly accepted. You help will be useful!
  • We believe that even our small project can become reality.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us is to get you to trust us! We will be completely transparent and everything we do well be filmed and reported here on the campaign's page! We will keep you updated every week!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word to your friends and use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
Mighty Lotus is passionate about empowering our youth to overcome challenges and live mindful, purposeful and healthy lives. We believe the life skills they learn using yoga and mindfulness practices has a positive impact on their future and into adulthood. In turn, a more mindful youth helps his or her community, and like a ripple effect, then can help to change the world.

We would be grateful for your support in helping us bring yoga and mindfulness to more youth in Indianapolis schools, where we can give our youth a chance to learn, grow and enrich their lives.

Your contribution will allow us to pay our yoga teachers a fair wage and purchase yoga mats and props.  

The positive impact on children:

Yoga and mindfulness could be the difference between failure and success by:

  • improving concentration & school engagement
  • increasing self-control & self-esteem
  • providing healthy coping mechanisms 
  • helping to deal with stress, trauma & abuse
  • turning negative thinking into positive thinking

Here's how you can help:

1.  First, Make a Tax-Deductible Gift! Support this campaign at whatever level is meaningful for you. Read over our list of perks and choose an amount. Our current studio partners are Body Mind & Core, Cityoga and The Hot Room. You can even give multiple times during the campaign to help us reach our goal! Keep checking back.  NOTE: Your contribution is tax-deductible to the extent the contribution exceeds the fair market value of the perk. You can also choose solely to donate and not receive a perk.

2.  Be a Campaign Champion! Forward this campaign to your friends or share on Facebook and Twitter. Use this campaign as an opportunity to say THANK YOU to special people in your life, and let them know how they have been a gift to you. And invite them to get involved in empowering youth in Indianapolis with yoga and mindfulness.

We put together some nice perks to thank you for your generosity.* 

  • $25 | One (1) yoga class from a Mighty Lotus studio partner** of your choice
  • $50 | Two (2) yoga classes from a Mighty Lotus studio partner of your choice
  • $75 | One (1) handcrafted journal from White Ox Studios
  • $100 | Three (3) yoga classes from a Mighty Lotus studio partner of your choice
  • $250 | Five (5) yoga classes from a Mighty Lotus studio partner of your choice
  • $500 | Five (5) yoga classes from a Mighty Lotus studio partner of your choice, networking opportunities and exposure, an invitation to our annual thank-you dinner, your logo on our website and in our newsletter
  • $1,000 | 10 yoga classes, yoga classes from a Mighty Lotus studio partner of your choice, networking opportunities and exposure, an invitation to our annual thank-you dinner, your logo on our website and in our newsletter
*Your contribution is tax-deductible to the extent the contribution exceeds the fair market value of the perk. You can also choose solely to donate and not receive a perk.
**Current studio partners include: Body Mind & Core, Breathing Space, Cityoga & The Hot Room.

Other ways you can help:

Please know that any way you can help is appreciated, even if it's not a monetary donation. Here are some other ways:

  • Share our posts on Facebook and Twitter with your friends and family
  • Forward our emails with friends and family

Thank you so much for your support. We look forward to sharing yoga and mindfulness with more youth in Indianapolis.

Mighty Lotus is an Indianapolis-based 501(c)(3) nonprofit (EIN# 46-3245250) empowering underserved individuals to overcome challenges and lead mindful, purposeful and healthy lives through the development of life skills using yoga, meditation and other awareness practices.

story:
Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space with Honeysuckle Moon

Your contribution to the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space secures:

  • Supply and Ingredient Surplus for Increased Production
  • Workforce Strengthening via Community Wellness Handcrafting Certifications
  • Production + Treatment Space, Green-Friendly Respites for Artists and Public



Greetings + Introduction to the Lady Behind the Work

Peace and good day! Allow me to introduce myself and offer a warm thank you, in advance, for all considerations and contributions. I am L'Angela "Honeysuckle Moon" Lee, Louisiana Handcraft Artisan, Apothecary, Herbalist, Natural Skin Therapist, Organic Spa Developer, Plant-Based Wellness Educator, Presenter and Writer. Mama and Sista to Many... Every day since March 2006, I've served as the Chief Product Developer of Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care. This is a labor of love that began in my Family home in a small, bayou town in North Louisiana. My life path has proven that I am among the Ones who are Divinely chosen, ordained and guided to do this work. Apothecary offers me countless opportunities to help others learn natural, effective approaches to self-care, condition redirection and wholistic well-being. I serve the Most High JAH by providing excellent service to the People, continually expressing the highest gratitude for my African and Native Ancestors' LOVe, cosmological intelligence, healing abilities and connection to nature. My vision of creating a plant-based wellness arts reality manifests in the forms of handcrafted skin wellness recipes, spa therapies and culinary cravings from a kitchen that cares for individuals, families and artists who take their health and happiness to heart. These jars and bottles are being filled with unparalleled levels of LOVe, wisdom, integrity and quality. Day by day, Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care offers a distinctive approach to herbalism, aromatherapy and apothecary that has traveled across the U.S., Canada, Jamaica, London, Zimbabwe and South Africa. My philosophy of self-care with plants and minerals reaches many, as the number of inquiries, consultations, units sold and bookings for festival, conference and expo dates continue at an incline. For what it's worth, I have been working as grassroots, touring artisan and product developer who seizes a multitude of opportunities annually, from farmer's markets, art shows, wellness conferences, corporate vendorships and music festivals. Each year, my travel itinerary allows me to reach thousands of people and share the healing knowledge that Mother Nature extends to me as I introduce my Roots, Trees and Flowers wellness platform to the world. 


Roots, Trees and Flowers... Plant and Mineral-Based Spa Life for All

Between 2007-2010, I earned several spa certifications and graduated from Atlanta Institute of Aesthetics, which led to my acquiring a penalty-free license in Georgia that permits me to practice as a Natural Skin Therapist. A Natural Skin Therapist who produces herbal preparations and skin condition remedies by hand, travels to share her mission and teach the People about the power of melanin and the countless benefits of embracing a plant-based wellness lifestyle. A few years ago, at such a crucial phase in operations, the confines of a brick and mortar would have been too isolated for my goals of  industry visibility, so the Roots, Trees & Flowers: Herban Wellness Lounge with Honeysuckle Moon was established as a pop-up natural spa and wellness arts studio that could travel  and introduce/service prospects to my work from market to market. The Lounge offers an interactive wellness space, with minimal commitment, that celebrates our skin's ability to be sacredly maintained, prepared, rejuvenated, redirected and, ultimately, resurrected through the proper integration of healthy herbotanicals, plants and minerals. Each recipe continues to be formulated and crafted by hand to meet the unique needs of varying skin and hair types. Since 2006, only one person (me) has remained responsible for Honeysuckle Moon's business formation and maintenance tasks, conceptualization, formulation, production, packaging, technical writing, graphic design and product photography, direct and web-based marketing, direct and web-based retailing, coordination, wellness education, consultations, contractual agreement management and mail order duty. Now, urban farming has been added to the list... It's a wildly kaleidoscopic life, I know. With this stated, I connect with the truth that it is time to reach more people, and because of this, more hands will have to be cultivated. More jars have to be filled and more independent work opportunities have to be devised and implemented for successful market saturation. Task delegation and a subsubstantial budget will take my business to the next level that it deserves. Everything is done in the Spirit of keeping the People healthy as I strive to remain a small-batch, handcrafted wellness product line that celebrates the power of melanin. Because of all of the art which I, personally, produce with just this one heart and set of hands, I am confident that I am ready to teach others my proven methods as an apothecary and achieve the goal of mass production by hand. 

By upholding the original intentions of the Roots, Trees & Flowers Herban Wellness Lounge, our Green Life Art Space concept and design in progress aims to continue to introduce and deliver the artistry of sacred beautification and natural skin wellness, just in a way that's more accessible. A green-conscious day spa, production space and herban sanctuary that grows organic herbs, flowers and fresh veggies and fruit onsite is a refreshingly sustainable, community-friendly, concept to support. Novice prospects and our long-term clientele alike will come to a place that inspires them to free up and partake of the art, our plant-based recipes, skin care and condition-specific treatments. Enjoy our natural facials, customizable aromatherapy products, adornment services, foot reflexology, energetic spa therapies, wellness education, respites and eco-retreat dates. Ultimately, I wish to be able to help as many individuals develop strengthened wellness habits by integrating the Roots, Trees and Flowers philosophy into realistic, customized regimen. I feel really good about this journey as we evolve Honeysuckle Moon into a household name and global community resource for homegrown, handcrafted apothecary, value-added production, urban agriculture and healthy lifestyle planning consultation. 

In addition to maintaining the ongoing operational expectations of Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care and the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Herban Wellness Lounge, in Spring and Summer 2014, with the expert directives of Fresh 2 Health's Charles Greenlea, urban farmer and wellness educator, we began cultivating a series of potted tropical plants and indigenous planting mounds on the prototype property just outside of Atlanta, Georgia. I became quite curious to see what we could grow... In addition to activating my green thumbs and an increasing number of fingers, many hours have spent communicating with the plants to ensure livity and well-being for all who will benefit from their growth and nutritional attributes. As an artist who wishes to live positively and in optimal health, I am doing the self work, removing the limitations my mind once knew in an effort to live harmoniously on the earth's biorhythm, keep LOVe present and continue to learn what is required to embody the faith and purpose of a mustard green seed. I receive it as a vast blessing that I have been granted the reawakening of an ancient knowledge base and will to survive, thrive, grow my own vegetables, flowers and herbs, ultimately, taking care of myself and others with plants and minerals. It's become a necessary task that I assist others in learning how to create these sorts of life boosts for themselves and others, too. 

In the year 2014, we grew the following hearty herbs, plants and superfood greens on a .35 acre private property outside of Atlanta, Georgia: Chamomile, Lemongrass, Honeysuckle, Jamaican Pumpkin, Gardenia, Rose, Sugar Cane, Dinosaur and Curly Kale, Collard and Mustard Greens, Broccoli Rabe, Bok Choy, with Broccoli and Onion on the approach... Spring and Summer 2015 planting goals include: Pot Marigold, Hyssop, Red Clover, Burdock, Aloe Vera, Catnip, Tomatoes, Sage, Lavender, Muscadine, as well as, several varieties of Mint, Basil and Cucumber. As I have accomplished with the yieldings of my winter garden, once mature, these plants  will be harvested and integrated into our plant-based wellness recipes and product formulation processes. 

My beloved Lemongrass (A hoop house will be purchased to accommodate more plants year-round) grew from a 5 inch plant to one that is over 3 feet in height! The heart-shaped leaves in the pot is Jamaican Pumpkin... In the native planting mound below, our Bok Choy, Kale and Mustard Greens are looking Irie! The Broccoli Rabe was just harvested for the first time around New Year's Day and we enjoyed the florets thoroughly. Organic, Natural Livity is the Lesson.


Our Bok Choy...

Our Broccoli Rabe


Growth is Inevitable: Overcoming the Operational Ceiling

As much as part of me would like to continue working in accordance to the demands of this present entrepreneurial formula as a private practice apothecary, I have to respect the fact that my business of almost 9 years has reached its operational ceiling and can no longer survive in the capacity of a grassroots, real-time doing-business-as determined on the basis of what's the available balance in the account. It's time to confront the truth that my dream-space to kitchen to marketplace approach as a Black Woman-owned business has reached the level where it deserves a real, tangible budget for production increase, wellness education and wellness respites for artists and individuals interested in green life cultivation. This is the point where I must navigate the business strategy into more of one with a culture that equips and empowers communities with plant and mineral-based wellness tools, treatments, consultations, employment training, eco-retreats and wellness education. My relentless nature, professional ethic and ongoing commitment to our progress is ready to encounter, share and create professional opportunities with others who move along a comparable path. Forward...

The Roots, Trees and Flowers wellness platform is currently undergoing a bit of energetic construction as it expands to include stationary design, layout and logistics for the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space. The first phase of design is scheduled to be initiated by Summer 2015 in one of the following states: Georgia, Mississippi and Louisiana. Kingston, Jamaica and Accra, Ghana are also being considered as international sites for the 2016-17 Community Wellness Handcrafting Partnership. Once the location has been set for 2015 production, interviews for apprenticeship with Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care (2 slots available) will be conducted.


"Early memories of my Family's gardens and farms along the Bayous of Louisiana create countless smiles in me... While I was always curious of the cotton, tomatoes, greens and peas growing as living things combined with the smell of the dirt, food cultivation was not a conscious idea for me. I loved nature, though. It overtook me, fully, as I found myself enjoying, partaking and building with the plant, insect and animal lifeforms that would reveal themselves. Southern bonding rites among the women that I grew up with included alot of tea brewing, salve making and the therapeutic "parting and scratching of the head." Together, trust was built as everyone did their part in caring for one another. Generations of My Mothers, My Aunts and My Favorite Neighbors all welcomed Me to this way of interactive womanhood, collective care and communal wellness at about age 8. I know that I was born for this... Despite my vow as an apothecary, it wasn't until I opened my heart and connected to the importance of growing food and herbs for wellness that I decided to do my part and become proactive student of agriculture. In 2015, we will experience a green life art space where individuals can come for wholistic wellness, learn the benefits of plant-based spa and growing food. Together, we shall establish a green-focused wellness community at work." Honeysuckle Moon


Root, Trees and Flowers: The Necessities

$100,000 is the 1st Year Start-Up and Operational Goal for the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space. This amount is based upon previous production numbers, financial data and future projections for 2015-16. $250,000 is the official budget amount that satifies formal projections and targets within the 5-Year Development Plan for Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care. Because we'd really like to be able to achieve each set goal, the decision has been made to launch the 1st year campaign with a realistic budget amount. It is important to be able to set goals and attain them, fully... Campaigns that satisfy the remaining projection goals required for stabilization will be set to launch in 2016-17. I trust that pacing the professional expansion goals is wise and is done in an effort to fulfill the mission in the most exemplary manner. Regardless of the final amount that is funded, monies will be appropriated and distributed chiefly, for increased production, intellectual property filings, associated costs with the production and treatment location and startup fees for the community wellness handcrafting partnership, publishing and field research.  

Here's the approximate percentages for 1st year fund allocation:

  • 18% Bulk Supplies and Ingredients for Increased Production at 125 Units Weekly - Bottles, Jars, Labels, Shea Butter, Raw Soap, Aloe Vera, Bulk Herbs, Plant-Based Oils, Essential Oils, General and Shipping Supplies.
  • 7% Intellectual Property Application Filings and Associated Legal Fees for Select Products Deemed Eligible for Mass Production
  •  2.5% Internet, Direct and Print Marketing
  • 6% Tradeshows
  • 3% Continuing Education
  • 3.5% Publishing
  • 3% Field Study for Plant and Mineral-Based Research
  • 25% Acquisition and Maintenance of Production and Treatment Site(s) 
  • 7% Community Wellness Handcrafting Partnership Platform, Formation and Startup
  • 10% Scholarships for Two First-Year Apprenticeship Participants in the Community Wellness Handcrafting Partnership.
  • 15% Preliminary Construction and/or Buildout Costs for the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space.
  • 15-25% Increase Potential for Perks




The Community Wellness Handcrafting Partnership: Cultural Impact and Economic Upliftment for Global Communities


Because I am a single mother of a daughter who chose self-employment to ensure her peace and safety, this season (and the struggles therein) has taught me the importance of being both physically and financially present for our children. Unemployed, underemployed and stay-at-home mothers are at the top of my list of individuals whose lives I wish to make a significant impact in by creating professional training opportunities that strengthen the independent workforce. In addition to learning the fundamentals of hand preparation and basic spa product formulation, all community wellness students will earn class hours in business management and safety and sanitation practices.The Community Wellness Handcrafting Partnership, as well as, implementation of a  poly-leveled, product distribution platform are among the near-future movements I plan to establish in an effort to empower communities culturally and economically around the globe. 


Relax... Release and Retreat

Having the proper outlet for "unplugging" for ultimate wellness and spa rejuvenation is an essential attribute of our Roots, Trees and Flowers philosophy and a necessary mainstay for my own artistic homeostasis. Humble, solar-powered eco cabins are scheduled to be constructed for treatments and respite bookings by Summer 2016. Our current treatment menu will continue to be offered exclusively, in the interim. Regional and international eco retreats will also continue to be made available and booked accordingly. Below, is one of the esteemed retreat opportunities that is presently available to the public as part of our extensive wellness arts portfolio: The 2014-15 Herban Wellness Eco-Retreat with options accommodates international eco-travelers to the island mystics and green life majesty of Jamaica, West Indies!  


Bread May Be a Bit Low... However, Feel Free to Link  Up Honeysuckle Moon with: 

  • Marketing Assistance. Email Moon at honeysucklemoon@gmail.com for initial inquiries and to discuss some really nice approaches to sharing this opportunity with your community.
  • Industry Professionals. You may know someone who is passionate about wellness and would like to add some energy to our mission.
  • Press Contacts and B/Vloggers. I need as many links as possible here, as press professionals, bloggers and vloggers are the people that the people are listening to.
  • Posts on Social Media. The more you share, the closer we all get to sharing some much-needed plant-based spa and retreat time. Tweet now, retreat later.
  • Positive Prayers and Affirmations of Abundance...
story_txt:
Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space with Honeysuckle Moon

Your contribution to the Roots, Trees and Flowers: Green Life Art Space secures:

Supply and Ingredient Surplus for Increased Production
Workforce Strengthening via Community Wellness Handcrafting Certifications
Production + Treatment Space, Green-Friendly Respites for Artists and Public








Greetings + Introduction to the Lady Behind the Work
 Peace and good day! Allow me to introduce myself and offer a warm thank you, in advance, for all considerations and contributions. I am L'Angela "Honeysuckle Moon" Lee, Louisiana Handcraft Artisan, Apothecary, Herbalist, Natural Skin Therapist, Organic Spa Developer, Plant-Based Wellness Educator, Presenter and Writer. Mama and Sista to Many... Every day since March 2006, I've served as the Chief Product Developer of Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care. This is a labor of love that began in my Family home in a small, bayou town in North Louisiana. My life path has proven that I am among the Ones who are Divinely chosen, ordained and guided to do this work. Apothecary offers me countless opportunities to help others learn natural, effective approaches to self-care, condition redirection and wholistic well-being. I serve the Most High JAH by providing excellent service to the People, continually expressing the highest gratitude for my African and Native Ancestors' LOVe, cosmological intelligence, healing abilities and connection to nature. My vision of creating a plant-based wellness arts reality manifests in the forms of handcrafted skin wellness recipes, spa therapies and culinary cravings from a kitchen that cares for individuals, families and artists who take their health and happiness to heart. These jars and bottles are being filled with unparalleled levels of LOVe, wisdom, integrity and quality. Day by day, Honeysuckle Moon Natural Skin Care offers a distinctive approach to herbalism, aromatherapy and apothecary that has traveled across the U.S., Canada, Jamaica, London, Zimbabwe and South Africa. My philosophy of self-care with plants and minerals reaches many, as the number of inquiries, consultations, units sold and bookings for festival, conference and expo dates continue at an incline. For what it's worth, I have been working as grassroots, touring artisan and product developer who seizes a multitude of opportunities annually, from farmer's markets, art shows, wellness conferences, corporate vendorships and music festivals. Each year, my travel itinerary allows me to reach thousands of people and share the healing knowledge that Mother Nature extends to me as I introduce my Roots, Trees and Flowers wellness platform to the world. 











Roots, Trees and Flowers... Plant and Mineral-Based Spa Life for All
Between 2007-2010, I earned several spa certifications and graduated from Atlanta Institute of Aesthetics, which led to my acquiring a penalty-free license in Georgia that permits me to practice as a Natural Skin Therapist. A Natural Skin Therapist who produces herbal preparations and skin condition remedies by hand, travels to share her mission and teach the People about the power of melanin and the countless benefits of embracing a plant-based wellness lifestyle. A few years ago, at such a crucial phase in operations, the confines of a brick and mortar would have been too isolated for my goals of  industry visibility, so the Roots, Trees & Flowers: Herban Wellness Lounge with Honeysuckle Moon was established as a pop-up natural spa and wellness arts studio that could travel  and introduce/service prospects to my work from market to market. The Lounge offers an interactive wellness space, with minimal commitment, that celebrates our skin's ability to be sacredly maintained, prepared, rejuvenated, redirected and, ultimately, resurrected through the proper integration of healthy herbotanicals, plants and minerals. Each recipe continues to be formulated and crafted by hand to meet the unique needs of varying skin and hair types. Since 2006, only one person (me) has remained responsible for Honeysuckle Moon's business formation and maintenance tasks, conceptualization, formulation, production, packaging, technical writing, graphic design and product photography, direct and web-based marketing, direct and web-based retailing, coordination, wellness education, consultations, contractual agreement management and mail order duty. Now, urban farming has been added to the list... It's a wildly kaleidoscopic life, I know. With this stated, I connect with the truth that it is time to reach more people, and because of this, more hands will have to be cultivated. More jars have to be filled and more independent work opportunities have to be devised and implemented for successful market saturation. Task delegation and a subsubstantial budget will take my business to the next level that it deserves. Everything is done in the Spirit of keeping the People healthy as I strive to remain a small-batch, handcrafted wellness product line that celebrates the power of melanin. Because of all of the art which I, personally, produce with just this one heart and set of hands, I am confident that I am ready to teach others my proven methods as an apothecary and achieve the goal of mass production by hand.

story:
Hello Friends,
Being a collector it struck me that here in the SW we have very little choices in the places we can go to feed our addiction. We don't need medical help or anything, we just need more Pops! I've been raising and saving some money for sometime, and I'm almost there, I just need a little bit of a push over the edge to open up a local Pop shop where we can collect to our hearts content!
If you don't know anything about the product go here but be warned they are addictive!
I have the contacts and the merchandise all that's required now is a premises and everything that goes with it plus extra stock I may need to fill the space.
What are we  offering that's different? Better prices and better selection! But not just that, we want to help others start their own Pop shops in their cities by giving advice and startup loans to others wishing to accomplish the same things

 We want to create a space where collectors can meet and discuss their collections buy to their hearts content and even use the store as a hub to trade your own pops!

If this is something you would like become a Funko Founder because this is how we do it in the South West. We work together, and we need all of your help to create this.

Please look at the numerous perks and be sure to especially look at the Gold Card Member perk! It's limited but it's a doozy and potentially could save you thousands.
Not too shabby if we do say so if you want to be one of the privileged few!

To anyone who wants to be a part of this, you're amazing.
With regards to what I've accomplished already, I have a history of employment for international companies in both sales and marketing, and have already put away some capital to start this venture. I've observed the marketing to ascertain a niche 

, scouted a small location to rent, made contact with wholesalers, made deals with friends for masonry etc found second hand retail fittings and equipment studied the market, worked out the costings and the bare minimum I would need to getting running factored in internet/heating costs I've been working away at this for what feels like forever, reading every single business book, seeking out local entrepreneur groups and business mentors and arranged an account with the bank all I need now is the support to get this off the ground which I can only do with the support of the pop community and the small business community. Giving us a hand up this year would be an amazing thing to do.

story:
Teenage Team Aims to Win Cutting-Edge Contest

  • We are team pHFine Scale and we are competing in the Wendy Schmidt Ocean Health XPRIZE! Our team is comprised of six passionate members with very important jobs:                                                                                                                              -Jack Maughan, 17, is our sensor electronic designer and founder of our  crusade                                                                                                                                           -Ethan Kurteff, 16, is our calibration guru                                                                            -Bridgett Maughan, 14, is our social media and fundraising master                           -Benek Robertson, 16, is our sensor packaging designer                                               -Caroline Maughan, 18, is our style guide coordinator                                                     -Lisa Walder, 48, is our team manager                
Thanks everyone for the generous donations!   We are heading to Seattle for Phase 3!
  • News stories about the team!
    1. Krista Almanzan NPR interview:  http://kazu.org/post/carmel-teens-advance-ocean-health-xprize-competition
    2. XPRIZE story:  http://oceanhealth.xprize.org/news/teens-compete-ocean-health-xprize
    3. Mr. Clifford's blog:  http://cscooltechnews.blogspot.com/2015/01/carmel-students-qualify-for-xprize.html
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
  •  XPRIZE has determined through expert research that pH sensor technology is where we need to start to solve the ocean acidification problem. Team pHFine Scale has designed a pH sensor that is both easy to use and affordable and has progressed to the phase 3 coastal trials in Seattle, WA. The team funded their own pH sensor R&D and phase 2a and 2b were locally based so travel funds were minimal. Now that we have to travel to deploy the pH sensor and retrieve it, we are in crucial need of travel funds. 
        WHAT WE NEED                    

  • We need help to get our team members to Seattle (twice), it will take approximately $6,000. This money will cover the purchases of plane tickets, hotel fees, meal costs, rental cars and various travel expenses. 
  • All funds, even if we do not reach our exact monetary goal, will go to supporting the team in our journey to the next phase of the XPRIZE competition. 

The Impact

  • What we don't know about the ocean could take our breath away! 70% of the world's oxygen comes from the ocean. 
  • What we don't know about the ocean could leave us all hungry! 2.6 billion people rely on the ocean as their main source of protein. 
  • The XPRIZE campaign is essential because the ocean's health is in danger! There is talk of dropping pH--meaning the water is acidifying--but there is not enough significant data to prove or disprove this. Winning the competition will slingshot us into production so we can attempt to log the ocean's pH on a massive scale.

Risks & Challenges

  • Our largest risk is not having the funds to travel. A lack of funds would halt our progress in the competition (each phase is mandatory for team participation). We have tremendous confidence in our pH sensor technology and would regret not being able to compete. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We would love for the XPRIZE initiatives to be shared on social media outlets through our friends and family networks. Truly amazing innovations will make positive impacts that will be shared worldwide! 
  • Please share our Indiegogo! http://igg.me/at/teamphfinescale

story:
Hierklicken für die Beschreibung in Deutsch!

Clean drinking Water for 4 KSH / Litre is changing lifes for the People in Kisumu / Kenya. With your help?

No access to clean drinking Water! Thats a real problem we should work on.


I was born in Switzerland, 47 Years old, IT Consultant and Businessman and I'm living since 6 Years here in Kenya. In Switzerland I was "naturaly" used to a perfect infrastructure offered by the Government. I had to learn that this is not the norm and other places on this Earth have big problems with basic needs. Here in Kenya, Families are dealing with the most basic needs - DRINKING WATER for there Family. We like to help the Families in Kisumu Kenya to get a minimum of healthy and clean drinking Water to an affordable fair price!


 
UPDATE: Water-APP will change the way of distributing Water (maji-app)

We designed a Watter-APP to run the Water business using a Smart-Phone for the complete Water ordering process. At the moment we expect to have the first version running before Cristmas so that the Water distribution can start in the beginning of the Year.

  • The functions of the Water-APP
  • Registration for Water-Kiosk owners and Water Customers
  • Water orders using the Water-APP
  • Payment of the Water order using MPESA mobile payment from SAFARICOM
  • Coordination of Water Distribution by Distribution agents
  • Payment to Distribution agents using MPESA mobile payment
  • Coordination of capacities and future developement steps
  • Voting for next region for the second, third, ...Water plant
The design of this application is matching the lifestyle o Kenyans. The Smart-Phone is standing in the middle of there lifes. Doing shopping in Kenya and pay you bill by MPESA is convinient and more save than carrying cash.


What is the main economical problem? The Gap!

When you compare the income structures from Europe with Countries like Kenya, you will recognize the real issues we have! The extrem Gap in the salary structure makes it simply impossible, that a normal Family can use the Money they have to buy bottled Water in the Supermarket. It is far to expensive and only accessable for a small group of top earners!


70% have NO access to clean drinking Water!

In places like Kisumu, 70% of the population has to drink dirthy and poisonous Water from Lake Victoria or little streams with Water, while clean Water is not affordable to them. It makes them sick und nobody cares about it!


IT IS OUR WISH TO CHANGE THIS FOR A BETTER WORLD! ARE YOU WITH US?

Together with my Swiss Friend in Kenya, we decided to initiate the project to help solving this problem in a sustainable way.

The Water Situation Today

Clean drinking water is today in Kisumu only accessable and affordable for the upper midle class and the upper class. More than 50% of the County Water supply is used by only 15% of the population.

Streat dealers are selling this highly with Chlorine treated water for 2 KSH / Litre from door to door. Water in the supermarkets costs approx. 25 KSH / Litre and is for the normal people not affordable. The Monthly salary in the middleclass ranges from 5'000 KSH to 25'000 KSH (50 - 250 $)


Our target: Quality drinking water for 4 KSH / Litre

We like to build up a distribution channel for quality drinking water to the Community for 4 KSH / Litre. The Community gets access to the Water on Water Kiosks with there own cannes.


We create Jobs!

We only run the central Water Production centre. The Water Kiosks, the distribution and the sales channel is done by selfemployeed partners. This creates new jobs for the community.


Sustainable business plan

We developed a business model to build up decentralized Water treatment plants. Dezentralisation is helping us to cut down costs for transport. This makes our Water more affordable and more accessible to the community.

We hope to install with your help until January 2016 the first plant and produce up to 10'000 Litres of clean drinking water every Day. When we reach 70% of sales, we will order the second machine to double the production to 20'000 Litres per Day. And we go on and on and on like this!!!

We use a quality technology from Trunz Water Systems AG in Switzerland.


The first Water production centre

We allready identified the location for the first Water production centre. It is on a perfect location, save for the equipment and very close to our first target Market, The Nyalenda B Estate with a population of approx. 32'430 People can be served within a distance of less than 300 Meter. The location has allready the needed roh Water supply tanks, standby Generator and enough space to supply the Water to Lorries with Water tanks.



Why and for what we need your Help!

We try at the moment to fund the project out of privat sources. The fund raising here on gofundme.com is an additional way to fund our project to start in a shorter period of time and in a bigger scale.

All the internal costs for salaries, traveling, accomodation, planning and integration of the phase 1 of our project is financed by us.


We need your help for the main investments:

  • Treatment plant from Trunzwatersystems AG
  • Setup of the first production plant with storage tanks and piping
  • For the customers we need to buy a first lot of Water Containers with capacities of 10 Litre, 15 Litre and 20 Litre. 
  • Setup of the first Two Water Kiosks
  • Registration costs on side of the Government

It is our target to execute the Phase 1 of the project anyway. We will also try other crowdfunding sites to speed and scale up the project.

AS MORE FUNDS WE CAN RAISE, AS FASTER WE MOVE ON TO PHASE 3 AND 4 AND 5 AND....

Get inspired by another project with the same technology implemented in January 2015 in Tanzania. 
NOTE: This is not our project, but it can help you understand the impact of such projects in Africa and the appriciation of the Community.



Our kind request!

People in Kisumu are suffering about that Water issue. Please help us to solve this problem together. Let us give Kisumu...

Please tell your Friends about our Project.

Thank you! Andreas Koller

Deutsche Projekt Beschreibung

Was sind wirkliche Probleme dieser Welt?

  • ein um 3 Minuten verzögertes „wichtiges Geschäfts E-Mail“?
  • ein Stromausfall, der in der Schweiz alle drei Jahre für 10 Minuten vorkommt?
  • ein Unterbruch des Internets für mehr als 30 Minuten?

Ich frage Dich nun, sind das wirkliche Probleme oder sind wir in der westlichen Welt so in der Hektik des Tages gefangen, dass wir dies als wahrhaftes Problem ansehen?

Die Einleitung zum Thema im Video von Peter Baumann!


Kein sauberes Trinkwasser! Ein wirkliches Problem.

Ich bin gebürtiger Schweizer, 47 Jahre alt, Menschenfreund, EDV Berater und Unternehmer, nun seit 6 Jahren in Kenya. Von der Schweiz war ich mir "natürlich" eine perfekte Infrastruktur gewöhnt. Das ist aber leider nicht selbstverständlich! Hier in Kenya beschäftigen Familien aber noch andere Probleme. Wir möchten den Menschen in Kisumu / Kenya helfen eine minimale Grundversorgung mit sauberem Trinkwasser zu einem fairen und für sie bezahlbaren Preis zugänglich zu machen!



UPDATE: Eine Wasser-APP revolutioniert den Wasser Supply in Kisumu / Kenya

Die Entwicklung unserer Wasser-APP geht gut vorwärts, wir werden voraussichtlich kurz bevor Weihnachten, so zu sagen als Weihnachtsgeschenk die erste Version vorstellen können. Dieser Zeitplan passt auch zu unserem Aufbauplan für das Wasser Produktionszentrum in Kisumu, welches wir anfangs Januar mit Eurer Hilfe in Betrieb nehmen möchten.

Die Funktionen der Wasser-APP
  • Anmeldung für Wasser Kiosk Betreiber und Wasser Kunden
  • Wasser Bestellungen mittels Wasser-App
  • Bezahlung des Wassers mittels MPESA mobil Zahlungsmittel
  • Koordination und Überwachung der Wasser Lieferung
  • Bezahlung des Lieferagenten
  • Koordination und Planung der Kapazitäten
  • Voting für künftige weitere Betriebszentren nach Bedarf.

Der Kern der Probleme in Kenya

Wenn man die Einkommensstrukturen von Europa mit einem Land wie Kenya vergleicht wird einem schnell klar, wo der Kern der Probleme liegt. Die extremen Unterschiede in den Einkommen erlauben es einem grossen Teil der Bevölkerung nicht, die absolution basis Bedürfnisse wie zum Beispiel Trinkwasser zu befriedigen.


Viele Familien in Kisumu haben kein sauberes Trinkwasser!

In Orten wie Kisumu / Kenya müssen 70% der Bevölkerung verseuchtes Wasser vom Lake Victoria oder kleinen Bächen trinken, weil kein anderes erschwingliches Trinkwasser zur Verfügung steht. Es macht die Menschen krank aber niemand kümmert sich wirklich darum.

Ich habe mich mit meiner Lebenspartnerin und zwei lokalen Freunden dafür entschieden mein Leben diesen Problemen zu dedizieren. Die Unterschicht braucht Hilfe zur Selbsthilfe. Ich liebe die Menschen in Kenya und sie werden für unsere Unterstützung dankbar sein!


Die Situation Heute

Sauberes Trinkwasser steht zur Zeit in Kisumu nur der oberen Mittelschicht und der Oberschicht zur Verfügung. Mehr als 50% des aufbereiteten Stadtwassers geht zu 15% der Bevölkerung, welche ans Wassernetz angeschlossen ist.

Strassenhändler besorgen sich dieses Wasser vom Stadtwerk, welches eine sehr hohen Chlorin gehalt hat und verkaufen dieses Wasser von Tür zu Tür für 2 KSH pro Liter. Wasser vom Supermarkt kostet in grossen Quantitäten ca. 25 KSH pro Liter was für die meisten Familien nicht erschwinglich ist. Der Monatslohn der unteren und mittleren Mittelklasse beträgt 5'000.- bis 25'000.- KSH pro Monat (50 - 250$).


Das genutzte Wasser macht die Menschen krank. Eine Behandlung von Typhus oder anderen Viralen und Bakteriellen Infektionen kostet zwischen 3'000.- und 5'000 KSH.


Die Zielsetzung: Trinkwasser für 4 KSH pro Liter

Unser Ziel ist es eine Versorgung mit qualitäts Trinkwasser aufzubauen, welches wir der Community zu 4 KSH pro Liter verkaufen. Die Kunden kommen mit Wasserbehältern zu unseren Vergabestellen, wo wir die Behälter auswaschen und mit sauberem Wasser auffüllen.

Unser Project macht es möglich, dass 80% der Bevölkerung Zugang zu preiswertem Qualitäts Trinkwasser erhalten.

Wir kreiren Jobs und Geschäftschancen!

Für den Betrieb unseres Projektes benötigen wir Frauen und Männer Power. Wo immer möglich, werden wir lokalen Arbeitskräften die Gelegenheit geben, ihr eigenes Geschäft auf Grund unseres Geschäftsmodelles aufzubauen.

  • Transport des Wassers zum Kunden mit Motorrädern (Selbständige Motorradfahrer)
  • Betrieb von Wasser Verkaufspunkten (Frauen Selbsthilfegruppen)
  • Verkaufsagenten und Verkaufsagentinnen (Selbständig mit wiederkehrenden Provisionen)
  • Hilfskräfte in unseren Produktionszentren (Angestellte)


Nachhaltiger Businessplan mit Wachstumsstrategie

Ich habe einen Businessplan entwickelt welcher vorsieht, dass wir in den nächsten Jahren dezentralisierte kleine Wasser Aufbereitungszentren aufbauen. Dezentralisierung hilft, die Transport Kosten herunter zu setzen und die Erreichbarkeit für die Menschen zu erhöhen.

Wir werden, hoffentlich auch mit Deiner Hilfe, bis anfangs Januar das erste System installiert haben, welches bis zu 10‘000 Liter pro Tag produzieren kann. Mit diesem System starten wir das Geschäft. Wenn wir eine Auslasten von 70 Prozent erreicht haben, bestellen wir das nächste System um die Kapazität zu verdoppeln. Dies wird dann mit lokaler Finanzierung möglich sein.


(Wir nutzen für die Aufbereitung des Wassers eine Schweizer Technologie der Firma Trunzwatersystems AG. Meine Firma Swiss Kenko Co. Ltd. ist registrierter Reseller für dieses Geräte in Western Kenya. Dies erlaubt es uns die Kosten für die Geräte minimal zu halten.)

So werden wir nach und nach einen grösseren Teil der Community mit Trinkwasser versorgen können. Wir werden uns auf Orte fokussieren wo die Wassersituation ein dringendes Handeln benötigt. Das sind viele!

Standort für erstes Wasser Produktionszentrum

Wir konnten bereits den Standort für das erste Wasser Produktionszentrum bestätigen. Der Standort offeriert bereits eine perfekte und sichere Infrastruktur. Die Wasserzufuhr ist mit grossen Lagertanks von 2 x 10'000 Liter gesichert, Notstrom agregate stehen uns zur Verfügung und der Zugang für Traktoren und Lastwagen mit Anhängern, welche das Wasser tranporieren können ist gewährleistet. Unser erster Zielmarkt, das Nyalenda Estate mit einer Population von ca. 32'340 Menschen ist in weniger als 300 Meter Distanz erreichbar.


--> Ich möchte mich nicht mit Fremden Blumen schmücken. Folgendes Video ist nur ein Beispiel eines ähnlichen Projektes, welches mit der Trunz Water Technologie in Tansania anfangs 2015 realisiert wurde.

Nehme es bitte als Inspiration an!


Warum und wofür wir Deine Hilfe benötigen

Wir versuchen im Moment aus dem privaten Umfeld und aus unseren eigenen Resourcen die Finanzierung für die erste Phase hinzukriegen. Der Versuch mit Deiner Hilfe und indiegogo.com ans Ziel zu kommen ist ein zusätzlicher Weg um schneller, mehr Menschen mit sauberem Wasser zu versorgen.

Alle internen Kosten für Löhne, Reisekosten, Unterkunft, Planung, Integration bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss der Phase 1 werden wir selber finanzieren! Wir benötigen Deine Unterstützung für die folgenden Projekt Komponenten.


Die 23'700 USD werden für die folgenden Investitionen benötigt:
  • Beschaffung der Trunz Watersystems Wasseraufbereitungsanlage mit einer Kapazität von 10'000 Liter / Tag inklusive Transport und Duties in Kenya
  • Spezielles "silver ionen module" welches das Wasser auch in nicht ganz sauberen Containern unserer Kunden sicher und frei von Bakterien halten kann
  • Einrichtung des ersten Produktionszentrum in Kisumu mit einem Wasser Storagetank und Einrichtungen zum abfüllen des Wassers
  • Für die Kunden werden Wasser Container benötigt, welche jeweils wieder aufgefüllt werden. Wir benötigen eine erste Lieferung dieser Container 10 L, 15 L und 20 L. Diese Wasser Container werden den Kunden zu Nettopreisen zur Verfügung gestellt, wenn Sie keinen eigenen Container haben
  • Einrichtung der ersten zwei Wasser Kiosks, welche dann von Frauen selbständig betrieben werden
  • Registrierungsgebühren mit dem kenyanischen Government um sicherzustellen, dass unser Geschäft nicht ausgehebelt wird
Es ist unser gesetztes Ziel das Pilot Projekt (Phase 1) so oder so durchzuführen. Wir werden gleichzeitig auf einer anderen Crowdfunding Platform in englisch unser Glück versuchen.

Wir lassen uns nicht stoppen! Wir tun es und Du bist hoffentlich mit dabei.

Es ist einfach:
JE MEHR GELD WIR BEREITSTELLEN KÖNNEN, JE MEHR LEUTE WERDEN KURZFRISTIG SAUBERES WASSER ERHALTEN WEIL WIR GLEICH ZUR PHASE 2 UND PHASE 3 ÜBERGEHEN KÖNNEN. BITTE HILF UNS DABEI!


Risiken & Herausforderungen

Wir wissen das die Einführung dieses Projektes verschiedene Herausforderungen für uns bereithält. Kenya hat massive Probleme mit Korruption, welche sich einfach gesagt in ALLEM findet. Du bezahlst Geld um einen Job zu bekommen, um für das Berufsmilitär aufgenommen zu werden, um die Polizei Kontrolle zu passieren, um eine Arbeitsbewilligung oder ein Visa zu erhalten. Korruption ist überall und in allem!

So werden wir auch mit unserem Wasser Projekt stehende Strukturen aufbrechen, wo Leute heute an der desolaten Situation profitieren. Wir werden versuchen diese Leute zu integrieren und von der besseren Qualität unseres Wassers zu überzeugen. Wir werden sehen und angemessen handeln! 

Es ist aus diesen Gründen wichtig, nahe mit den lokalen Leuten zusammen zu arbeiten. Gewisse Dinge wollen sie nicht mit einem weissen Mann diskutieren. Die weissen Eroberer in Afrika haben mir hier in der Vergangenheit wohl keinen nur guten Namen hinterlassen.

Ich bin froh, dass ich in den letzten 6 Jahren einige Freunde gefunden habe welche verstanden haben, dass ich etwas gutes für die Leute und das Land tun will. Das macht mich glücklich!


Schlusswort

Wir wissen es ist nötig, Wir wissen das wir es tun können. Also werden wir es tun!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterstützung und bedanken uns von Herzen dafür.


Wenn Du uns nicht mit Geld unterstützen kannst oder möchtest, kein Problem. Aber

centre. It is on a perfect location, save for the equipment and very
close to our first target Market, The Nyalenda B Estate with a
population of approx. 32'430 People can be served within a distance of
less than 300 Meter. The location has allready the needed roh Water
supply tanks, standby Generator and enough space to supply the Water to
Lorries with Water tanks. 





Why and for what we need your Help!

We try at the moment to fund the project out of privat sources. The
fund raising here on gofundme.com is an additional way to fund our
project to start in a shorter period of time and in a bigger scale.

All the internal costs for salaries, traveling, accomodation, planning
and integration of the phase 1 of our project is financed by us. 


We need your help for the main
investments:


Treatment plant from Trunzwatersystems AG
Setup of the first production plant with storage
tanks and piping
For the customers we need to buy a first lot of Water
Containers with capacities of 10 Litre, 15 Litre and 20 Litre. 
Setup of the first Two Water Kiosks
Registration costs on side of the Government

It is our target to execute the Phase 1 of the project anyway.
We will
also try other crowdfunding sites to speed and scale up the project.

AS MORE FUNDS WE CAN RAISE, AS FASTER WE MOVE ON TO PHASE
3 AND 4 AND 5 AND....

Get inspired by another project with the same technology
implemented in January 2015 in Tanzania.  
NOTE: This is not our project, but it can help you understand the
impact of such projects in Africa and the appriciation of the Community.





Our kind request!

People in Kisumu are suffering about that Water issue. Please help us
to solve this problem together. Let us give Kisumu...


Please tell your Friends about our Project.

Thank you!
Andreas Koller



Deutsche Projekt
Beschreibung
Was sind wirkliche Probleme
dieser Welt?

ein um 3 Minuten verzögertes „wichtiges
Geschäfts E-Mail“?
  
ein Stromausfall, der in der Schweiz alle drei Jahre
für
10 Minuten vorkommt? 
ein Unterbruch des Internets für mehr als 30
Minuten? 

Ich frage Dich nun, sind das wirkliche
Probleme oder sind
wir in der westlichen Welt so in der Hektik des Tages
gefangen,
dass wir dies als wahrhaftes Problem ansehen?
Die Einleitung zum Thema im Video von Peter
Baumann!


Kein sauberes Trinkwasser! Ein
wirkliches Problem.


Ich bin gebürtiger Schweizer, 47 Jahre alt, Menschenfreund,
EDV Berater und Unternehmer, nun seit
6 Jahren in Kenya. Von der Schweiz war ich mir "natürlich"
eine
perfekte Infrastruktur gewöhnt. Das ist aber leider nicht
selbstverständlich! Hier
in Kenya beschäftigen Familien aber noch andere Probleme. Wir
möchten
den Menschen in Kisumu / Kenya helfen eine minimale Grundversorgung mit
sauberem Trinkwasser zu einem fairen und für sie bezahlbaren
Preis
zugänglich zu machen! 





UPDATE: Eine Wasser-APP revolutioniert den
Wasser Supply in Kisumu / Kenya

Die Entwicklung unserer Wasser-APP geht gut vorwärts, wir
werden voraussichtlich kurz bevor Weihnachten, so zu sagen als
Weihnachtsgeschenk die erste Version vorstellen können. Dieser
Zeitplan passt auch zu unserem Aufbauplan für das Wasser
Produktionszentrum in Kisumu, welches wir anfangs Januar mit Eurer
Hilfe in Betrieb nehmen möchten.

Die Funktionen der
Wasser-APP

Anmeldung für Wasser Kiosk Betreiber und Wasser
Kunden
Wasser Bestellungen mittels Wasser-App
Bezahlung des Wassers mittels MPESA mobil Zahlungsmittel
Koordination und Überwachung der Wasser Lieferung
Bezahlung des Lieferagenten
Koordination und Planung der Kapazitäten
Voting für künftige weitere
Betriebszentren nach Bedarf.


Der Kern der Probleme in Kenya

Wenn man die Einkommensstrukturen von Europa mit einem Land wie Kenya
vergleicht wird einem schnell klar, wo der Kern der Probleme liegt. Die
extremen Unterschiede in den Einkommen erlauben es einem grossen Teil
der Bevölkerung nicht, die absolution basis
Bedürfnisse wie zum
Beispiel Trinkwasser zu befriedigen.




Viele Familien in Kisumu
haben kein sauberes Trinkwasser! 
In Orten wie Kisumu / Kenya müssen 70% der
Bevölkerung
verseuchtes Wasser vom Lake Victoria oder kleinen
Bächen trinken, weil kein
anderes erschwingliches Trinkwasser zur Verfügung steht. Es
macht die Menschen
krank aber niemand kümmert sich wirklich darum.


Ich habe mich mit meiner Lebenspartnerin und zwei lokalen
Freunden dafür entschieden mein Leben diesen Problemen zu
dedizieren. Die
Unterschicht braucht Hilfe zur Selbsthilfe. Ich liebe die Menschen in
Kenya und
sie werden für unsere Unterstützung dankbar sein!


Die Situation Heute

Sauberes Trinkwasser steht zur Zeit in Kisumu nur der oberen
Mittelschicht und der Oberschicht zur Verfügung. Mehr als 50%
des aufbereiteten
Stadtwassers geht zu 15% der Bevölkerung, welche ans
Wassernetz angeschlossen
ist. 



Strassenhändler besorgen sich dieses Wasser vom
Stadtwerk, welches
eine sehr hohen Chlorin gehalt hat und verkaufen dieses Wasser von
Tür zu Tür
für 2 KSH pro Liter. Wasser vom Supermarkt
kostet in grossen Quantitäten ca. 25
KSH pro Liter was für die meisten Familien nicht
erschwinglich ist. Der
Monatslohn der unteren und mittleren Mittelklasse beträgt
5'000.- bis 25'000.-
KSH pro Monat (50 - 250$). 



Das genutzte Wasser macht die Menschen krank. Eine
Behandlung von Typhus oder anderen Viralen und
Bakteriellen Infektionen kostet
zwischen 3'000.- und 5'000 KSH.


Die Zielsetzung:
Trinkwasser für 4 KSH pro Liter
Unser Ziel ist es eine Versorgung
mit qualitäts Trinkwasser
aufzubauen, welches wir der Community zu 4 KSH pro Liter
verkaufen. Die Kunden
kommen mit Wasserbehältern zu unseren Vergabestellen, wo wir
die Behälter auswaschen
und mit sauberem Wasser auffüllen.

Unser Project macht es möglich,
dass 80% der Bevölkerung Zugang zu preiswertem
Qualitäts Trinkwasser erhalten.



Wir kreiren Jobs und
Geschäftschancen!
Für den Betrieb unseres Projektes benötigen
wir Frauen und
Männer Power. Wo immer möglich, werden wir lokalen
Arbeitskräften die
Gelegenheit geben, ihr eigenes Geschäft auf Grund unseres
Geschäftsmodelles
aufzubauen.


Transport
des
Wassers zum Kunden mit Motorrädern
    (Selbständige Motorradfahrer)


Betrieb
von
Wasser Verkaufspunkten (Frauen Selbsthilfegruppen)


Verkaufsagenten
und Verkaufsagentinnen
    (Selbständig mit wiederkehrenden Provisionen)


Hilfskräfte
in unseren Produktionszentren
(Angestellte)



Nachhaltiger Businessplan
mit Wachstumsstrategie
Ich habe einen Businessplan entwickelt welcher vorsieht, dass
wir in den nächsten Jahren dezentralisierte kleine Wasser
Aufbereitungszentren
aufbauen. Dezentralisierung hilft, die Transport Kosten herunter zu
setzen und
die Erreichbarkeit für die Menschen zu erhöhen.
Wir werden, hoffentlich auch mit Deiner Hilfe, bis
anfangs
Januar das erste System installiert haben, welches bis zu
10‘000 Liter pro Tag
produzieren kann. Mit diesem System starten wir das
Geschäft. Wenn wir eine Auslasten von 70 Prozent erreicht
haben, bestellen wir das nächste
System um die Kapazität zu verdoppeln. Dies wird dann mit
lokaler Finanzierung möglich sein.




(Wir nutzen für die Aufbereitung des Wassers
eine Schweizer Technologie der Firma Trunzwatersystems
AG. Meine Firma Swiss Kenko Co. Ltd. ist
registrierter Reseller für dieses Geräte in Western
Kenya. Dies erlaubt es uns die Kosten für die Geräte
minimal zu halten.)

So werden wir nach und nach einen grösseren Teil der
Community mit Trinkwasser versorgen können. Wir werden uns auf
Orte fokussieren
wo die Wassersituation ein dringendes Handeln benötigt. Das
sind viele!

Standort für erstes Wasser
Produktionszentrum

Wir konnten bereits den Standort für das erste Wasser
Produktionszentrum bestätigen. Der Standort offeriert bereits
eine
perfekte und sichere Infrastruktur. Die Wasserzufuhr ist mit grossen
Lagertanks von 2 x 10'000 Liter gesichert, Notstrom agregate stehen uns
zur Verfügung und der Zugang für Traktoren und
Lastwagen mit Anhängern,
welche das Wasser tranporieren können ist
gewährleistet. Unser erster
Zielmarkt, das Nyalenda Estate mit einer Population von ca. 32'340
Menschen ist in weniger als 300 Meter Distanz erreichbar.



--> Ich möchte mich nicht mit Fremden Blumen
schmücken. Folgendes Video ist nur ein Beispiel eines
ähnlichen Projektes, welches mit der Trunz Water Technologie
in Tansania anfangs 2015 realisiert wurde. 

Nehme es bitte als Inspiration an!


Warum und wofür wir Deine Hilfe
benötigen

Wir versuchen im Moment aus dem privaten Umfeld und aus unseren eigenen
Resourcen die Finanzierung für die erste Phase hinzukriegen.
Der Versuch mit Deiner Hilfe und indiegogo.com ans Ziel zu kommen ist
ein zusätzlicher Weg um schneller, mehr Menschen mit sauberem
Wasser zu versorgen.

Alle internen Kosten für Löhne, Reisekosten,
Unterkunft, Planung, Integration bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss der
Phase 1 werden wir selber finanzieren! Wir benötigen Deine
Unterstützung für die folgenden Projekt Komponenten.


Die 23'700 USD werden für die
folgenden Investitionen
benötigt:



Beschaffung der Trunz Watersystems
Wasseraufbereitungsanlage mit einer Kapazität von 10'000 Liter
/ Tag inklusive Transport und Duties in Kenya
Spezielles "silver ionen module" welches das Wasser auch in
nicht ganz sauberen Containern unserer Kunden sicher und frei von
Bakterien halten kann

Einrichtung des ersten Produktionszentrum in Kisumu mit
einem Wasser Storagetank und Einrichtungen zum abfüllen des
Wassers
Für die Kunden werden Wasser Container
benötigt, welche jeweils wieder aufgefüllt werden.
Wir benötigen eine erste Lieferung dieser Container 10 L, 15 L
und 20 L. Diese Wasser Container werden den Kunden zu Nettopreisen zur
Verfügung gestellt, wenn Sie keinen eigenen Container haben
Einrichtung der ersten zwei Wasser Kiosks, welche dann von
Frauen selbständig betrieben werden
Registrierungsgebühren mit dem kenyanischen
Government um sicherzustellen, dass unser Geschäft nicht
ausgehebelt wird


Es ist unser gesetztes Ziel das Pilot Projekt (Phase 1) so oder so
durchzuführen. Wir werden gleichzeitig auf einer anderen
Crowdfunding Platform in englisch unser Glück versuchen. 

Wir lassen uns nicht stoppen! Wir tun es und Du bist
hoffentlich mit dabei.

Es ist einfach: 
JE MEHR GELD WIR BEREITSTELLEN KÖNNEN, JE MEHR LEUTE
WERDEN KURZFRISTIG SAUBERES WASSER ERHALTEN WEIL WIR GLEICH ZUR PHASE 2
UND PHASE 3 ÜBERGEHEN KÖNNEN. BITTE HILF UNS DABEI!


Risiken &
Herausforderungen
Wir wissen das die Einführung dieses Projektes
verschiedene
Herausforderungen für uns bereithält. Kenya hat
massive Probleme mit
Korruption, welche sich einfach gesagt in ALLEM findet. Du bezahlst
Geld um
einen Job zu bekommen, um für das Berufsmilitär
aufgenommen zu werden, um die
Polizei Kontrolle zu passieren, um eine Arbeitsbewilligung oder ein
Visa zu
erhalten. Korruption ist überall und in allem!
So werden wir auch mit unserem Wasser Projekt stehende
Strukturen aufbrechen, wo Leute heute an der desolaten Situation
profitieren.
Wir werden versuchen diese Leute zu integrieren und von der besseren
Qualität
unseres Wassers zu überzeugen. Wir werden sehen und angemessen
handeln! 
Es ist aus diesen Gründen wichtig, nahe mit den
lokalen
Leuten zusammen zu arbeiten. Gewisse Dinge wollen sie nicht mit einem
weissen
Mann diskutieren. Die weissen Eroberer in Afrika haben mir hier in der
Vergangenheit wohl keinen nur guten
Namen hinterlassen. 
Ich bin froh, dass ich in den letzten 6 Jahren einige
Freunde gefunden habe welche verstanden haben, dass ich etwas gutes
für die
Leute und das Land tun will. Das macht mich glücklich!


Schlusswort
Wir wissen es ist nötig, Wir wissen das wir es tun
können. Also werden wir es tun!
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterstützung und bedanken
uns von Herzen dafür.



Wenn Du uns nicht mit Geld unterstützen kannst oder
möchtest, kein Problem. Aber

story:
Rebuild the Bear

A community project to preserve the legacy of Kodiak's historic bear statue

Please join us in this community effort to erect a bronze Kodiak bear, replacing the historic but weathered fiberglass statue that has welcomed visitors to Kodiak Island for the past 60 years. This iconic landmark recognizes guides and others who contributed to the conservation of Kodiak brown bears.

The new statue will continue this legacy, and serve as a lasting tribute to the cultural, historical, and economic importance of Kodiak bears - and a reminder that we can coexist and thrive with bears on our island home for generations to come.

A Lasting Contribution

Over time, Kodiak’s wild climate has irreparably damaged our venerable and welcoming bear. A new, life-sized bronze statue will endure, welcoming all who come to our island, celebrating our history, and honoring our unique connection to Kodiak bears. We plan to install the sculpture in the summer of 2016, in conjunction with the 75th anniversary of the Kodiak National Wildlife Refuge.

The Trust is working with renowned sculptor Stan Watts, and has set a fundraising goal of $40,000. Our campaign strategy includes grant support, corporate & association sponsorship, and YOU! The Kodiak Brown Bear Trust and Kodiak community partners value your participation in this project.

The Kodiak Brown Bear Trust is a certified 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization that supports conservation of Kodiak brown bears and protection of their wilderness habitats throughout the Kodiak Archipelago through funding and guidance of research, management, habitat protection and educational outreach projects. Any funds raised in excess will support stewardship of the original statue and help meet the Trust’s mission. www.kodiakbrownbeartrust.org

We gratefully acknowledge the support of the following individuals and companies who have donated in-kind opportunities as part of our fundraising campaign: Kodiak Treks, Harvey's Flying Service, Munsey's Bear Camp, Andrew Airways, and Rohrer Bear Camp.

A Conservation Success Story

This statue is a monument to the presence of our Island’s magnificent bears and their significance in our lives. It also commemorates Kodiak’s first registered bear guide, Charles Madsen, who established the Kodiak Guides Association in 1929 and worked with local Alutiiq natives to guide sportsmen from around the world. Alarmed by growing pressures on the bear population in the early 20th century, Kodiak guides, hunters, and others were important advocates for bear conservation: they championed the creation of Kodiak National Wildlife Refuge in 1941 to protect bears and their habitat. A true conservation success story and a testament to collaborative efforts, the Kodiak brown bear population has recovered and remains healthy.

A Brief History of the Statue:
In 1955, the original “Madsen Bear” statue stood in front of the Kodiak Hotel, greeting visitors who arrived to Kodiak by boat. A mural at the dock proclaimed the Emerald Isle “Home of the World’s Largest Bear,” and the statue proudly rose above the channel. It survived the 1964 tsunami that devastated Kodiak’s harbor and downtown; as the community rebuilt and grew, it moved to different locations, including the Harbormaster’s building. In 2011, the bear statue found a fitting home outside of the recently-built Kodiak National Wildlife Refuge Visitor Center, welcoming everyone and reminding us all of the importance of bears in our community and island villages.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends on social media and help us build support!
With gratitude, the Rebuild the Bear Planning Team.
