story:
Pork and Pickles

Pork and Pickles is the new BBQ brick and mortar restaurant started by food truck and catering company Lazy Farmer owned by chef Chris Simard. Lazy Farmer started in 2013 after a year of organic veggie farming left him wanting to get back in the kitchen. He bought a leaky, dilapidated 1967 vintage camper and converted it into a food trailer and started serving up lunch around Burlington, VT. In 2014 he made a name for himself by getting into all the major festivals, and serving food at local breweries in Burlington. In 2015 Lazy Farmer expanded to cater large events (weddings etc), in addition to serving lunches, vending at events and serving at breweries.

After taking over the garage, kitchen, basement and dining room it was time for Lazy Farmer to finally move out of the house.

In December 2015 Chris purchased an existing restaurant space in Essex Junction, VT to double as a kitchen for Lazy Farmer, and create a new BBQ restaurant called Pork and Pickles.

Why not call it Lazy Farmer Restaurant? Lazy Farmer has established itself as a catering and food truck business and serves a wide range of cuisines. It will continue to cater and serve a wide range of cuisines out of a commercial kitchen.

Why call it Pork and Pickles? Through catering BBQ themes, hearing lots of positive feedback from customers about BBQ, and traveling to BBQ destinations, Chris has developed a passion for pork, BBQ, and pickling, so he wants to create a BBQ concept restaurant to showcase this cuisine.

About the Chef

Chris was born and raised in Colchester, VT. He is a proud 8th generation Vermonter who has also lived in Boston, San Francisco, and lived briefly while attending school in Ottawa and New Hampshire.

Chris has worked in food service for about 15 years holding both back of house and front of house positions in independent and national establishments. Chris attended Le Cordon Bleu in Ottawa, ON in 2002. While at school he became interested in where the food was coming from. He then went to University of Vermont to study Ecological Agriculture. While at UVM he worked part time at Tiny Thai Restaurant. After graduation he helped a friend expand his farming business by selling produce to area restaurants including Tiny Thai. With all of his savings and the money earned from the year of farming, he started Lazy Farmer food truck. He has continued to work at Tiny Thai during his slow seasons of Lazy Farmer allowing him to finance his business entirely on his own.

Now What?

We purchased an existing restaurant with a little help from Chris' Family and signed a lease in Dec 2015. The dining room needs some renovation, the kitchen needs some renovation, and we still need some equipment to get us going. With a little bit of your help we can avoid falling into debt to get this restaurant off the ground. 

Here is what we still need:

  • A working walk-in cooler $2500
  • A dish sink $1000
  • A dishwasher $2000
  • Additional plumbing $1000
  • An indoor smoker $3500
  • Griddle $500
  • Signage $600
  • Dining room decorations and seating $1500
  • Bathrooms renovations $250
  • Dining room renovations $1200
  • Exterior renovations $1000
  • POS system $1000

If we don't reach our goal of $16,000 the funds raised will go towards improving the kitchen and a bare bones build out of our dining room. Your contribution will help us keep our heads above water while we start a new restaurant. 

Here is what you get:   A new independently owned BBQ restaurant in Essex Junction.  

Please donate to help make Pork & Pickles BBQ a reality!  Thank you gifts for your greatly appreciated donations:

$25 Gets you a hug, Everyone needs a hug, and I'll give you the biggest one!

$50 Gets you a $50 gift card to Pork & Pickles.

$100 Gets you a $100 gift card to Pork & Pickles.

$150 Gets you one free dinner and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.

$250 Gets you an invite to our soft opening night with a free dinner and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.

$500 Gets you free dinner for 4 and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.

$1,000 Gets you the Lazy Farmer food truck at your house.  We will pull up and serve a party of up to 30 people at your house this season.

$5,000 Gets you a free private party for 20 people and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.

$10,000 Gets you free food for life and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt and you can come to soft opening and get a hug! 

The Impact

Chris has shown that he achieves business success. He has left a lasting mark on every business he has worked in, whether it is establishing cleaning regime, improving management communication with staff, motivating his peers, setting guidelines for organizational standards, doubling sales at the farm, or growing Lazy Farmer from serving 10 customers a day to catering weddings of 200, he has a proven record of achieving his goals.

Chris' education in both agricultural science and culinary arts allows him to use his knowledge of agriculture to make informed decisions on his purchasing as well as grow some produce himself as his focus is on buying local and responsibly sourced ingredients. Supporting us supports the rural economy of Vermont that makes this state such a unique and beautiful place to live. We want to be part of your weekly routine allowing you to support a local business that supports other local businesses.

Pork and Pickles is a casual BBQ restaurant. We will fill a void in Essex Junction by being the only BBQ restaurant, as well as the only "farm to table" restaurant that will offer meals at reasonable prices you can afford to enjoy regularly. 

Risks and Challenges

Everyone knows restaurants are risky businesses. Fortunately our restaurant is backed by an established catering and food truck business that can help carry us forward in the beginning.

We are all creatures of habit. It might be hard for us to attract customers to a new restaurant. We have come up with a marketing plan sure to get our name out there. 

How is Chris going to run a catering business and a restaurant? He has enlisted the help from people he has worked with over the past three years. He has the support of trusted individuals that he knows can execute food and service to his high standards. 

Ways You Can Help

Please donate to help make Pork & Pickles BBQ a reality!  If you want to help, but don't have extra cash you still have a way. Please spread the word about our campaign on social media, tell your friends and family, and come visit us when we open!

goal of $16,000 the funds raised will go towards improving the kitchen and a
bare bones build out of our dining room. Your contribution will help us keep
our heads above water while we start a new restaurant. 
Here is what you get:
  A new independently owned BBQ restaurant in Essex Junction.  Please donate to help make Pork & Pickles BBQ a reality!  Thank you gifts for your greatly appreciated donations:$25 Gets you a hug, Everyone needs a hug, and I'll give you the biggest one!$50 Gets you a $50 gift card to Pork & Pickles.$100 Gets you a $100 gift card to Pork & Pickles.$150 Gets you one free dinner and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.$250 Gets you an invite to our soft opening night with a free dinner and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.$500 Gets you free dinner for 4 and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.$1,000 Gets you the Lazy Farmer food truck at your house.  We will pull up and serve a party of up to 30 people at your house this season.$5,000 Gets you a free private party for 20 people and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt.$10,000 Gets you free food for life and a Pork & Pickles T-shirt and you can come to soft opening and get a hug! 
The Impact
Chris has shown that he achieves business success. He has
left a lasting mark on every business he has worked in, whether it is
establishing cleaning regime, improving management communication with staff,
motivating his peers, setting guidelines for organizational standards, doubling
sales at the farm, or growing Lazy Farmer from serving 10 customers a day to
catering weddings of 200, he has a proven record of achieving his goals.
Chris' education in both agricultural science and culinary
arts allows him to use his knowledge of agriculture to make informed decisions
on his purchasing as well as grow some produce himself as his focus is on
buying local and responsibly sourced ingredients. Supporting us supports the
rural economy of Vermont that makes this state such a unique and beautiful
place to live. We want to be part of your weekly routine allowing you to
support a local business that supports other local businesses.
Pork and Pickles is a casual BBQ restaurant. We will
fill a void in Essex Junction by being the only BBQ restaurant, as well as the
only "farm to table" restaurant that will offer meals at reasonable
prices you can afford to enjoy regularly. 
Risks and Challenges
Everyone knows restaurants are risky businesses.
Fortunately our restaurant is backed by an established catering and food truck
business that can help carry us forward in the beginning.
We are all creatures of habit. It might be hard for us to
attract customers to a new restaurant. We have come up with a marketing plan
sure to get our name out there. 
How is
Chris going to run a catering business and a restaurant? He has enlisted the
help from people he has worked with over the past three years. He has the
support of trusted individuals that he knows can execute food and service to
his high standards. 
Ways You Can Help
Please donate to help make Pork & Pickles BBQ a reality!  If you
want to help, but don't have extra cash you still have a way. Please spread the
word about our campaign on social media, tell your friends and family, and come
visit us when we open!

story:
Zovren Nitro Brews needs your help to feature the best nitro cold brew coffee from local, independent brewers on our solar-powered Nitro-on-tap mobile vending cart at festivals and events across California. 

Declaring sovereignty is a courageous action in our franchise-dominated beverage industry and we are proud to be supporting these beverage craftsman delivering the best nitro-infused cold drinks possible, starting with the finest nitro cold brew coffee we can find! 



Our love of attending festival events (especially music festivals!) led us to a major realization that something crucial was missing - good coffee. We have found that many events have no coffee vendors and if they do, usually features the standard espresso and hot coffee. This is unacceptable! Coffee is an essential part of our daily lives and we are passionately devoted to sharing the best of coffee culture with everyone. 

Zovren Nitro Brews is happening regardless of the campaign's success but we would love your help to get us there faster! Your generous contributions will help us get our solar-powered mobile vending cart featuring the best independent nitro cold brew coffee on tap to all your favorite festivals and events in California. 

Why Nitro Cold Brew Coffee?
The first time Co-Founder Kevin Waid tried cold brew coffee (at the insistence of Co-Founder Jourdan Waid) the experience instantly changed the way he viewed coffee. The cold brew process eliminates certain compounds allowing for a smoother, less acidic coffee than hot brewed. The introduction of nitro cold brew added a whole new layer to the experience - even literally with the foamy head many might confuse for a stout beer. Infusing an already great cold brew coffee with nitrogen delivers a velvety and slightly sweeter result without the need for milk and sugar. Nitrogen also provides the pressurization to deliver the brews from the kegs to the taps, creating the foamy head. Think you don't like black coffee? Nitro cold brew coffee is likely to change your mind! 

Market Strategy & Growth

Zovren Nitro Brews will serve nitro cold brew coffee from local cafes committed to delivering the best cold brew blends possible. We have a couple brewers ready to go and eager to provide us their unique creations to share with everyone!

Our initial focus will be on special events such as music festivals, food & drink festivals, street fairs, fundraisers, farmers markets, and catering for various private events like weddings, corporate events, and birthdays. Once we have more events than we can handle alone, our goal is to add additional carts and employees to serve at every event we can.  

We will also be providing business coffee services to various companies for their employees and clients because we know all to well how important coffee is to a productive workplace. Zovren Nitro Brews will install a Nitro-on-tap cold brew kegerator in their business and periodically deliver fresh kegs of their chosen cold brew. Nitro cold brew coffee on tap at the office? Yes please!


Our custom solar-powered Nitro-on-tap mobile vending cart pours the brews utilizing a draft keg system very similar to what you see at any bar. The key difference is using nitrogen gas instead of CO2 for the kegs and delivery to the taps. 
Main design features:
- Refrigerated main compartment is hidden within the outer shell that resembles our Zovren Nitro Brews emblem. Capacity to hold three 5-gallon kegs and nitrogen tank connected to a stainless steel tap tower for consistent cold drinks throughout the event. 
- 150w solar panel and battery pack to support the eco-friendly and mobile concept. Many events don't provide electricity and a generator is beyond unappealing in most environments. Silent, renewable solar power is the answer! 
- Dry storage compartment for our eco-friendly, biodegradable serving products to help reduce our footprint and influence a standard for responsible mobile vending.
- Small sink and tank to satisfy health department requirements 
- Custom LED totem towering over the cart flying a Zovren Nitro Brews logo flag to make finding us easy. Our logo is more than just a random design, can you find each letter of Zovren? One hint, the O is the center diamond. 

We have set a fundraising goal of $10,000 to bring our dream to reality.
Below is exactly how the money will be used:
  • Finalize our solar nitro-on-tap mobile vending cart
  • Coffee! Nitro Cold Brew Coffee Kegs for the initial events
  • Professional Signs & Marketing materials
  • Business license & Health Permit fees (really adds up when every city AND county requires a separate license!) 
  • Vendor fees for each event
  • Eco-friendly serving products (cups, straws, lids, napkins, etc)
  • Secure storage for equipment between events

When we exceed our funding goal, we plan to use the additional funds for:

  • Increased marketing such as free coffee happy hours and unique giveaways
  • Host a charity event benefiting animal rescue/adoption
  • Develop simple app for rewards program and event updates
  • Expand our menu options to include nitro-infused Tea & Juice! (Yes, nitro juice is as good as it sounds!)
  • Build an additional nitro-on-tap mobile cart enabling us to be at more events 

In return for your generous contributions, we have put together some really cool rewards you can actually use! Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram for updates and a personal shoutout thanking you for your contribution!! We cannot make this possible without your help and want to reward everyone - regardless of donation amount!  

(More perk details with pics coming soon!!)


Jourdan Waid graduated Belmont University with a degree in Business and has always had an entrepreneurial spirit as she is self driven and is full of great ideas. She has professional management and barista experience and is a pro social media strategist. In addition to being beyond passionate about coffee, she loves music, traveling, and adventure. Jourdan has a giving heart and enjoys participating and hosting charity events like beach cleanups and animal rescue efforts. Jourdan always has smile on her face and has a talent for brightening the day of everyone she interacts with.

Kevin Waid is also a Belmont University graduate with a degree in Business and Entreprenuership. Kevin started working at an early age and has a thorough understanding of how to successfully run a business. He is a sales extraodinaire and marketing pro with extensive professional experience. His curiosity drives him to find out how things work and will no doubt become an inventor in his lifetime. In his spare time he loves playing at the beach and extreme sports like skateboarding and snowboarding. Kevin has the ability to easily explain things simply and loves to teach others, enriching the community he serves on a daily basis.

                                           

Koki Waid is a local celebrity and by far the cutest member of the team. He is a marketing guru, making people smile everywhere he goes. Koki enjoys long runs on the beach, apples, and chewing up everything in sight. No one can draw a crowd like Koki! 

Kevin and Jourdan have both left behind the well-paying world of corporate life in pursuit of their entreprenuerial dreams. While this can be a daunting decision, they have complete trust in their experience and talents that got them here and has provided all the confidence they needed to manifest their dreams into reality. This is where you come in, to help them overcome the initial funding hurdles and backup their confidence with real capital. 

Zovren Nitro Brews was started with very little cash and and relying solely on grassroots marketing. This is why we need you! Supporting us is easy whether you contribute cash to take advantage of our reward perks or simply want to support our dream by spreading our story. 

We understand that not everyone can contribute money to Zovren Nitro Brews but you can still help our campaign tremendously by sharing with your friends, family, and co-workers. Indiegogo makes it very easy to share so please take a few seconds and send the campaign link to someone you know that is passionate about access to delicious coffee and helping good people. Reposting this on your social media has a bigger impact than you may realize!

story:
In March 2015, category 5 Cyclone Pam destroyed their homes, environment and water systems. Now, the people of Vanuatu are in danger of dying of thirst if they don’t get access to fresh drinking water. What’s more, El Niño conditions prevail across the Pacific (learn more about El Niño at http://www.unocha.org/el-nino). The impacts of this drought will be varied but they include water shortages, crop failures, food shortages, and an increase in the occurrence of disease. Our focus here is water shortages as “Water is Life.” 

This campaign aims to provide a sustainable solution to a severe shortage of drinking water, primarily in Vanuatu but by extension in the entire South Pacific region.

We believe the answer lies in a low cost, low tech, solar powered desalination process called solar distillation. You can make drinking water from seawater using little more than sunshine, through solar distillation. And there is no lack of sunshine and seawater in the South Pacific! This is a small but important part of a much larger problem, ensuring that everyone on the planet has access to clean water. For more info please read on...

Hi, my name is David Stein. I have spent the last 18 years working to improve the quality of life for communities in rural Vanuatu through the application of renewable energy. My credentials and passion for leading this particular project stem from:

  • Extensive experience with the technology.
  • Donor affirmation: finalist in two World Bank Development Marketplace competitions (2006 and 2009), both for solar powered distillation projects.
  • Commitment at all levels: more than 18 years of experience working ‘on the ground’ in Vanuatu; some as a volunteer, some in the NGO/not for profit sector, and some in the private sector.
  • Community involvement: I am by longstanding association part of a local ni-Vanuatu family and have an extensive local network of people and institutions.
  • I am fluent in Bislama, the lingua-franca of Vanuatu.

“Isn’t it funny that an island, a place surrounded by water, should ever know a water shortage? Maybe we will truly know paradise when we can change salt water into drinking water. Humankind has been dreaming this dream throughout history. Our early efforts to desalt seawater were frustrating. Our recent efforts, though successful, are typically expensive.

However, we can desalinate seawater using little more than sunshine with an ever-improving process called solar distillation. Solar distillation works on the principles of evaporation and condensation and mimics the way rain is made. Input water can be seawater and/or dirty water while the output water is fresh and very pure, like rain water.”


There is nothing more dear to us than water. In the developing world, the lack of adequate drinking water is a leading cause of sickness and death. In fact, access to clean water is one of the most severe problems in the world today.  For an ABC story that describes the urgency and severity of this drought please follow this link http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-11-03/young-children-hardest-hit-in-vanuatu-drought-driven-by-el-nino/6906560

In rural Vanuatu, as in other Pacific Island countries, much of the population is entirely dependent on harvesting rainwater to drink. This works well enough in “normal times” but climate change has made these times anything but normal, especially for Pacific Islanders.

The region is currently experiencing severe drought conditions caused by an El Niño event (follow this link to learn more about El Nino http://www.unocha.org/el-nino), made worse by climate change. This means that in many cases the water tanks are already empty and the people are thirsty.

However, there is a low cost, low tech, solar powered desalination solution to the access to drinking water problem. It is called solar distillation. Solar distillation can make drinking water from seawater. And there is plenty of seawater in the Pacific Islands. I believe that the solar distillation of seawater may provide the perfect solution for ‘access to drinking water’ issues in coastal communities in Vanuatu, and throughout the Pacific.

The basic principles of solar water distillation are simple yet effective, as distillation replicates the way nature makes rain. The sun's energy heats water to the point of evaporation. As the water evaporates, water vapor rises, condensing on the glass surface for collection. This process removes impurities such as salts and heavy metals as well as eliminating microbiological organisms. The end result is water cleaner than the purest rainwater. The still is a passive solar distiller that only needs sunshine to operate. There are no moving parts to wear out.

By donating to this campaign you'd be helping to find sustainable solutions to one of the biggest problems facing humanity today;access to clean water.  Furthermore, Vanuatu is a prime place to start the project because 1) the need is very real and 2) the scale is manageable.
The issue is acute.  Without clean drinking water many other developmental issues become secondary...gender equality, education, political corruption...because...  without water, people die. 

We are hoping to raise USD 50,000.00 which will allow us to design and install fully automated solar distillation plants in three rural communities in Vanuatu.  Specifically we will:

  • Design appropriate solutions.  (i.e. consider each recipient community           individually, so that an appropriate amount of output water is produced, pumps are sized properly, and adequate storage facilities are provided for.) 
  • Specify and source suitable materials and equipment from reputable suppliers and get them to the work sites.  (Logistics in an island country can be tricky!  Local experience and standing is invaluable.) 
  • Ensure that installations are made to a very high standard.
  • Develop appropriate monitoring protocols in collaboration with the communities.  (Are the end users happy with the technological solution?  Are they willing to continue using it?)
  • Develop training materials and deliver training to recipient communities on the operation and maintenance (which is minimal) of their systems, so that operation and maintenance can be done without the need for external support.  (Local O & M is key to the sustainability of the project!)
  • Develop training materials and deliver trainings to local personnel on all of the above topics, so that this project can be replicated at other sites with a minimum of external input.  (I like this work :-) but an objective is for this to become a local initiative.)

15+ recognition
Contributors who give USD 15 or more will receive a "One Solution Comes Up Every Morning" bumper sticker so that they can show the world their commitment to renewable energy and its role in changing the world.
30+ recognition
We will happily give a music video/documentary of the project to contributors who give USD 30 or more.  This will not only immortalize the project in song, you will be able to say "I made this project happen" when sharing the video with friends and family.
50+ recognition
Contributors who give USD 50 or more will receive both the bumper sticker and the video as a special thank you gift from us.

If we don’t reach our goal and are unable to work on solar distillation at any scale, we will donate the funds we have raised to agencies doing humanitarian relief work in  Vanuatu such as the Red Cross, CARE, Oxfam, Save the Children, and UNICEF, and account for these funds on this website.

Aid agencies are predicting that the current drought will affect millions of lives in the region. They stress that access to clean water is essential for life. So be assured, every contribution will have a huge impact! It will put us a step closer to ensuring that everyone on the planet has access to clean water.

We were very successful with our “Lighting Vanuatu” project (for which we won an Energy Globe award http://www.energyglobe.info/awards/national/awd...) We introduced solar lighting to thousands of households across Vanuatu.  And in so doing we changed lives! We are confident that this initiative will have an even greater impact, as “Water is Life.”

We understand it can be difficult sometimes to make a financial contribution, but please also help us spread the word; let your friends and family and everyone on your social media network know about this campaign.

Besides sharing this on your social media networks, please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

*(The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, Samuel Taylor Coleridge)

15+ recognition Contributors who give USD 15 or more will receive a "One Solution Comes Up Every Morning" bumper sticker so that they can show the world their commitment to renewable energy and its role in changing the world.30+ recognitionWe will happily give a music video/documentary of the project to contributors who give USD 30 or more.  This will not only immortalize the project in song, you will be able to say "I made this project happen" when sharing the video with friends and family.50+ recognition Contributors who give USD 50 or more will receive both the bumper sticker and the video as a special thank you gift from us.If we don’t reach our goal and are unable to work on solar distillation at any scale, we will donate the funds we have raised to agencies doing humanitarian relief work in  Vanuatu such as the Red Cross, CARE, Oxfam, Save the Children, and UNICEF, and account for these funds on this website.Aid agencies are predicting that the current drought will affect millions of lives in the region. They stress that access to clean water is essential for life. So be assured, every contribution will have a huge impact! It will put us a step closer to ensuring that everyone on the planet has access to clean water.We were very successful with our “Lighting Vanuatu” project (for which we won an Energy Globe award http://www.energyglobe.info/awards/national/awd...) We introduced solar lighting to thousands of households across Vanuatu.  And in so doing we changed lives! We are confident that this initiative will have an even greater impact, as “Water is Life.”We understand it can be difficult sometimes to make a financial contribution, but please also help us spread the word; let your friends and family and everyone on your social media network know about this campaign.Besides sharing this on your social media networks, please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!*(The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, Samuel Taylor Coleridge)

story:
I am currently working with a team of volunteers on Lesbos island, Greece, where thousands of people are arriving everyday from Turkey, Iraq, Afghanistan and Syria. Having survived the dangerous ocean crossing they are subjected to inhumane conditions in the registration camps, where during 4 days of thunderstorms thousands of families with children were sleeping in a mud river with no shelter. 

Most arrive with tiny children and absolutely nothing but the dirty clothes on their backs. They need food, water, shoes and clothing for the 2 day walk that they will need to make once they arrive on the island.

Read more here.

A small amount of money can help massively, we need to buy tarpaulins and tents and provide these people with basic shelter and food. Every penny goes to aid the refugees with basic resources of food, water and clothing to continue their journey into Europe.

Winter is swiftly approaching and the situation will only get worse.They’re now living in tents with little access to basic sanitation and water no one should have to live in this way. They have been forced to flee their homes, comforts and families in search of safety and security. 


Your donations can make a lot of difference to their current situation, please support this cause by donating.

story:
We have a way to feed the hungry. And yes, it's fishy.

Imagine a system where plants and fish feed each other and both, feed people. And, what if this type of agriculture existed without doing damage to the environment and, did not threaten human health?

Here at Sustainable Integrated Farms International, we have developed a self-sustaining system using aquaponics and hydroponics. Aquaponics is the integration of recirculating aquaculture production with hydroponic plant production. Simply put, aquaponics is a system for farming fish and plants together in a mutually beneficial cycle. Fish produce waste, which is a great fertilizer for plants, and the plants take in all of the nutrients and in turn purify the water, which is good for the fish.

At SIFarmsintl, we have created a closed system where plants and fish feed each other, and both feed people. The foods are locally grown, fresh, natural and organic. No pesticides. No Herbicides. The entire process is chemical free.

As part of a strategic partnership with St Vincent de Paul, we have built a 60 x 90 foot commercial size aquaponic/hydroponic facility that grows food and hope locally. We call it, The Hoop House. During the last 12 months, The Hoop House has become somewhat of a landmark. It is used as a learning ground for Arizona State University students interested in alternative farming methods. It has become a destination for the curious and like-minded individuals who see the future in hydroponics and aquaponics as a sustainable agriculture and want a peek at what that reality looks like. For others, it is quite different. The large greenhouse, amidst dilapidated buildings, half-torn-concrete structures, dirt and dust filled inner city streets, represents hope and food security.

For St Vincent de Paul and Sustainable Integrated Farms International, the last 12 months represents successful and rewarding beta testing. We have created a balanced ecosystem that is cost efficient, climate resilient, eliminates waste and produces consistent, healthful, nutritious foods locally – and where a portion of both products and proceeds goes to hunger programs.

“There are approximately 468,000 families in need in Arizona alone. Families who are struggling with hunger and poverty. The partnership with SIFarms gives us (St Vincent de Paul) one more channel to help families in need", says David Smith, Director of Urban Development at St Vincent de Paul. This partnership, along with 6000 volunteers throughout the valley, make the possibility of future table service of fresh, healthful food, and the ability to protect human health and our environment...a reality.



We are in the fight against hunger and we need your help to make it happen.

As you can see from the video above, the basics are done. But it is not enough. If we are going to continue to feed the hungry in our community and make this system turnkey for other charities to utilize, we will need your help.

How Your Contribution Will Help

  • Covering: First and foremost we need to keep the Hoop House safe. We need twin walled covering material that can withstand our monsoons and provide protection from the extreme heat, wind, and other elements.
  • Shade Cloths: Shade fabric helps protects plants from direct sunlight and offers superior ventilation, improves light diffusion, reflects summer heat and will keep the Hoop House cooler.
  • Fish tanks: We need additional tanks for livestock. We are adding different species and will soon use shrimp in addition to tilapia. But we need to keep the species separated and make sure they continue to thrive.
  • Food for livestock
  • Seeding boards for vegetables and greens
  • Blowers to ensure the water cycles through
  • Land: We need additional greenhouses. A new a 60 x 90 foot commercial size aquaponic/hydroponic facility can cost between $50,000 and $75,000.

We invite you to be part of the solution.
Help eradicate hunger.

*Help us get the word out.  

*Know of anyone whose expertise or talent can lend a helping hand during future projects...send them our way.

*Donations? — no amount is too small and very much appreciated.

We have been offered 1 acre of land on which to build more greenhouses.  Won’t you help us help others?  We may even name a greenhouse after you.

A heartfelt THANK YOU to all who have given their time and support and to those about to make a difference in feeding the hungry.

-Johnny Vasquez (New Stitch a Day/Argyle Sheep)

"I am so attracted to the drama that can be achieved with Tjockt/ThickandFinn yarns. I love how much can be creatively said with just one big, beautiful stitch. The fibers are sweetly soft to the touch and glide gracefully along the smooth wood of the companies large needles which are sized to be just right for their extra super bulky fibers. Having designed cowls in both Fat Fairy Merino & Tussah Silk and Fat & Fluffy Merino, I am looking forward to working with more of Tjockt/ThickandFinn's yarns."
Talitha Kuomi (Talitha Kuomi Designs)

FAQ'S

How can I contact you? 

You can message us through your Indiegogo account, by leaving a comment (either privately or publicly) or by emailing us at heretohelpyou@thickandfinn.com

We usually respond with a few hours or faster :)

When will I receive my order?

We will start shipping orders in November and all orders will be shipped (leaving our warehouse) by Dec 7th so you'll be sure to receive it in time for the Holidays!

What is your return policy?

EXCHANGES:  Because we only sell products with the very best quality we are confident you will love them too.  If however, you need to exchange an item for other merchandise from our store you may do so by shipping it to us within 14 days of your purchase.  The item will need to be in salable condition and while we are covering the cost of shipping to you, the cost of shipping back to us will need to be covered by you.

RETURNS:  Before items are shipped, returns can be made through Indiegogo. After you have received your items you have a 14 day return window.   The item will need to be in salable condition and while we are covering the cost of shipping to you, the cost of shipping back to us will need to be covered by you.

What can I do if there is a break in the yarn?

Our yarns are crafted of the finest quality 100% merino with care in Finland.  The Finnish take great pride in their work and do everything to assure their products are made to the highest of standards.  Still, when using only natural wool, variations in thickness and on very rare occasions a break in the yarn can occur.  If this should happen, you can either tie the ends together (and because the fabric created by fat yarns is super thick, imperfections are easily hidden) or you can use a felting tool to prick the fibers in the ends joining them together.

Always fee free to drop us a line with any questions or concerns you may have!

Do you ship worldwide?

Yes!  But free shipping is valid for within the United States only.  Shipping charges for all other countries are added at check out.

In fact merino wool is so soft, it doesn't itch.  So you can 
wrap your little ones in a hand-made hug of warmth with confidence.
And no expensive dry-cleaning bills to worry about.  Just hand or delicate wash and lay flat to dry.



**Message us with your choice from the color chart above**
Remember, only TJOCKT is pre-washed and slightly felted so your project will stand up to wear & friction as well as winter winds.


Time and quantity are running out...so CONTRIBUTE NOW

-Patterns 4 different ones to choose from!-500g Skein of TJOCKT Fat & Sassy 100% merino

Super fast project (an hour or two for most).

Super cute & super warm gift.  Love it!
You want your adorable scarf to last. 

 So choose TJOCKT from ThIck and Finn
to prevent the shrinking & pills but keep the fun and warmth !


In fact merino wool is so soft, it doesn't itch.  So you can 
wrap your little ones in a hand-made hug of warmth with confidence.
And no expensive dry-cleaning bills to worry about.  Just hand or delicate wash and lay flat to dry.



Time and quantity are running out...so CONTRIBUTE NOW





Fat & Sassy Throw Blanket Kit


FREE SHIP 

Small/$403 LevelMedium/$939 Level


(Click on this perk in the column on the right)

Luxe Knits your holiday guests will rave about!
Small2.5 Kg Fat & Sassy 100% merino (31" x 43")
Medium
6.3Kg Fat & Sassy 100% merino (51"x 66")
Kits include 25mm (US 50) Natural Wood Needles
**Message us with your choice from the color chart above**
You'll love choosing from 4 patterns for an heirloom blanket that will provide fond & snuggly memories for the whole family.  Relax, unlike roving or some fat yarns which fall apart under friction, TJOCKT Fat & Sassy from Thick and Finn can keep on comforting your loved ones without excessive pilling or shrinking.

The secret is the pre-washed slightly felted exterior.  Don't be fooled by cheaper imitations which won't last even one season.

In fact merino wool is so soft, it doesn't itch.  So you can 
wrap your little ones in a hand-made hug of warmth with confidence.
And no expensive dry-cleaning bills to worry about.  Just hand or delicate wash and lay flat to dry.

 Although it's a super quick project (a few hours for most), especially compared to traditional knitting, you'll get so many hours of enjoyment  both creating and using this luxurious throw!


QUESTIONS?  MESSAGE US ANYTIME--WE'RE GLAD TO HELP!



"Tjockt yarn is, in my opinion, the highest quality yarn you can use for quick and beautiful knitting and crochet projects. It’s soft but durable and the color palatte is a great mix of classic and modern.”-Johnny Vasquez (New Stitch a Day/Argyle Sheep)


"I am so attracted to the drama that can be achieved with Tjockt/ThickandFinn yarns. I love how much can be creatively said with just one big, beautiful stitch. The fibers are sweetly soft to the touch and glide gracefully along the smooth wood of the companies large needles which are sized to be just right for their extra super bulky fibers. Having designed cowls in both Fat Fairy Merino & Tussah Silk and Fat & Fluffy Merino, I am looking forward to working with more of Tjockt/ThickandFinn's yarns."Talitha Kuomi (Talitha Kuomi Designs)


FAQ'S
How can I contact you? 
You can message us through your Indiegogo account, by leaving a comment (either privately or publicly) or by emailing us at heretohelpyou@thickandfinn.com
We usually respond with a few hours or faster :)
When will I receive my order?
We will start shipping orders in November and all orders will be shipped (leaving our warehouse) by Dec 7th so you'll be sure to receive it in time for the Holidays!
What is your return policy?
EXCHANGES:  Because we only sell products with the very best quality we are confident you will love them too.  If however, you need to exchange an item for other merchandise from our store you may do so by shipping it to us within 14 days of your purchase.  The item will need to be in salable condition and while we are covering the cost of shipping to you, the cost of shipping back to us will need to be covered by you.
RETURNS:  Before items are shipped, returns can be made through Indiegogo. After you have received your items you have a 14 day return window.   The item will need to be in salable condition and while we are covering the cost of shipping to you, the cost of shipping back to us will need to be covered by you.
What can I do if there is a break in the yarn?
Our yarns are crafted of the finest quality 100% merino with care in Finland.  The Finnish take great pride in their work and do everything to assure their products are made to the highest of standards.  Still, when using only natural wool, variations in thickness and on very rare occasions a break in the yarn can occur.  If this should happen, you can either tie the ends together (and because the fabric created by fat yarns is super thick, imperfections are easily hidden) or you can use a felting tool to prick the fibers in the ends joining them together.
Always fee free to drop us a line with any questions or concerns you may have!
Do you ship worldwide?
Yes!  But free shipping is valid for within the United States only.  Shipping charges for all other countries are added at check out.

heretohelpyou@thickandfinn.com

DID YOU SEE OUR VIDEO?  
-AT THE TOP OF THIS PAGE-
LEARN MORE ABOUT US AND OUR DREAM
--WATCH IT NOW!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nicole Dennis, I live in a small town in Oregon with my husband and daughter surrounded by the beauty of our small farm. Every since I found out that I was pregnant I decided to live my life in a healthier way, from the inside out. Elderberry Boost was a product that we needed when we were all sick and I refused to buy the typical, chemical filled cold medicine. After buying one bottle of over priced, sugary elderberry syrup I realized that I could make a better version. Soon I found a local source for wild elderberries and began creating my own unique recipe. After some trial and error I had created my delicious Elderberry Boost.  Elderberry Boost is a delicious, all natural herbal tonic that helps to support the immune system as well as helping to shorten the duration of cold like symptoms. It is made with local, wild-crafted elderberries, local raw honey, organic raw apple cider vinegar, organic lemon juice, organic echinacea root and herb, organic stinging nettle leaf, organic cinnamon, organic cloves and ginger.  The positive feedback that I consistently receive is what motivates me to continue this business and take it to the next level. ( You can see the reviews and more at www.facebook.com/yesitspure1 )

With your help in funding this campaign I will be able to raise the necessary funds to create a full production space for my business. My business has been growing for the last few years and it is on the verge of getting a lot bigger! In order to become successful and grow further I need to be able to produce a larger quantity of Elderberry Boost in an efficient way. There are a few larger Oregon based stores that are interested in carrying Elderberry Boost. I am hesitant to follow through with them because I know that I can not keep up with the quantities they will need. 

This business allows me to create an amazing product that people everywhere need. Colds and sickness are a fact of life and being able to stay healthy is necessary so that you don't have to miss work, school or fun! I want to have my product available online and in stores so anyone can benefit from Elderberry Boost.

All contributions will go towards helping my business to have more production equipment. If my goal is met I will be able to create an entire production area solely for making Elderberry Boost. The area would be large enough that I could have a few people working with me as well. This is something that I really need but don't have the space for now. The funds raised from this campaign will also help with market research, hiring someone to do marketing and advertising, and designing new graphics to go along with the new business name that is scheduled to launch in January 2016. My current business name is Yes It's Pure and the new name that is scheduled to launch next year is, Abiqua Naturals.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for this campaign is $30,000. Although this may seem like a large amount, the majority of it will go towards creating a production kitchen. We have a large shop and my wonderful husband has agreed to section off a portion of it for my business. There will need to be permits, walls, roofing, insulation, flooring, electrical, plumbing, windows, ventilation and that's just the structure! After having a licensed contractor come out we realized that this part alone will cost right around $20,000 to get the job done properly. The remaining $10,000 will be used to purchase all of the interior kitchen items as well as helping with marketing and design work. In the kitchen I will need to have the basic requirements to get licensed as well as the specific equipment that I need. This includes multiple large sinks, large propane stove, propane tank, stock pots/ steam kettles, refrigeration, a large dehydrator and more.  Industrial kitchen equipment is very expensive and we will do our best to purchase refurbished whenever possible. 

At every level of contribution you will have the opportunity to receive amazing perks. If you love my business idea but can't make a large contribution please know that even a small donation is helpful. One of the fantastic perks is a year supply of Elderberry Boost delivered to you every month, along with a surprise product each month. You can keep this for yourself or share with others! Another fantastic perk is a Yes It's Pure party at your house for you and 3 friends. I will show you how to make an amazing organic sugar scrub that you can personalize with the scents you like, and you'll also get Elderberry Boost and other products for every person. There are many other perks at a variety of levels so be sure to check them all out!

If my goal of $30,000 is not met by the end of the campaign you can be sure that your contribution will still be extremely beneficial to my business. All funds that are raised will help purchase some production equipment and larger sinks that I can use in my current work space. If you're wondering why I don't just keep using this space- well, it simply is not big enough for me to produce a larger quantity of product. This is a licensed secondary kitchen in my home and it is great for allowing me to make a few dozen bottles of Elderberry Boost at a time, but it is a tight space and is not adequate in many ways.

The Impact

This project will allow everyone to have access to the best Elderberry Boost you can find. Even if you are not local you will be able to purchase online and have 1 bottle or a dozen bottles shipped right to you! My business has proven successful over the last few years and has gained a loyal following. I am confident that Elderberry Boost needs to be widely available in the near future. 

Risks & Challenges

This business is not without its challenges. As I grow and make larger batches using new methods, it will take more trial and error to produce larger quantity while maintaining the same quality that my customers have come to value. I am confident that this is only a small hurdle and with a few test batches I will be able to master my recipe and method to create an amazing and consistent product, every time.

 Knowing that I have gone from making small batches in my kitchen, canned in mason jars, to something that is now available in a handful of stores is what gives me the drive to keep expanding. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can donate monetarily but there are still other ways that you can help. You can share my Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and other social media outlets. Tell your family, friends and co-workers about this awesome business. Keep sharing, it all helps! Trust me when I say that I am extremely grateful for any and all support that I receive!

story:
You would be surprised to know that there is only one  USDA certified Organic restaurant in the U.S. 

With your help Fresh Break will become the second restaurant in the nation to obtain a USDA certification and the first in Florida.

By certifying our restaurant as Organic (as opposed to just using certain Organic ingredients on our menu) we are making a statement on the need for food operations to overlook the integrity of their purveyors and processes. Thus, we will create an environment that is less damaging to our health and our planet´s, and more conducive toward well-being and harmony.

By supporting Fresh Break´s certification process and healthy lifestyle campaigns, you will foster a domino effect that will permeate the food industry and society.


                                                      


 Your contribution will help us fund: 

  • USDA Organic certification process
  • Our “Eat Well-Live Well” Project, which will promote awareness on the benefits of a healthy lifestyle at schools and other venues 
  • Plans to expand operations to other states in the U.S.

                 

                                                      

                                                            

      How we got here...

Allow me to tell you a little bit more about myself:

 Growing up in Mexico, family meals were true productions.  My family prided itself on the effort placed in each culinary confection, where Latin, Middle Eastern and Asian influences converged.  As I grew up, I came to understand how eating influences our health.  So began a lifelong quest for delicious recipes that would motivate everyone to stick to healthy eating. I made it my mission to create a wide variety of tasteful and exciting recipes made with natural ingredients.  

                                               

       Sara Mizrahi, Fresh Break´s Founder                 Jacobo Tussie, Chef

 

                 

 Moisés Tussie, Founder.                                    

Challenges and Antidotes

Sure, we expect to face some challenges along the way. But I am confident that the great team of Chefs, restaurateurs and caterers involved in this project is exceedingly qualified to overcome these hurdles. They are: 

Moises Tussie. Founder and CEO.

Moises is a prominent businessman, experienced in restaurant ventures. His passion for customer service and promoting healthy lifestyles, lead him to support the creation of Fresh Break, a project he strongly believes will benefit society. 

Jacobo Tussie. Chef.

Jacobo is a talented Culinary Arts student at the prestigious Mariano Moreno Culinary Institute, on his way to obtain his Chef Diploma. His fresh take on new trends and flavors brings an invaluable element of surprise to all of our dishes.

Be a part of the Fresh Break project and join our amazing team of Indiegogo backers.

With your support, our flagship Fresh Break restaurant in Florida, will become a reality, and then be able to expand to other states in the U.S.

Other ways to help:

  • Spread the news about our restaurant to your friends and family, and tell them why this is important to you.
  • Share this campaign through email, Facebook, Twitter, and other forms of social media
  • "Like" us on Facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
We are really grateful to everyone willing to embark with us in this journey!

story:
Thank you for your time! Unfortunately our partner Lisa Marie Morgan has decided it best for her family to step away from the project right now so we will be unable to continue at the moment. We will be contacting those who donated already to get you refunds. Thanks for your support!


Our Vision

Our vision is to create a community of moms, wherever they are in their journey, by building a Free Standing Birth Center, Boutique, and Family Resource Center in East Multnomah County!

Who We Are

We are three moms whose passion and businesses center on families!

Lisa Marie Morgan is a mommy of three. She is a Doula and Dancing for Birth Instructor. She is also on her way to becoming a Midwife.

Robin Murphy is a mommy of two. She is a Baby Signing Time Instructor, a Volunteer for a local Non-Profit helping mothers and babies, and on her way to becoming an IBCLC (Lactation Consultant).

Felicia Starr Pattersonn is a mommy of two. She is the Owner and Creator of Mommy's Milk & More! 

Making our dream of creating a space to support families a reality is a major privilege that we are truly grateful for!

Our background in serving families during their parenthood journey, from birth through childhood, has made it evident to us that our area lacks the community support that is easily found in larger cities and is desperately needed.

What We Need & What You Get

There are so many things needed to open up a business, let alone a whole community center! We have already done most of the leg work and have secured much of the things needed to open this center.

We are asking for your help to raise $30,000.00 which will go towards:

• Approximately $1000 will be used for licenses and fees.

• Approximately $10,000 will pay for first and last month's rent to get us in the door.

• Approximately $3,500 will buy beautiful waterbirth tubs for our two birth suites as well as the associated plumbing costs.

• Approximately $10,500 will help us pay for costs associated with the space build out, equipment, and permits to set up the birth center.

• Approximately $5000 will help us pay for costs associated with the federal accreditation with the Commission for Accreditation of Birth Centers

• Regardless of what we make during this campaign, after fees are paid, 100% will go directly towards securing our site in East County, our build-out, and initial start-up expenses.

To express our immeasurable thanks, we are collaborating with local businesses to offer you some amazing perks! Check back often as new perks will be added!

The Impact

We already found the perfect space and are working towards getting the funds together to make it happen!

This space is all that we have been looking for and would allow us to have:

A Birth Center comprised of 2 Full Birth Suites (both of which would have their own access to a beautiful outdoor space), a Family Waiting Area, A Kitchen and Table, and even a nice Sitting Room for your midwife to do her charting and give you some space when needed.

A Boutique that features local, handmade goods, natural toys, and possibly even a small selection of consigned children’s clothes to make life easier and get your shopping done in one spot!

This amazing space will also give us a Class Room for various Enrichment Classes, such as: Mommy & Me Sign & Play, Dancing for Birth, and Community Classes like: Cloth Diapering, Babywearing, Whole Food Nutrition, and SO much more! We would also like to open this space up to local mom groups in the community to use as a comfortable meeting space.

As moms ourselves, we intend to really focus on women helping women.

Local business moms who are in need of space to conduct meetings and other things would be able to use our space at a minimal charge to help grow their business.

We will have many free events to build community and create a warm and comforting space such as Mom Morning Coffee Meet-ups, Mom’s Night Outs, New Parent Meet-ups, and More!

Risks & Challenges

Along with all of the wonderful benefits this resource would bring to our community, there are of course challenges that we will face.
Our most concerning challenge is the risk we face in starting this Center with large amounts of personal debt. We are trying to think outside the box and to bring the community in to help prevent this problem.
If, after we have reached out to the community we will serve, we are unable to raise enough money to fully fund this fantastic resource, we will then continue to conventional financing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our Center is meant to be a central "gathering place" for women and families to gain the support and information they need on their parenting journey. We will only be as good as the community we serve and we truly value your support.

There are many ways you can help along the way and the MOST HELPFUL would be to spread the word about our vision and share with those around you!

Indiegogo makes sharing so easy and the more people we can get to hear our goals the more likely we are to reach them!

You can also check out our event page on Facebook:

 https://www.facebook.com/events/1711747382387946/

We are beyond excited about this opportunity and we hope you are as well!

• Approximately $10,000 will pay for first and last month's rent to get us in the door.
• Approximately $3,500 will buy beautiful waterbirth tubs for our two birth suites as well as the associated plumbing costs.
• Approximately $10,500 will help us pay for costs associated with the space build out, equipment, and permits to set up the birth center.
• Approximately $5000 will help us pay for costs associated with the federal accreditation with the Commission for Accreditation of Birth Centers
• Regardless of what we make during this campaign, after fees are paid, 100% will go directly towards securing our site in East County, our build-out, and initial start-up expenses.
To express our immeasurable thanks, we are collaborating with local businesses to offer you some amazing perks! Check back often as new perks will be added!
   The Impact

We already found the perfect space and are working towards getting the funds together to make it happen!
This space is all that we have been looking for and would allow us to have:
A Birth Center comprised of 2 Full Birth Suites (both of which would have their own access to a beautiful outdoor space), a Family Waiting Area, A Kitchen and Table, and even a nice Sitting Room for your midwife to do her charting and give you some space when needed.
A Boutique that features local, handmade goods, natural toys, and possibly even a small selection of consigned children’s clothes to make life easier and get your shopping done in one spot!
This amazing space will also give us a Class Room for various Enrichment Classes, such as: Mommy & Me Sign & Play, Dancing for Birth, and Community Classes like: Cloth Diapering, Babywearing, Whole Food Nutrition, and SO much more! We would also like to open this space up to local mom groups in the community to use as a comfortable meeting space.
As moms ourselves, we intend to really focus on women helping women.
Local business moms who are in need of space to conduct meetings and other things would be able to use our space at a minimal charge to help grow their business.
We will have many free events to build community and create a warm and comforting space such as Mom Morning Coffee Meet-ups, Mom’s Night Outs, New Parent Meet-ups, and More!
   Risks & Challenges
Along with all of the wonderful benefits this resource would bring to our community, there are of course challenges that we will face.
Our most concerning challenge is the risk we face in starting this Center with large amounts of personal debt. We are trying to think outside the box and to bring the community in to help prevent this problem.
If, after we have reached out to the community we will serve, we are unable to raise enough money to fully fund this fantastic resource, we will then continue to conventional financing.
    Other Ways You Can Help Our Center is meant to be a central "gathering place" for women and families to gain the support and information they need on their parenting journey. We will only be as good as the community we serve and we truly value your support.
There are many ways you can help along the way and the MOST HELPFUL would be to spread the word about our vision and share with those around you!
Indiegogo makes sharing so easy and the more people we can get to hear our goals the more likely we are to reach them!
You can also check out our event page on Facebook:
 https://www.facebook.com/events/1711747382387946/  We are beyond excited about this opportunity and we hope you are as well!

story:
{Who We Are}

Jenn & Mike are a husband and wife duo who created Pillow & Plaster out of inspiration from women's mobile fashion boutiques around the country. Our spin on the mobile movement is providing St. Louis and surrounding areas affordable, on-trend housewares out of a truck renovated to resemble a room in your home. We believe that it's the little things that make a house a home; from picture frames holding precious memories to that eclectic piece of artwork from a local artist hanging over the mantel.  By contributing to Pillow & Plaster, you will help fund the start-up costs of the business, leading to lower overhead costs. With this, we will be able to bring the savings to you...literally! We can come to your house! If we meet our goal, we will roll out in Spring 2016, but we can't do it without your help.

{What We Need & What You Get}

We're asking for your help in raising $15,000. 

 Here's the breakdown of what we need:

  • $8,000 will purchase & license a Step Van 
  • $4,000 will get it  vinyl-wrapped with our logo
  • $3,000 will cover the cost of building out the cargo area of the truck. This will include installation of a generator, insulation, walls, flooring and displays. 
Any donations we have left over will be put directly back into the business, covering various expenses like shopping bags and fun things, like, insurance on the truck. 
THERE IS SOMETHING IN IT FOR YOU, TOO!
We are offering a wide variety of perks including having your name displayed in our shop, locally produced candles,a private shopping experience for you and your nearest and dearest and even, a lifetime discount (yep, you read that right: lifetime.) Check them all out here -----------> 

{The Impact}

We want to help make St. Louis great by being a small business rooted in its community and contributing to the local economy. We'd also like to be known for helping make STL just a little bit prettier. 

{You Gotta Take Risks to Reap the Reward}

Starting a business from the ground-up is hard, but we're up to the challenge! We have used some of our savings and have a loan lined up for inventory, but our biggest challenge is simply buying and retrofitting a truck. 

Your contribution will make our dream of owning a little roving home decor boutique a reality. And, it'll be really fun too! 

{No Dollars? No Problem!}

We understand that not everyone can contribute in the monetary ways that they would want to (and we would love for you to), but there are other ways to get involved and contribute:
  • Own a business or know someone that does? That's great! As of now, St. Louis city/county laws only allow us to sell on private property. If you know someone that would let us post up at their business, we would love that too!
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

We can't wait to show you the junk in our trunk!

story:
Magpie Custom Creations seeks to raise the profile of sewing and handicrafts as a valid and valuable art form and promote the recycling and re-use of fiber and decorative materials. We currently represent seven independent fiber and jewelry artists and a rotating group of painters and sculptors in our small shop in Cortland, NY. 

I've been given the opportunity to apply for a citywide Microenterprise Grant for Magpie but I must supply 10% equity to have access to the money.  This is where you can help!  Please consider making Magpie's holiday season merry by contributing toward my goal.  

Here is how Microenterprise Grant funds will help my business work smarter and faster:

-an updated and functional computer system to streamline the shop's retail procedures (no more handwritten receipts! Hooray!);

-advertising funds to assist in spreading the word about Magpie’s offerings outside the immediate city of Cortland;

-a dedicated website to drive online sales and outreach (so many of you have asked for this!);

-additional machinery and supplies (i.e. sewing machines, sergers, tables, scissors, thread, fabric, manuals, etc.) so we can start holding classes;

-funds to hire a part-time administrative assistant/bookkeeper to assist with business operations; thus freeing up the seamstress to create more work;

-ability to hire several part-time assistants to help on the shop floor and teach classes.

Though business is quite robust,  I'm still just covering day to day expenses. Right now, all business operations and custom services, repairs, and alterations at Magpie are performed by me. Please help me share the wealth with other talented individuals, and give Magpie a chance to continue growing, thriving, and expanding!

Hello, my name is Darby Harcourt, and I am a Junior at La Serna High School in Whittier, California.  The recent 7.9 magnitude earthquake in Nepal was devastating to the country.  My mom, Sarita Amatya Harcourt, was born and raised in Nepal. My grandparents (Baa & Maa) live in Kathmandu with all my other relatives.  About 10 years ago, I visited Nepal and still have fond memories of the country. The picture you see is of my siblings, my mom, and I in Patan Durbar Square. Those temples seen behind us are now all gone.  It is such a tragedy, but the Nepalese people are strong and will overcome this horrible situation.  I want to do something for Nepal and I am campaigning to raise money for basic essentials that are needed. They need basic items like a toothbrush, toothpaste, hand sanitizer, comb, hair brush, wipes and sanitary products.   My goal is to raise $10,000 to help the victims of this unforeseen tragic event.  I hope you will help me reach my goal and more.  I am scheduled to go to Nepal in June and hope to take your generous contributions with me to the Nepalese people.  Thank you and NAMASTE!

story:
We are Chris and Fiona Wade and two years ago we bought Le Delice, a Cafe/Restaurant in the French Alps; our dream had become a reality.

Two things quickly became apparent; the restaurant was severely neglected(in every way) and we were going to need to make big changes to get it back on track, and lessen the carbon footprint we were creating in the already overpolluted Chamonix Valley.
We are both passionate about living in the mountains and were shocked to find out that the Chamonix Valley has one of the highest pollution levels in Europe. We would love to help reduce the affect our small business has on this level by making some changes.
We already recycle all our plastics, glass and paper. Our kitchen oil is also recycled by an innovative gentleman who uses it to fuel his car. We use LED lighting wherever we can as we cannot afford solar lighting, but we know we can do MORE!
The funding we receive from your help will be used to invest in newer and more energy efficient equipment in the kitchen aswell as throughout the restaurant. Here are a few examples of where the €15 000 would be spent:
Currently we have a 10 year old dishwasher which requires the use of non-green chemicals as well as huge amounts of electricity and water to run, which we would desperately like to replace.
We have two entrance doors which both leak heat and energy and which need to be replaced and reconstructed to create a double entrance door for the winter, and a fully sealed side door which does not leak great amounts of air. This will drastically reduce our heating costs as well as our fuel consumption on the property. This could also be improved with double insulation throughout the restaurant in various areas.
We are incredibly lucky to be able to have our own vegetable patch for the summer months and would like to expand this in our back garden area in order that we use more home grown produce and become more self-sustainable, a compost bin would not only reduce our waste but also increase our ability to grow our own produce.
We will also be able to use more local farms and produce grown and harvested in the area through the assistance that this project will provide.
These few examples will allow us to use our suppliers less, thereby reducing vehicle transportation in the Chamonix Valley, reduce our natural resource consumption and improve our energy and waste emissions.

Risks & Challenges

Due to our location it is sometimes difficult and costly to get the right equipment and use the Greenest supplies and suppliers, however, with help from you and our immediate community we are confident we can go about this in the most efficient way. 

The help from this project will give us the opportunity and freedom to be more selective about who we use and when we use them, also allowing us to use local produce, farms and suppliers more regularly.

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't only need financial help, we can use your help in creating a buzz about our project, our restaurant and what we are trying to achieve. 

Tell your friends, colleagues, family and your dog!! Who knows who might be able to help!

Keep checking our Facebook page to see how your contributions are helping us achieve our goals!!
