story:
Short Summary

Above is a picture of the applications that were received by the Justice Service Commission in Nairobi,Kenya. With rampant nepotism, tribalism and corruption, what are the chances of a qualified candidate getting a fair shot?

My name is Joan Osogo, an entrepreneur, mother, avid reader and full time optimist. I recently graduated from the University of Southern California, Marshall School of Business and immediately returned to my home country of Kenya after 15 years of living abroad. I was excited to come back and make positive change, especially given that as a child I lived in poverty in one of Kenya's slums known as Huruma. As a child, I always dreamed of somebody coming to save me from the filthiness, drug & alcohol use, crime and hopelessness that is the slum life. Through working hard at school, I was able to secure a visa to France where I worked as an au pair, after which I moved to the US and fast forward 15 years, I decided to come back to Kenya to save a young child in my former predicament.

Soon after my arrival, I quickly realized that Kenya is very different from the US, especially in the employment sector! The US has great systems in place, and if you work hard, you are rewarded for your hard work. In Kenya, not so much!Reuniting with alot of my friends, I realized that a majority of them are in the same place they were in 15 years ago, if not worse. Most are losing hope, which is ironical because  Kenya's economy is rapidly growing, but unfortunately this growth is only witnessed by the wealthy and connected. I would like to change that, and with your help I know we can create a career development agency that creates a pathway to a stable career for people who have worked hard in their universities and colleges. I would like to adopt the US system in Kenya especially the internship & mentor ship programs that ensure that students get a glimpse into their future careers.

With your help, we will be able to set up a career development agency that will act as a link between the rapidly growing companies in Kenya, both local and international. Our goal is to have a year round agency that does much more than just find jobs for prospective candidates. We plan on holding recruitment fairs, job readiness workshops, resume writing workshops, business etiquette lessons and so much more. All of this requires capital, especially given that there are virtually no public work spaces from which we can operate. Your contribution will help with paying rent, salaries, administrative costs, supplies etc. We estimate that a size able percentage of the funding will go towards renting a work space, a cost that we have come to realize is necessary in this busy city. This said, we plan on bootstrapping as much as possible, just like our company name, Jitahidi, means. Our plan is to outsource most of our services, opting to use virtual offices and holding training programs at hotel lobbies until we are able to scale the agency. With your help, we will be able to give bright, college educated youth who are not connected or from the elite class, a shot at life! Below is a caption from the Daily Nation, Kenya's leading newspaper, on how foreign direct investments have more than doubled, but you would not know of this if you made a visit to the slums. The situation in the slums and lower middle class neighborhoods have remained the same if not worsened due to ever increasing living costs. We would like to change that!


What We Need & What You Get

Our estimates is that we will need $100,000 to cover our annual expenses. 30-40% of this amount will go towards getting premises for us to conduct business. Even though we prefer to outsource everything and have virtual offices, we realize that we will have to pay for hotel lobbies where we will hold recruitment fairs, resume writing workshops, networking events and so on. 20% of the budget will go towards advertising, 20% will go towards salaries and administrative costs with the rest going towards paying for supplies, website and other miscellaneous costs. Jitahidi Inc is already registered in the US and we are in the process of having it registered here in Kenya.

We have great perks to show you our gratitude for your support! Since our company is located in Kenya, we thought it would be great to give perks that are made in Kenya, and that will hopefully give you a taste of Kenya!

Some of our perks...

Canvas oil drawings & paintings.


Beautiful beaded sandals.



Handwoven baskets.

 




Colorful Maasai shukas.



Beautiful Maasai beads and necklaces.


In the case that we do not reach our goal, the funds raised will go towards setting up a website for Jitahidi, paying for the hosting of our first event, paying for advertisement costs all dependent on how much funding we secure.


The Impact

With your help, we will be able to bring some much needed transparency and a level playing ground for the Kenyan youth. I believe that hard work should be rewarded, and I saw first hand in the US how they reward people who work hard and have inbuilt systems that ensure that the right people are rewarded. Everything from internships, recruitment fairs, career development workshops, resume fairs and information sessions where companies come on campus and talk to students about opportunities with them and why they should work for them. These and other programs are almost impossible to find in Kenya! I was shocked to find out that getting an unpaid internship, something that in theory should be very easy to get, is almost impossible to get in Kenya unless you are connected. The level of nepotism in this country makes me wonder what hope the youth have as they graduate from college and head for the real world. In my Strategic Management class at USC, I had constant conversations with one of my  professors,  Professor Phil More,  about my project. He would listen and give his thoughts on the project. One day, he casually said, "So you basically want to do what what the University and its career placement office does?" At the time, I did not think much of it and gleefully answered "Yes!" But now, after 6 months on the ground, I realize that this task is easier said than done. There is a lot that will be needed to get word out about our project, to get the supplies needed to train the candidates, and most importantly to get the opportunity to provide manpower to the multinational companies in Kenya. The following is a list of some of the multinational companies that are currently in Kenya: Google, IBM, Toyota, Deloitte, PriceWaterhouseCoopers, Ernst & Young, Coca Cola, Citi, Shell and so much more. I believe that these companies will be interested in creating a pathway for bright disadvantaged students to begin a career with them and with your help, we can make this a reality. 

This is currently how numerous job advertisements are done, in print, in the newspaper. Not only is this approach not effective but it also locks out the poor who can not afford to pay Kshs 60 ( $0.63) everyday to find job advertisements! There is a need for a more cost effective and productive way to link employers to job seekers.

I started this project  in my Sophomore year in college. I was excited to look for an internship in my home country of Kenya, and when I inquired with the Career Center, I was informed that there were no internships to Kenya. There were no systems in place to provide students with an opportunity to work in Kenya, and right there a bulb went off. I knew that Kenya was a great destination, and upon inquiring with my fellow classmates, majority of them expressed a great interest in interning in Kenya during their summer holidays. And thus Jitahidi Inc was born! While taking my Business Writing class with my now mentor and advisor, Professor Clark Hansen, the business idea was crystallized because the class focused on poverty alleviation and social entrepreneurship. With Professor Hansen's help, I was able to work out a business plan that was both socially sustainable and had an impact on society. The more we thought through the business plan, the more we realized that there was a dire need for this agency.

Once we are fully established. we plan on creating internship and career opportunities in Kenya for US university students in order to expand their world view and bring some much needed skilled labor to the Kenyan work space.  I registered to compete for the New Venture Seed Competition, organized by the Lloyd Greif School for Entrepreneurship, the Entrepreneurship school of USC. At the time, my business idea was not yet well developed so I did not place in the competition, and determined, I went on to compete for 1000 Pitches, a campus wide competition held by Spark SC to find business ideas from students. This time around, I was more prepared and had fine tuned my business plan, and was able to make it to the finals, representing the top 10% of pitches that were received. Although I did not win the competition, needless to  say making it to the finals  re- energized my quest to get Jitahidi Inc off the ground. Since that competition, I have registered Jitahidi Inc in the US, and have moved to Kenya to make the company a reality.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges that we face is that it is hard to bring change to a society that is set in its ways! The wealthy and connected have no reason to change the society because it favors them, while the poor have no power to demand change! Corruption, tribalism and nepotism are deeply rooted in this society, and without the help of companies both local and international that will partner with us to create a level playing field, it will be close to impossible to change the system. Below is a newspaper announcement about employment fraud, in which a government agency was the victim!


I am optimistic that companies will be interested in employing qualified youth who do not have connections, because not only will they get skilled labor, but it will also help in their Corporate Social Responsibility.

I am a very resilient and tenacious person, I have graduated from one of the prestigious universities in America despite coming from very humble beginnings. 



With my business degree, exposure to the American workplace and passion to create opportunities for someone living in poverty, I believe that we will be able to overcome any hurdles that come our way. And besides, change begins with you and I to ensure that the next generation gets a fair shot at life. Granted, because my daughter is a US citizen, she already has an upper hand, but I would like to ensure that the other children she goes to school with here in Kenya, can also dream of a brighter future. It is only fair!


Other Ways You Can Help

Other than a financial contribution, you can help us out by getting the word out about our campaign through social media to your friends, family and colleagues. Not only are we looking for financial contribution, we are also looking to get the word out about what our company does and start partnerships with companies to be their source for skilled labor! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out!

Colorful Maasai shukas.



Beautiful Maasai beads and necklaces.

In the case that we do not reach our goal, the funds raised will go towards setting up a website for Jitahidi, paying for the hosting of our first event, paying for advertisement costs all dependent on how much funding we secure. 
    The Impact
With your help, we will be able to bring some much needed transparency and a level playing ground for the Kenyan youth. I believe that hard work should be rewarded, and I saw first hand in the US how they reward people who work hard and have inbuilt systems that ensure that the right people are rewarded. Everything from internships, recruitment fairs, career development workshops, resume fairs and information sessions where companies come on campus and talk to students about opportunities with them and why they should work for them. These and other programs are almost impossible to find in Kenya! I was shocked to find out that getting an unpaid internship, something that in theory should be very easy to get, is almost impossible to get in Kenya unless you are connected. The level of nepotism in this country makes me wonder what hope the youth have as they graduate from college and head for the real world. In my Strategic Management class at USC, I had constant conversations with one of my  professors,  Professor Phil More,  about my project. He would listen and give his thoughts on the project. One day, he casually said, "So you basically want to do what what the University and its career placement office does?" At the time, I did not think much of it and gleefully answered "Yes!" But now, after 6 months on the ground, I realize that this task is easier said than done. There is a lot that will be needed to get word out about our project, to get the supplies needed to train the candidates, and most importantly to get the opportunity to provide manpower to the multinational companies in Kenya. The following is a list of some of the multinational companies that are currently in Kenya: Google, IBM, Toyota, Deloitte, PriceWaterhouseCoopers, Ernst & Young, Coca Cola, Citi, Shell and so much more. I believe that these companies will be interested in creating a pathway for bright disadvantaged students to begin a career with them and with your help, we can make this a reality. 
This is currently how numerous job advertisements are done, in print, in the newspaper. Not only is this approach not effective but it also locks out the poor who can not afford to pay Kshs 60 ( $0.63) everyday to find job advertisements! There is a need for a more cost effective and productive way to link employers to job seekers.



I started this project  in my Sophomore year in college. I was excited to look for an internship in my home country of Kenya, and when I inquired with the Career Center, I was informed that there were no internships to Kenya. There were no systems in place to provide students with an opportunity to work in Kenya, and right there a bulb went off. I knew that Kenya was a great destination, and upon inquiring with my fellow classmates, majority of them expressed a great interest in interning in Kenya during their summer holidays. And thus Jitahidi Inc was born! While taking my Business Writing class with my now mentor and advisor, Professor Clark Hansen, the business idea was crystallized because the class focused on poverty alleviation and social entrepreneurship. With Professor Hansen's help, I was able to work out a business plan that was both socially sustainable and had an impact on society. The more we thought through the business plan, the more we realized that there was a dire need for this agency.
Once we are fully established. we plan on creating internship and career opportunities in Kenya for US university students in order to expand their world view and bring some much needed skilled labor to the Kenyan work space.  I registered to compete for the New Venture Seed Competition, organized by the Lloyd Greif School for Entrepreneurship, the Entrepreneurship school of USC. At the time, my business idea was not yet well developed so I did not place in the competition, and determined, I went on to compete for 1000 Pitches, a campus wide competition held by Spark SC to find business ideas from students. This time around, I was more prepared and had fine tuned my business plan, and was able to make it to the finals, representing the top 10% of pitches that were received. Although I did not win the competition, needless to  say making it to the finals  re- energized my quest to get Jitahidi Inc off the ground. Since that competition, I have registered Jitahidi Inc in the US, and have moved to Kenya to make the company a reality.

   Risks & Challenges
The risks and challenges that we face is that it is hard to bring change to a society that is set in its ways! The wealthy and connected have no reason to change the society because it favors them, while the poor have no power to demand change! Corruption, tribalism and nepotism are deeply rooted in this society, and without the help of companies both local and international that will partner with us to create a level playing field, it will be close to impossible to change the system. Below is a newspaper announcement about employment fraud, in which a government agency was the victim!
 


I am optimistic that companies will be interested in employing qualified youth who do not have connections, because not only will they get skilled labor, but it will also help in their Corporate Social Responsibility.
I am a very resilient and tenacious person, I have graduated from one of the prestigious universities in America despite coming from very humble beginnings. 




With my business degree, exposure to the American workplace and passion to create opportunities for someone living in poverty, I believe that we will be able to overcome any hurdles that come our way. And besides, change begins with you and I to ensure that the next generation gets a fair shot at life. Granted, because my daughter is a US citizen, she already has an upper hand, but I would like to ensure that the other children she goes to school with here in Kenya, can also dream of a brighter future. It is only fair!



    Other Ways You Can Help
Other than a financial contribution, you can help us out by getting the word out about our campaign through social media to your friends, family and colleagues. Not only are we looking for financial contribution, we are also looking to get the word out about what our company does and start partnerships with companies to be their source for skilled labor! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out!

story:
RevFit's Indiegogo Campaign is a project to support the development of a brand new low-cost, community-based fitness studio. This is our first physical location and we are excited to be in the great neighborhood of East Harlem. There’s a range of one-of-a-kind perks for you to choose from, with all proceeds going towards building the new studio.

Revolutionary Fitness was founded in June of 2010 to address the health and fitness crisis within underdeveloped communities throughout New York City.

Using education, fitness services, multimedia and a focus on creating leaders from within our neighborhoods. Revolutionary Fitness has been able to serve thousands of people around NYC, but more importantly train our community members so they can help empower their friends and family with the message of health and fitness.

We are currently in the process of opening our first low-cost Fitness Studio in East Harlem, join our efforts today.

In return for your support, we have a bunch of cool thank you gifts—wristbands, tote bags, T-shirts, custom water bottles, and fitness services, all custom with the RevFit logo and with our progressive message of fitness for the people!

Cool black wrist bands with Revolutionary Fitness name and Phoenix Logo in red font.

We have three custom designs for shirts. At the end of the campaign we will email you to get your design, color and size preferences. 
Membership Shirt:

Go shopping for your fresh fruits and vegetables in style with a custom made tote bag with the Revolutionary Fitness name and logo on.

This custom styled protein shaker/water bottle is the only workout drink bottle you'll ever need. And the fact that it comes with the RevFit red on the cap and logo on the side makes it even cooler.

You can't get where you need to go without first assessing where you are and creating a scientific plan to make qualitative change. Meet in person (NYC) or via Skype with one of our People's Trainers to do a full health and fitness assessment and get a 5-week customized program for your personal goals.

We teach tons of educational workshops and love bringing these workshops to the masses. We will travel to you (if in NYC area) or create a webinar personally customized for the subject that you and your community would like to learn more about. Bring us to your local school, community center, church or workplace.

In our new Fitness Studio will be providing top of the line fitness training, at an affordable price. Most small semi-private studios of this nature charge $200-$300 a month, a price tag that most people in underdeveloped communities like East Harlem cannot afford.  Our Studio will make this high level training accessible at nearly a fifth of the price.

In addition, our Studio is a new home where we can deliver all of our low-cost health and fitness educational workshops. Examples of the kind of workshops we do are: healthy living on a budget, yoga for all shapes and sizes, certifications to become a fitness trainer, restoring functional movement for working people, understanding the systematic reasons communities are in poor health and much more!

The RevFit Studio is also part of the new Justice Center en El Barrio, a community-based advocacy center which houses other organizations that share common missions of community empowerment with Revolutionary Fitness. So tons of opportunity for collaboration.

East Harlem, NYC, similar to many of the communities that Revolutionary Fitness serves, is disproportionally unhealthy compared to more affluent communities. One out of four children in East Harlem are obese, 30% of adults in East Harlem report not exercising at all and 90% of folks don't regularly eat fresh fruits and vegetables. This is not because people in East Harlem want to be unhealthy, but rather like most underdeveloped communities, there is an issue with lack of access to healthy and nutritious alternatives.

Through our low-cost services and our educational workshops we have been working to empower our communities to change this health crisis. Having a studio space will allow us to take our services and educational workshops to a whole new level. 

This new home will allow us to empower our folks to become agents of change, create more local fitness ambassadors, help generate job opportunities in the heath and fitness sector and bring more awareness to healthy living.

Revolutionary Fitness is solely funded by the contributions and donations of our community members. We are all from poor and working communities here in NYC and we don't have any big sponsors.

We have already invested personal funds reaching into the $30,000 range to renovate a bare knuckles space in East Harlem into a top of the line fitness studio and equipped it with state of the art exercise tools. Here is a break down of some of our expenses we have collectively fronted;

  • $6,500 Labor for interior renovations (we were able to keep this cost low because of all the great volunteers that helped us throughout the renovations)
  • $3,800 Materials for renovations
  • $4,200 Electrical Work
  • $2,300 Flooring
  • $2,800 Store front window replacement
  • $900 Installation of utilities equipment
  • $6,200 New equipment for the studio
This is not counting the rent and security we had to place on the space, nor the expenses it will take over the next few months to get started on a strong foot. So while the $24K won't cover all of these expenses, it will definitely help us in this vital stage of our development. The more money we can raise through this campaign and other fundraisers, the more services we can provide to our community at a low-cost.

We are a very passionate group who are serious about making real change. We have been working tirelessly for the past five years to improve the health and wellness of underdeveloped communities in NYC. With your contribution, you are giving us the financial support to keep us doing the work that we love to do and spread our message even further. So, thank you so much!

When will I get my thank you gift?
Our fundraising campaign ends on August 13th. We will begin production of all the perks immediately afterward, that way we have accurate sizes and quantity counts. We anticipate that products will be available to ship out in mid-September 2015.

Do I get to pick my own shirt  size? 
Yes, but after the shirt is shipped/delivered to you they are non-refundable even if it didn't fit the way you thought it would. The shirts we order run true to size.

What exactly will my donation go towards? 
We've fronted a lot of personal money and personal loans to get this great space up and running so many of your contributions will go towards those expenses. But depending on how much we surpass our goal, your contributions will go towards expanding our services over the next several months.

Is my donation tax deductible? 
No, we are not currently have our 501(c)3 but if large enough you can mention to your tax handler that you made a contribution to fundraiser and they can give you some options.

story:
What We're All About

Motherboard Connection, founded in 2015 by Richard Salane, seeks to revolutionize the Information Technology industry by providing personalized, adaptable solutions, advice, education, repairs and training to individuals and small businesses. In theory, it's a very simple concept, but one we haven't seen executed as well as we know it can be. We're all experienced IT professionals that decided to do things the way they should be done, rather than the way they normally are. So, that being said, here's a general summary of our goals:

  • We want to provide corporate quality IT help to individuals, while still treating every customer, whether they're one person or a small business, like they're our closest friend.
  • Our approach is to bring the help to our customers rather than forcing them to seek us out and leave their important technology in our hands for days on in. When you hire us, we become your in house IT department. We want to be more convenient than the standard big box retail electronics store and those local computer shops, while also remaining fairly priced.
  • Upon the completion of this campaign, we plan to establish a presence in a number of major cities in the southeast. As of now, we are based out of Charlotte, NC and have services in Columbia, SC and Asheville, NC as well. We will be expanding to Charleston and Savannah, and hope to continue our expansion into many other major cities. We will typically service anywhere within an hour of any of those cities, and hope that by establishing offices in multiple major cities, we can provide a level of technical expertise to communities that would otherwise lack them.

Innovative ideas. Expert knowledge. Personal solutions.

What We Need

So, here's how you can help us: The $2000 we have set for our goal will enable us to cover all of the fees associated with setting up a business to operate in multiple cities, specifically Charlotte, Asheville and Columbia, and maintaining our online presence and email systems. Beyond that $2000 mark, we will be setting up stretch goals to help facilitate the growth of this project. Our hope is an expansion into actual office space with a greater number of full-time professionals so that we can continue to bring our revolutionary take on technology assistant to as many people as possible. Any funds we receive, whether we hit our goal or not, will be dedicated to the expansion and maintenance of Motherboard Connection

Risks & Challenges

As with turning any hobby into a full fledged business, the primary risk is that the business may not be able to support itself. For the time being, we have the ability to operate in some capacity whether the the funding arrives or not, however that capacity will be severely limited.

Beyond that, there could potentially be delays if we obtain enough funding to push on to launching in more cities. While there are a number of candidates already prepared for hiring processes if we are fortunate enough to have that ability, there's no guarantee these people will actually be hired, and any delay in that process could place additional strain on the consultants we already have. We're dedicated to working around the clock no matter what to fulfill our rewards.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to funding, we need:

  • Photographers, web designers, app developers, people to run social media, etc. We'll have actual job postings on our website soon, but for now if you're in the creative field, shoot us an email and we'll talk.
  • If you want to donate but wish to do so outside of IndieGoGo, shoot us an email on our website for options.
  • Just sharing our campaign and, more importantly, getting the word out that we exist would help more than any amount of money ever could.

Thanks, guy!

story:
Early Bird Bonus:

If you’re one of the first five supporters to contribute $25 or more to our campaign, we have a special way of saying ‘thanks!’. You’ll automatically get bumped up to the next perk level, and, if you’re contributing at the $25 level, you’ll also receive a pair of tickets to the Whole Heart Productions mixer.

Thank you!!

______________

No Act of Kindness, However Small, is Ever Wasted


The Campaign: Essential Information

The Hearts of Love Luncheon will help to raise awareness for the work that Hearts of Love Co. does for the New Orleans homeless and at risk communities. The luncheon will also serve as a fundraiser, helping to raise funds towards their future goals, including a mobile outreach facility.


The funds raised through this campaign will allow us to not only meet those two goals, but also celebrate the work of a few of our tireless volunteers. The luncheon will also feature the work of local performers who have contributed to the unique cultural landscape of New Orleans.

Who We Are

Hearts Of Love Corporation is an outreach organization that provides charitable, cohesive, holistic, and social support for individuals and families that are homeless, chronically homeless, or are at risk of homelessness, with the goal to change the life of each individual that connect with us. We aid in the creation of a stable environment that will increase the individual’s ability to thrive, thus affording the opportunity to live healthy, stable and independently.

What We Do

In 2008, it was approximated that 12,000 people in New Orleans—4% of the city’s 302,000 residents, or 1 in 25—were homeless in post-Katrina New Orleans. This meant that “the city that care forgot” had four times as many homeless people as most U.S. cities. Prior to Hurricane Katrina, which struck America’s Gulf Coast in September 2005, New Orleans’ homeless population was about 6,300.


As the number of homeless families and individuals continued to increase to an unprecedented number, the availability of affordable housing as well as other services to the poor grew to dismal proportions. Hearts of Love Co. was created to help those who suffer most within our community. We understand the only way we can maximize our effectiveness is through collaborative efforts with other agencies, corporations, organizations, and caring citizens that are dedicated to the same mission as we are.


The Hearts of Love Co. is made up of individuals that are dedicated to creating and offering quality, tailored services to those that are the most vulnerable in our community; attending to both the heart and health, as well as the individual needs, of each person that crosses our paths.


What We Hope to Accomplish

Hearts of Love Co. is working towards establishing a mobile facility that will provide food, clothing, toiletries, emergency and immediate health care by a registered and licensed healthcare professional (nurse or doctor). We will also, with the help of a licensed clinician, provide assistance in accessing vital resources such as entitled benefits, employment services, housing support, and any other support that will aid in the individual maintaining an independent, stable environment.

How You Can Help

The Home Grown Awards Luncheon will not only celebrate some of our tireless volunteers, it will also help us to raise funds to support Hearts of Love Co.’s future work in New Orleans and raise awareness for the needs of the homeless population in our city.


But we need your help to do it.


Partnered with Whole Heart Productions , we’ve organized an event that includes  performances from local artists, a special guest speaker, and recognition for a selection of community volunteers who have gone above and beyond in their service to our city. We will also recognize the contributions of three cultural art pioneers.

In addition to helping Hearts of Love Co. to raise awareness, all money raised through ticket sales will directly benefit the homeless population of New Orleans, providing both immediate assistance and helping us to work towards the creation of our mobile facility. Any funds raised in excess of our campaign goal will also go to help support future Hearts of Love Co. projects.

Home Grown Events

This campaign helps to make our awards luncheon a reality, but it's only one part of the Home Grown events happening that weekend.


The WHP Mixer

On September 18th, our partners at Whole Heart Productions will be hosting a special thank you event for our top sponsors. The WHP Mixer is a great opportunity to meet the team behind Home Grown before the event kicks off the next day. The only way to be included is to receive tickets through this campaign.

The Home Grown Awards Luncheon

The Home Grown Awards Luncheon starts at 12:00 on September 19th, and celebrates the people who are out making a difference in their communities. The luncheon also recognizes three cultural art pioneers, all native New Orleans artists. Tickets will be on sale soon, or you can receive them early as part of our top-level perk packages.

Home Grown: Journeys of Euphoria Dance Production

The conclusion of the awards luncheon isn’t the end of Home Grown. That evening, Whole Heart Productions presents a series of performances, all which feature local performers and choreographers. After the performance, guests will also have the opportunity to attend a talk back with the choreographers. This event is separate from the awards luncheon and not affiliated with Hearts of Love, but our two top-level perks do include tickets to this event, too.

Other Ways to Help

If you’re looking for another way to help us meet our goal, but aren’t able to contribute right now, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Also, if you're in the New Orleans area, please consider coming to the Home Grown Awards Luncheon on September 19th. You can find more information in the website link below.

Prior to Hurricane Katrina, which struck America’s Gulf Coast in September 2005, New Orleans’ homeless population was about 6,300.As the number of homeless families and individuals continued to increase to an unprecedented number, the availability of affordable housing as well as other services to the poor grew to dismal proportions. Hearts of Love Co. was created to help those who suffer most within our community. We understand the only way we can maximize our effectiveness is through collaborative efforts with other agencies, corporations, organizations, and caring citizens that are dedicated to the same mission as we are.The Hearts of Love Co. is made up of individuals that are dedicated to creating and offering quality, tailored services to those that are the most vulnerable in our community; attending to both the heart and health, as well as the individual needs, of each person that crosses our paths.What We Hope to AccomplishHearts of Love Co. is working towards establishing a mobile facility that will provide food, clothing, toiletries, emergency and immediate health care by a registered and licensed healthcare professional (nurse or doctor). We will also, with the help of a licensed clinician, provide assistance in accessing vital resources such as entitled benefits, employment services, housing support, and any other support that will aid in the individual maintaining an independent, stable environment. How You Can HelpThe Home Grown Awards Luncheon will not only celebrate some of our tireless volunteers, it will also help us to raise funds to support Hearts of Love Co.’s future work in New Orleans and raise awareness for the needs of the homeless population in our city.But we need your help to do it. Partnered with Whole Heart Productions , we’ve organized an event that includes  performances from local artists, a special guest speaker, and recognition for a selection of community volunteers who have gone above and beyond in their service to our city. We will also recognize the contributions of three cultural art pioneers. In addition to helping Hearts of Love Co. to raise awareness, all money raised through ticket sales will directly benefit the homeless population of New Orleans, providing both immediate assistance and helping us to work towards the creation of our mobile facility. Any funds raised in excess of our campaign goal will also go to help support future Hearts of Love Co. projects. Home Grown EventsThis campaign helps to make our awards luncheon a reality, but it's only one part of the Home Grown events happening that weekend. The WHP MixerOn September 18th, our partners at Whole Heart Productions will be hosting a special thank you event for our top sponsors. The WHP Mixer is a great opportunity to meet the team behind Home Grown before the event kicks off the next day. The only way to be included is to receive tickets through this campaign. The Home Grown Awards LuncheonThe Home Grown Awards Luncheon starts at 12:00 on September 19th, and celebrates the people who are out making a difference in their communities. The luncheon also recognizes three cultural art pioneers, all native New Orleans artists. Tickets will be on sale soon, or you can receive them early as part of our top-level perk packages.Home Grown: Journeys of Euphoria Dance ProductionThe conclusion of the awards luncheon isn’t the end of Home Grown. That evening, Whole Heart Productions presents a series of performances, all which feature local performers and choreographers. After the performance, guests will also have the opportunity to attend a talk back with the choreographers. This event is separate from the awards luncheon and not affiliated with Hearts of Love, but our two top-level perks do include tickets to this event, too. Other Ways to HelpIf you’re looking for another way to help us meet our goal, but aren’t able to contribute right now, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Also, if you're in the New Orleans area, please consider coming to the Home Grown Awards Luncheon on September 19th. You can find more information in the website link below.

story:
The Boring Business Bit.

I started my LYS (Local Yarn Shop) business 6 months ago. I decided not to go for funding at the time as I wanted to see if it was a viable proposition.

I have to say it has worked. I have paid all my bills (I haven't taken a salary but that is different) and expanded my product range, all just by income from the shop. 

Now however I need help. For the least 6 months I have been renting (a small) space at a World Famous weaving mill. I am also their largest independent retailer of their unique yarns in the UK. These yarns are fantastic for many crafts not just weaving. We have a wonderful friendly relationship that is going to evolve in an unexpected way.

The mill is doing so well it needs to expand. They need to expand into my space, so I have to leave. Nothing else will change they will still be my suppliers etc. 

We are looking for me to vacate at the end of August. 

What I Need 

I need the deposit for a retail unit within walking distance of the City Centre. I need a space big enough to hold workshops. The weaving workshops are held in the darning room at the mill at the moment.

I will need to buy my own shop fittings, cash register, telephone et al ( everything I am using now belongs to the mill).

At this time I have the use of the mill's cone winding machine, so will have to buy my own. Most are three-phased, so I would either have to instal three-phase into the unit or convert the machine to 240v.

I would also need new stock (bigger place would require more filling). From customer feedback over the last 6 months they would like new and unique yarns from around the World, as well as unusual accessories.


The Break Down.

Building and Move.     £15,000      This will be the biggest expense by far. It will include: 3 months deposit, 1 months rent. Possibly a survey will be needed if a repairing lease. Redecoration and signage. Installation or connection of telephone. PoS/cash register. Shop fittings and display units. Reprint of leaflets and advertising the move.

Fees and Perks.    £10,000.     This section I believe speaks for it's self. If I don't reach my goal the fees will be higher, but the perks will be less. Obviously the reverse if I attain my goal.

Cone Winding.     £5,000      This is for a cone to cone winder, delivered and installed. The price includes having an electrician converting it from 3-phase to 240v.

Extra Stock.     £5,000       Expand the ranges of the brands I already stock. Start to carry brands I have already approached, and source some new and exciting products.

Unforeseen.   £3000    If you want to hear God laugh make a plan.



That is the perfect solution. What happens if I don't reach my goal? After the fees and perk requirements. My first priority will be the building and move. I will get as much done as possible with the money. 

After that I will continue as I have been up till now. As the shop earns enough it will be invested in new products.


The Perks.


 No Thanks Needed Option.

Someone asked me if it was possible just to give money without picking a perk. The answer is yes. Instead of clicking on a perk, click on the Contribute button. You can then enter any amount you want.

 The Card.

A specially printed card just for you (the image is my mock up NOT the actual card)

The Bag

Natural cotton 4oz carrier 36x39cm, with long handles (the image is my mock up NOT the actual bag).

Dispatched end September

The Apron


White polycotton 58x78cm (the image is my mock up NOT the actual apron).
Dispatched end September

The Project Bag


Natural cotton drawstring bag 20x24cm (the image is my mock up NOT the actual bag).
Dispatched end September

The Accessories


A beautiful brocade accessory case, fully lined in a complementary plain coloured fabric with internal zip pocket.
Containing:
1 x Panda Li tape measure,    1 x Puppy snips,   1 x Cable needles (set of 3),
1 x Darn It Needles (set of 3),   1 x Locking stitch marker, 1 x Needle gauge,
1 x Knitters safety pins (set of 10),   1 x Classic point protectors (pair) 
and 1 x Stitch holders (set of 3).
Dispatched end September beginning of October (dependent on stock levels)

The Ultimate Crochet

0.50mm - 2.10mm are Nickel Plated Crochet Hooks

2.00mm - 10.00mm are Aluminium Crochet Hooks

12.00mm - 15.00mm are Acrylic Crochet Hooks.

The case colour and fabric may vary.

Dispatched end September beginning of October (dependent on stock levels)


The Combined

Containing the 'ultimate' selection of 9" circulars and DPNs for tackling any sock project - all neatly stored in a stylish brocade case.
Each set contains:
2 x 2.25mm, 2 x 2.50mm, 2 x 2.75mm and 1 x 3.50mm 9" circulars.
1 each of 2.25mm, 2.50mm, 2.75mm and 3.50mm 6" DPN sets
1 set of Darn It needles, 1 x Needle gauge, 1 x Kitty snips
1 set of Yarn ball markers and 1 x Locking stitch marker.
Case colour and fabric will vary.
This set is available with Sharp or Bamboo points.
Dispatched end September beginning of October (dependent on stock levels)

The Pinnacle

Everything you could want and more - the whole range of 5" tips with cables and accessories.
Set contains:
1 each 2.75mm, 3.00mm, 3.50mm, 3.75mm, 4.00mm, 4.50mm, 5.00mm, 5.50mm, 6.00mm, 7.00mm, 8.00mm, 9.00mm and 10.00mm 5" tips.
1 each 16"/18", 24"/26", 32"/34", 40"/42" and 60"/62" Life line cables.
1 each Straight needle adaptor set in small and large.
1 each Panda Li cable stoppers in small and large
1 x Tip adaptor, 1 x Darn It needle set, 1 x Puppy snips, 1 x Needle grips,
1 x Interchangeable case (colour and fabric will vary).
This set is available in Steel, Sharp and Bamboo.
Dispatched end September beginning of October (dependent on stock levels)

The Mouseketeer

A plaque will be prominently displayed on the wall of the shop.
A Mouseketeer Card which entitles you to a 10% discount on any service or product from The Mouse Hole, in store or online forever.
The Card also entitles you to a day of workshop free once a year. So a one day workshop will be free, 2 day workshop = 50% discount, 3 day = 30% discount etc.
You have to book (normal booking terms apply) but the attendee can be anyone you specify.

Please note there is a £5 shipping charge on the higher value items. This is to help out with insurance costs. 


Why?

I truly believe there is a resurgence of fibre crafts, not just knitting and crochet, but a 'rediscovering' of spinning and weaving as some thing other than an 'industrial' processes. 
There are some amazing Craft Shops that have a selection of yarns in Carlisle, but no specialist yarn and fibre shop. I think it is time, for this to change.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people can't contribute. Maybe you just don't 'feel' the campaign. That is Ok I get that. Thank you for reading this far.

Before you go please consider spreading the word amongst you friends. 

There are lots of tools to help you make some noise. Let us raise the decibels.

story:
On June 1, 2015 - An Injustice Will Begin

K & L (names are being protected) have lived their lives in the care of their mother. K's father abandoned him and his mother when he was an infant. L's father kicked her mother out of his house while she was pregnant.

Now, thanks to an unfair court ruling by a judge who's decision can best be described as nothing but the punishment of K & L's mother, has ordered that they live with their fathers. Mom gets to see them every other weekend and 3 weeks in the summer.

Mom has the opportunity to appeal this unjust decision and have a fair court consider overturning this unfair decision.

The Florida Family Resource Center is a 501 (c)(3) organization that helps put families back together. Help us help mom raise the money she needs to file an appeal. The cost of the transcripts alone is over $13,000 as the fathers dragged this out from a scheduled 3 day trial to a 6 day trial.

Mom's Story - In Her Own Words

Amanda's Fight for her Children

I am in despair of keeping my children together and urgently necessitate your help.  I have a five (5) year old son, K and a three (3) year old daughter L.  They are the light of my life and I will do whatever measures to keep them together.  The siblings are very close and inseparable, always looking out for each other.  They also have different Fathers, which neither ever-showed concern nor desire to their responsibilities’. 

K’s father is a drinker and is very heavy into smoking pot. Coming from a well-to-do family, his mother financially supports him, with housing, utilities etc.; therefore, he does not have to maintain steady employment. Shortly after K was born, his walked out on us both.  He left and moved into his Mother’s house, abandoning us and leaving me to maintain a home for my infant son and myself.

L’s father also comes from a well to do family and his parents financially support him.  L’s father is a very heavy drinker, loves to party and adamantly, never wanted children.  When I became pregnant with his child, he crossly evicted my son K and me from his home, leaving us out on the street. 

I have always been the primary caregiver throughout the life of my children with extremely little help from the fathers. I always maintained employment and my money goes solely to the support for my children. It was not until I sought legal counsel for child support that both fathers reached out, conversed and met. They both became very good friends, spent much time together bonding, retained the same attorney and both conspired to fight against me.  Cost was no issue for them as they both obtained financial assistance from their parents. Despite that, K’s father who had a domestic violence injunction against him and refused to submit a substance abuse evaluation was granted primary custody. K’s father resides over 450 miles away.  Despite the fact that L’s father was established an excessive alcoholic with enhanced temperaments, the Judge also awarded him primary custody. L’s father lives 2 two hours away.  Based on the time-sharing schedule, I will have the children 83 overnights a year and the fathers will have 282 overnights per year. This is a cruel, deliberate unfairness which separates the siblings from each other, their grandmother and myself. 

My entire family, and my children are devastated.  From what I have learned, this particular Judge notoriously “favors” fathers, with no regard for the children or their mothers. I also have over 50 face book messages that support this to be a fact.  My fight is not with the fathers, but with the Judge. My children need to stay together and be brother and sister, to grow together, enhance each other and share all the normal things a brother and sister are supposed to do. Separating these children will cause much heartache and infuse great anxiety for them.

My attorney fervently recommends appealing to the District Court of Appeals as soon as possible to work to terminate this injustice.  The transcripts are over $13,000.00 (over 1700 pages @ 8.00 ea.) along with additional court costs and attorney fees. My mother, my family members nor I have this kind of money.  Between my Mothers retirement funds and my savings, we have exhausted our funds. I humbly implore that my cries be heard and attain the financial funds needed to keep my children together.  Your help is deeply valued.  Thank you.

story:
THE STORY

At Babouka, the purchase of a single item from our signature baby couture collection goes a long way; it fosters a dream, provides a voice to the underrepresented, and creates community in difficult places. 

It is through the sale of our handcrafted, socially conscious clothing that we not only seek to bring joy to the children wearing it, but also to the women creating it.

Over the past two years, we’ve dedicated ourselves to the cause of ethical fashion, with a focus on female empowerment. 

We developed two collections, each created by ambitious women in developing countries: The first is Spice Route, which donates proceeds to Upendo Means Love, an organization in Zanzibar that promotes interfaith understanding among Muslim and Christian women through trainings in sewing, home-planning and basic healthcare. And the second is Silk Road, the result of a collaboration with Behbud, a Pakistani organization that brings work opportunity, income-generating education, and healthcare training, turning underprivileged women into breadwinners in Islamabad.

We have been selling our couture on several online platforms and at fairs across the United Arab Emirates. Since launching in 2012, we’ve come to see that this is a formula that works and that compassion can complement business and transcend borders.


THE ASK

Given the incredibly positive response to Babouka, we have decided that we’d like to spread the word about it to a larger, more global audience. We would also like to connect our customers with the seamstresses in a more profound way by showing them their stories and transporting them to their worlds.

Since our funds are limited (we are a non-profit), we need your help to fund a video about our work and mission. The video will be filmed in both Zanzibar and Islamabad, highlighting the work of the women and the story of the garments and the influence they have on people's lives from when the materials are sourced, to when they reach babies worldwide. 

We choose video because it is a highly effective, engaging format. This is no easy feat – creating this will require renting expensive equipment, hiring talented multimedia staff and funding them for pre- and post-production work, and financing flights/accommodation to both Zanzibar and Pakistan. But we believe that with the right support, we can make it happen.


Whether it’s $20, $100 or $500 your contribution will help raise important and necessary awareness about Babouka's talented female artisans. This video is the necessary step to take Babouka to the next level and create more opportunities for these women. To find out more about us, check out www.babouka.com. To find out more about our partners and the amazing women they are working with, check out www.upendomeanslove.com & www.behbud.org.



EXAMPLES OF THE HANDCRAFTED GARMENTS 

Garments below are included in some of the "perks" on the right hand side
Spice Route (Zanzibar) 
"Kiponda" boy's overalls                                     "Kibele" girl's dress

                                   

Silk Road (Islamabad)

"Guddu" Baby Bib                                               "Sibbi" Quilt

                                     

For more examples, please check out  www.babouka.com 

TESTIMONIALS

Some words from the female artisans themselves. 

Mwanaisha: My future dreams are to improve further my skills and expand, expand, expand.


Amna: The best part of my job is that enriching environment and passion of all the women.


Nargis: I love it when I make different styles of stitching and people appreciate my work. It gives me the courage to continue working.

                                                                           ***

Since our funds are limited (we are a non-profit), we need your help to fund a video about our work and mission. The video will be filmed in both Zanzibar and Islamabad, highlighting the work of the women and the story of the garments and the influence they have on people's lives from when the materials are sourced, to when they reach babies worldwide. 

We choose video because it is a highly effective, engaging format. This is no easy feat – creating this will require renting expensive equipment, hiring talented multimedia staff and funding them for pre- and post-production work, and financing flights/accommodation to both Zanzibar and Pakistan. But we believe that with the right support, we can make it happen.
Whether it’s $20, $100 or $500 your contribution will help raise important and necessary awareness about Babouka's talented female artisans. This video is the necessary step to take Babouka to the next level and create more opportunities for these women. To find out more about us, check out www.babouka.com. To find out more about our partners and the amazing women they are working with, check out www.upendomeanslove.com & www.behbud.org.
EXAMPLES OF THE HANDCRAFTED GARMENTS Garments below are included in some of the "perks" on the right hand sideSpice Route (Zanzibar) "Kiponda" boy's overalls                                     "Kibele" girl's dress
                                   
Silk Road (Islamabad)
"Guddu" Baby Bib                                               "Sibbi" Quilt

                                     
For more examples, please check out  www.babouka.com TESTIMONIALSSome words from the female artisans themselves. 
Mwanaisha: My future dreams are to improve further my skills and expand, expand, expand.

Amna: The best part of my job is that enriching environment and passion of all the women.


Nargis: I love it when I make different styles of stitching and people appreciate my work. It gives me the courage to continue working.

                                                                           ***

story:
Summary

Season [see-zuh n], noun. 1. one of the four periods of the year (spring, summer, autumn, and winter); 2. a period of the year when something is best or available; 3. to heighten or improve the flavor of food by adding condiments, spices, herbs, or the like.
SEASON is an of-the-moment concept, yet its origins are anchored in something deeper than a trend: an intention to serve a resolutely market-driven menu to the good people of the Hudson Valley and beyond.  SEASON features a rotating seasonal menu of re-imagined classics and innovative specials, down-to-earth and slightly luxurious at once.  Our produce and ingredients promise to always be both organic and local whenever possible, in a commitment to support our incredible community of Hudson Valley farmers who are taking care to practice sustainable methods of agriculture and growing non-GMO fruits and vegetables without the use of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides.
SEASON is a creation of Northern Catskills resident JD Eiseman.  He has been cooking since he was a teen, experimenting with classic recipes, feeding family and friends, hosting unconventional dinners, and catering small parties.  JD moved to the region in 2012 after a three-year stint in Los Angeles.  It was in that notoriously polluted yet increasingly health-conscious city that he began to be turned onto thinking about food production and consumption in ecologically-sound and economically-progressive terms.  He has since taken up positions in the organic food sector and currently works as a farmhand at Foxtail Community Farm, an organic vegetable farm in Greenville, New York.

What We Need

Raised funds will be used toward the purchase of a newly renovated food truck, initial permits and licensing, and initial operational needs.
The Impact
SEASON will be an invaluable addition to the growing, diverse community of Hudson Valley food trucks, serving not only our local diners, but actively participating and investing in the local agricultural economy.  We invite our diners to connect with their food from the ground up, using consumer purchasing power to support the values and benefits of a local food economy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, families, and extended networks via social media platforms - we need you to make noise!

story:
Short Summary

  • When did finding love become about a downloadable app? Swipe apps are beyond frustrating, not to mention time-consuming, redundant and vague. You can't find out much about the person and the pictures are not so accurate (and that’s being kind!). Even if you are connected with someone through mutual friends, it is often based on your being single and not any other compatibility criteria. And seriously who wants to waste their time giving their number to a ton of strangers and/or kill their battery chatting in an app all day and night?
  • My matchmaking company, COMMITZVAH, is about people. It teaches people to “fall in love with the process, as only then, the results will come.” Getting there is half the fun. Everyone has a different journey and if you face your opportunities and obstacles with love and without fear, you have a shot at finding true happiness and a partner to enjoy it with.
  • Married and divorced before I turned 30, I will admit that I only believe in love at first sight! Which is why being open minded is so incredibly important. Some people are blessed to meet the loves of their lives, their partners, their twin-souls and their soul-mates. I have been fortunate enough to experience each of these types of true love. Destiny, however, will be revealed in the right time.
  • For the past 10 years, I have been working in the fashion industry in areas from Sales to Trend Analysis, Marketing and Press to Editorial and Social Media. Always based in NYC, I have had the opportunity to travel the globe, meet tons of designers, brands and like-minded people across the way.
  • Networking and connecting people has always been the most emotionally rewarding part of what I do. In addition to all that, I have been mentored by a private investigator, worked in a coffee shop, written a memoir, proposed a major role for a TV series and lived a life almost no one who ever believe. Without a doubt, I have done more in a decade than most people do in a lifetime.
  • There is great magnitude of what can be achieved through the support of your contributions. I look forward to receiving help financially, getting certified, starting my own business, hearing your feedback, meeting your friends / family / co-workers and to encouraging you to live happily ever after. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to be properly equipped to succeed with my new venture, $4000 is needed to get certified by The Matchmaking Institute in NYC. The rest of the money will go towards setting up a legal business.
  • As perks for donating, several options are available at discounted rates. Everything from being listed in our database to a styling consultation and one time only prices for monthly memberships.
  • In the event that I am unable to reach my entire goal, I will put down what I do raise as a deposit for my certification.

The Impact

  • Any contribution at all will make a big difference. This is a project that is supposed to be attractive and entertaining. It is meant to bring happiness and hope to singles out there struggling. The idea is to invest in something personal because nothing in this world is more important than love.
  • The drive and motivation inspired by just about every experience throughout my career is what has led me to where I am today. Networking comes naturally, hard work is incredibly rewarding and research is the best part. I follow my intuition and am not afraid to take risks. As someone who knows what they want in life and stops at nothing to get it, I want to use my magical powers to help others.
  • Love, passion, intimacy and partnership are a combination of timing, self-awareness, compromise, acceptance and communication. Dating is a difficult process but it is important in helping one get to know themselves in order to define their ideal match. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The greater the risk, the greater the reward.
  • It will be challenging to get certified without your help to raise money.
  • It will be challenging to start a database without your interest.
  • In the early stages, we will limit the number of male clients we serve.
  • Taking baby steps and taking the time to learn before expanding.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
  • Please spread the word out and tell your friends about this campaign.
  • Invite friends and family to sign up for our newsletter.
  • Contact us to discuss partnerships and events.
  • We are looking for help with web design, logo creation, legal help etc.

story:
The Time Has Come

My name is Zachary McConnell. Ten years ago, I moved from Chicagoland to Fort Wayne. Between then and now, I got a bachelor's in marketing from Indiana Tech and worked at one of Fort Wayne's premier advertising agencies as a researcher for four years, and am now running my own research firm. But one thing that I love has been missing in Fort Wayne, and it's not deep dish pizza. 

It is a world-class fragrance store.

For many years, I was content with the selection of fragrances at existing Fort Wayne retailers. But a vacation to California in the summer of 2008 changed my vision of what fragrance should be. By a stroke of luck, I met Kilian Hennessy of By Kilian, a niche fragrance brand with incredible fragrances - including the one that I am wearing as I am typing this story. As I bought more niche fragrances, I got compliments like crazy.

A few years later, mainstream fragrances didn't appeal to me anymore. Only niche ones did. And even though Fort Wayne is the second-biggest city in Indiana, the fragrance selection here isn't what it should be for a city of our size. People have to go online or wait for a vacation to another city to sample these great fragrances from around the world. 

But this is a city where people want to stay local if they can. Take air travel. When I moved here, people wanted to fly out of Fort Wayne, but often found better options and fares out of Indianapolis. Our local leaders knew that, and began courting airlines for better business and leisure travel routes at competitive fares. Fast-forward a decade, and Fort Wayne International Airport just might have its best year ever in 2015. The same is true in Italian and Mexican restaurants, where the local options outnumber the chains.

I want to do the same thing with fragrance. Both me and Murat, one of my close friends with the same passion, want to build a store called Xscentrik (pronounced eccentric). Xscentrik features these unique niche brands from around the world, along with great European bath and body products that you also can't find here today. (Because we don't want to tip off the competition, we can't say the brands that we're targeting for day one and beyond. But we think you'll love them.) Unlike the stores of today, Xscentrik will make buying fragrances fun, with a one-of-a-kind no-pressure buying experience. And we want to build Xscentrik in downtown Fort Wayne - to be part of the downtown renaissance and to return fragrance shopping here to its Wolf and Dessauer roots.

And to do it, we want to accomplish a world first: build the first crowdfunded fragrance store on the planet. Xscentrik will be a store dedicated to the entire global fragrance community, and everyone who contributes will have their name listed at our entrance.

For people who are buying niche fragrances elsewhere, we want to be their new local source. For people who are buying mainstream fragrances, we want to have them smell what they've been missing. And that is why we are here today.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to get at least $100,000 to start Xscentrik by  the end of 2016. This money will be used for two core reasons: to purchase initial inventory and for initial payroll. A loan will be procured for our lease in downtown Fort Wayne, so the space can be renovated, and so technology can be procured. If we don't reach our entire goal, Xscentrik will still be a reality, but the money will be allocated to our existing consulting business first while we raise additional capital through consulting cash flow. Furthermore, we will be far more reliant on costly business loans that may weigh us down and inhibit our ability to bring in new brands for years to come.

Make no mistake: $100,000 is a lot of money. But if just 1,430 people decided to contribute $70 to our campaign instead of buying the most popular mainstream men's fragrance in the US for the same price, we will have exceeded our goal.

And what if you want to contribute more than $70? Well, we have four levels of perks that make it even more enticing to chip in. If you contribute $100-$499, you get a limited-edition T-shirt. If you contribute $500-$2,499, you get a signed poster of everyone that donated. If you contribute $2,500 to $9,999, you get a framed and signed fine art photograph of a downtown Fort Wayne landmark to be determined. And if you are one of up to five people that contributes $10,000 or more, you will be invited to our pre-opening dinner and launch party - one that is usually reserved for the local media and our vendors. (Per Indiegogo rules, please note that this does not include hotel and transportation.)

Making an Impact

To us, fragrance isn't just something that you put on after a shower. It is a lifestyle.

Both of us have a deep love and passion for fragrance - and for business, as both have business degrees. In our own unique ways, we have built their way in the business world from the bottom up, with major successes along the way. My friend is a master salesman who will provide unrivaled expertise, and I know the ins and outs of business from a marketing and technology standpoint.

And we want to make an impact on downtown Fort Wayne. People laughed in 2006 when plans for what is now Parkview Field were announced. Some wondered why they couldn't renovate the existing stadium. But Parkview Field was a home run - figuratively and literally. More downtown investment followed, like the Anthony Wayne Building renovation and the Ash Skyline project that is now under construction. Downtown retail is the last piece of the puzzle in this rebirth, and Xscentrik wants to be a core part of this.

Risk Factors

Make no mistake: All businesses have risk involved, and I have seen many businesses come and go in Fort Wayne over the past decade. But we plan to use our expertise - and sell great products - to minimize and mitigate these risks.

  • We may not be able to procure the initial targeted brands at launch. However, we have a full list of nearly 50 brands to consider over the next few years - a list that continues to grow.
  • Once open, competitors may try to copy or steal some of our brands. If this is the case, we won't fight it - we will simply move on to the next great thing.
  • People may use our store for showrooming. To minimize this risk, we will focus on carrying brands that do not sell their inventory to online discounters and the grey market at a price where it would be impossible to compete. Eventually, we plan to enter e-commerce as well with the same rules.
  • Obstacles may get in the way of continued downtown redevelopment. Although both major 2015 Fort Wayne mayoral candidates support downtown redevelopment in one form or another, who knows what the 2019 election will bring? We will exclusively support local leaders in both parties that support a vibrant downtown.
  • People may not adapt to downtown shopping fast enough. To help people consider shopping downtown instead of at malls, we will optimize our hours so people can come in before or after the downtown workday. We will also consider validated free parking for customers.
  • An economic downturn may hit. Although fragrance was a relatively stable product during the Great Recession in terms of sales, we don't want to take chances. We plan to offer fragrances at a wide variety of pricepoints, all held by our high standards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there are ways that you can help out. 

  • Let your friends and family know - especially if they like fragrances.
  • Follow our progress at Basenotes.net. The Start! column will feature regular updates, as will MFfan310 (that's Zach) on the Basenotes Forums.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools. 
  • Remember, this store is dedicated to the fragrance community as a whole, not just Fort Wayne. Spread the word across America and around the world.
Sing it for the world,
Zach and Murat

story:
Our Story

We are the Aandhimul Project and have been supporting the Aandhimul village in Bandipur VDC in Central Nepal for over 7 years.

The epicentre of the 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Nepal on Saturday 25th April was only 35km from the village.

I (Lee), cofounder of the Aandhimul Project, was in Nepal at the time of the earthquake having only left the village the previous day for Kathmandu.

After a few days frantically trying to gain contact with Bikram, our Nepali project manager based in the tourist town of Bandipur, I received the good news that nobody was hurt in Aandhimul. However...

What We Need

...many of the houses sustained some damage and a few quite badly damaged. And we want to raise money here to help rebuild and repair, with any surplus going towards helping the surrounding communities and other issues that may arise in the coming months.


The Impact

As Aandhimul is not so remote, and the damage from the earthquake is not substantial, we do fear that they may not get the support needed from larger agencies. This is why we are appealing to family, friends and others to donate specifically for this area and surrounding communities.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are making sure that the people get the support in time for the upcoming monsoon season. And the challenge is to get the repairs and rebuilding started. Waterproof shelter is vital.

Other Ways You Can Help Nepal

You can also donate to other NGOs / Agencies who are providing support to other areas nearer the epicentre, via some of the links below : 

Earthquake Nepal : Accommodation & medical camps

Children of the Mountain – Nepal Earthquake Relief

DEC Nepal Earthquake Appeal

Thank you and Namaste!

For more about our project, please visit www.aandhimulproject.org

The epicentre of the 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Nepal on Saturday 25th April was only 35km from the village.


I (Lee), cofounder of the Aandhimul Project, was in Nepal at the time of the earthquake having only left the village the previous day for Kathmandu.


After a few days frantically trying to gain contact with Bikram, our Nepali project manager based in the tourist town of Bandipur, I received the good news that nobody was hurt in Aandhimul. However...
   What We Need 

...many of the houses sustained some damage and a few quite badly damaged. And we want to raise money here to help rebuild and repair, with any surplus going towards helping the surrounding communities and other issues that may arise in the coming months.



   The Impact As Aandhimul is not so remote, and the damage from the earthquake is not substantial, we do fear that they may not get the support needed from larger agencies. This is why we are appealing to family, friends and others to donate specifically for this area and surrounding communities.
    Risks & Challenges The risks are making sure that the people get the support in time for the upcoming monsoon season. And the challenge is to get the repairs and rebuilding started. Waterproof shelter is vital.


    Other Ways You Can Help Nepal You can also donate to other NGOs / Agencies who are providing support to other areas nearer the epicentre, via some of the links below : 
Earthquake Nepal : Accommodation & medical camps
Children of the Mountain – Nepal Earthquake Relief
DEC Nepal Earthquake Appeal

Thank you and Namaste!


For more about our project, please visit www.aandhimulproject.org

story:
We are a team of young Nepalese women that are collecting funds to donate food and shelter to the victims of the recent earthquake in Nepal. 

We are aware of funds being directed to the wrong organizations. We had the same problem when we  were looking for organizations that we could assist. Hence we decided to form Food for Relief Nepal so we know exactly where  our funds are going. Our team is personally reaching coordinators in different camps that need help and we are handing over the supplies to these camp coordinators in front of the camp population, to make sure people know what they are getting, and to avoid it from being misused or taken elsewhere.

All the funds will be used to buy food and materials for those IN NEED with complete transparency. We are developing a project to adopt a village and help the victims in long run to build houses and sustain them

The INGO's and Government agencies are doing their bit but the scale of disaster asks each one of us to contribute in the best possible way. Please stand up for the victims and help those in immediate need for a better future of Nepal.


Recent updates:

-Death toll: 8,046 & Injured: 17,851 (Nepal Police)
-456 MW Tamakoshi Hydro Dam affected by the quake
-2 out of 14 assessed high rise apartments have been red taped 
-Lawmakers urge government to step up aid works 
-Nepal telecom donates Rs 270 million 
-Israel's medical team returns after handing over the responsibility to the local counterpart
-According to scientists the height of a swathe of the Himalayas has dropped by around one metre after Nepal earthquake (BBC)
-Over 150 tremors experienced in past 2 weeks

story:
Hello,

we are two dreamers from Austria and Germany. We are traveling around the world in our old Mercedes Benz and a sponsored trailer tent from Camp-Let with a special mission.
Using our savings we started our trip in South America with the intention to travel through about 100 countries in 5 continents; meeting, sharing and recording people, seeing the wonders of their lands. 



Our traveling these past four months has been with very low expenses - we sleep in our tent or in cities in our car. We even get help from truck drivers to fill up our car with a couple liters of diesel at truck stops on the Panamericana Highway. To fill up our travel budget we sometimes has worked as a photographer with our camera and our drone.



So the first 15.000 miles worked out really well. But last week after all the good experiences we have made, we made one really bad one. Someone has broken into our car and stole nearly all our belongings. What us hurt most is the lost of our camera. And by bad luck, after four months of good work, our drone had a failure malfunction and is now broken.
So now we need your help to get back our equipment.

What we are doing - the project 5c100c 
Maybe you are wondering, why we are here under the category community? It is not only to get back our camera and drone, it is about to finish our project and complete our car with signatures from 5 continents and 100 countries. 
Along the way, everyone who has helped us in anyway, has signed with a special pen on our car.


And after our journey we are going to donate this car for a good cause on television for a project that benefits children.
Because there is no other similar car like this on the whole planet we really hope that we can raise hundred thousand dollars.


What we need
Before we had a Canon 70d with four lenses (70-200 L 2.8f, wide angle 11-22, 24-70 L 2,8f, 50-1,4f) and our dji drone phantom 2 vision+. The total cost were around 7000 $. But now we were thinking to buy a cheaper bridge camera and the drone, as we really need them to document the journey and our project. So the total cost will be 4000 $.

Rewards for your contribution
We have a lot of things to offer from pictures from the sky on your smart phone, over posters from our trip and signing our car to a visit from us.

Other ways to help:
- Even if you don't have a dollar left, you can share the campaign with all your friends, that would help us a lot.
- Follow our trip on Facebook 5c100c and give us a like.
- Or maybe you know somebody or a company who would like to sponsor two crazy people driving with an old Mercedes around the world for a good purpose.

Thank you so much for your support,

Melanie and Stefan

Here are the pictures to choose for the posters:
