story:
An innovative community is forming here in the Greater Boston area. It's called 'Oasis', and it's a place where we can connect, inspire, and empower one another. A place where life is celebrated, family is valued, and all people matter.


Oasis is, quite simply, a secular alternative to faith-based community. We want to give people the sort of community experience that many of us experienced in churches growing up, but without the dogma. A place where we can build a community with like-minded people, a place where we can refresh ourselves among people who share our secular, humanity-focused values. Oasis events are often described as a cross between a TED Talk and a house concert. In addition to these Sunday gatherings, Oasis communities participate in discussion groups, neighborhood potlucks, community service and charity events, all of the types of things you would expect from an extended local community.




Oasis is a place for humanists, agnostics, skeptics, atheists, freethinkers, deists, even some theists, to come together into the sort of community that has become the purview of churches, and to do so without super-naturalism or spiritualism. A community bonded by shared values, not shared beliefs or dogma.  We are guided by core values, which define our communities. They shape our interactions with each other, society, and the world.

Recent statistics put the number of “nones” (meaning those with no religious affiliation) at close to 20% of adults in the United States. At the same time, people who are openly non-believers are among the most distrusted groups in our society. Oasis is an opportunity for the Nones to have a place they can find a sense of community. A place where we can feel at home, unjudged, and valued.




Oasis is also a great option for secular families. Kansas City Oasis’s Executive Director Helen Stringer elaborated on this. “One of the most important reasons for organizing KC Oasis is children and families. Whether we like it or not, churches are pursuing our children. When my son’s classmates talk about going to a church youth function and how much fun it was, he automatically wants to go and doesn’t understand why we don’t. Lets face it, churches do a lot of fun things with kids: lock-ins, parties, group games, ski trips, etc. When I was growing up, these things were the highlight of my youth. The church wants you to believe it’s all the supernatural stuff that helps people, but the social benefits of belonging to a community is the real magic—a magic we shouldn’t let churches monopolize any longer. As a parent, I want my kids to have a safe place to explore their developing worlds view. A place where it’s not just okay to ask questions, but encouraged.”



At Oasis, our Core Values are:

  • People are more important than beliefs.
  • Reality is known through reason.
  • Meaning comes from making a difference
  • Human hands solve human problems.
  • Be accepting and be accepted.

For a long time, churches have had a virtual monopoly on the types of community that we see forming in groups like Oasis, Sunday Assembly, Humanist Hub, and others, each of which takes a slightly different approach so there is a group to fit the needs of any non-religious individual or family looking for that sense of community.

It’s time for Oasis – a well of compassion and reason where we can celebrate life and, together, make a difference. A place where life is celebrated, family is valued, and all people matter.

Want an example of what an Oasis community looks like once it is up and running? This article in the Kansas City Star, profiling Kansas City Oasis, is a great example of what secular community can be, and what Boston Oasis will be aiming for.



The Impact
Vibrant, tightly knit communities are central to human happiness and well-being; we are social creatures by nature. For this reason, we need communities like Oasis to provide a place to connect, be inspired and feel empowered. 

Furthermore, we need to provide a place where children can explore their developing world-views, ask questions and make friends in an environment that is supportive of critical thinking.

How we are set up to succeed
We are launching as part of the Oasis Network, a group of secular communities built on the same model. The Oasis community model has produced thriving, successful, diverse communities in multiple cities across the nation and we are confident it will do so here as well. We have received, and will continue to receive, guidance from Oasis leaders who have built their own communities, as well as documented best-practices drawn from their experiences. From this foundation, Boston Oasis will develop into a unique iteration of this successful community model. Boston Oasis members will be free to suggest activities and events which are in keeping with the Oasis Core Values.

Where will Boston Oasis meet?
While the Sunday gatherings will take place in a consistent location to be determined, there are certainly some ideas on what kind of spaces we will be looking for. We will be looking for locations which are accessible by car and by public transportation. We will be looking for locations with available parking. We will be looking for locations with good accessibility.
Furthermore, it is important to note that Oasis events outside the Sunday gatherings will take place across the area where our community resides. Neighborhood Potlucks, Meetings of Minds (discussion groups), Game Nights, social events... all of these can and will be scheduled throughout the Boston area, typically with several venues for a single event on a given night.


What does your contribution pay for?

We have set our initial fundraising goal at $4,500 to focus primarily on our start-up and launching costs. If we reach this goal, we will:

  • be able to file with the IRS as a tax-exempt non-profit
  • be able to print the community engagement and marketing materials that will help us be visible in the secular community and attract new members to our launch group and to Oasis as a whole (i.e., things like banners, cards, t-shirts, stickers, and the like)
  • pay rent for event space for 3-4 weeks
In addition, we have set some stretch goals which will allow us to do even more to help Greater Boston Oasis launch successfully.

$5,700

If we exceed our goal by $1,200, we will be able to:

  • purchase a PA system for our speakers and musical acts
  • purchase a projector for use by our speakers in their presentations
$6,000

If we exceed our goal by a further $300, we will be able to:

  • invest in supplies for our children's programming
And the big goal... 

$8,500

If we exceed our goal by a further $2,500, we will be able to:

  • host and market a pre-launch and membership drive event to educate people about Oasis, bring in new members, and publicize Oasis among the community at-large

And beyond...

If we exceed the big stretch goal, or if we fall in between other levels, then we will still be able to use those donations to pay rent on our space, pay musicians for the initial Sunday gatherings, and the other ongoing expenses of an Oasis community.


A NOTE ABOUT TAX-DEDUCTIBLE STATUS OF DONATIONS
Note that Greater Boston Oasis is registered as a nonprofit in Massachusetts and is currently working through the paperwork for 501c3 (tax deductible) status. Once that status is granted, donations made will be tax deductible retroactive to the date of incorporation (5/21/2015)!

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to volunteer?  Visit our website and let us know you would like to help! www.BostonOasis.org

story:
Run4Nepal

Hi my name is Goldie, and I am just one more person like you or anyone else who quite often takes my day to day routine for granted. Do you go to school, or shopping or need to visit a hospital?  The people of Nepal used to do all these things but what they didn't know was that one day it would all change. The lucky few who survived the earthquake need help, my help and your help too.

I cannot build a house, I cannot build a school either. Together however, we can try to raise funds so these homes, schools and hospitals can be built again. "Heal their cracks of fear and help them smile again".

I am lucky to have a lot of friends and family who I can count on, so I am counting on you! I am counting on a global pull, my worldwide strength. Will you be my strength?

What We Need & What You Get

I love running, I love the way it liberates me and I love how I can run away or run towards things. Today we will run together, today we will run for Nepal and help the victims of the earthquake.
You don't have to run fast, or slow.. just jog or trot, enjoy the glide. 
My aim is to raise $1,500USD and you can help by running :
1) 5 KM #Run5forNepal
2) 10 KM #Run10forNepal

It doesn't matter where you are in the world, we will all run on Sunday 9th August 2015 at any time that suits your time zone. You can run by the beach, on the road, in the mountains or even on your treadmill. You just have to run. 

All runs will be justified through a running App of your choice or treadmill screenshot. You can broadcast your run with the hashtag #Run4Nepal via

  1. Twitter @Run4Nepal
  2. Instagram @Run4Nepal
  3. FacebookPage: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Run4Nepal/501965006632904 

Where will the funds go?

All funds will go to www.circulodecooperacion.org
They are a Spanish NGO who have got a correspondent directly based in Bhaktapur, Nepal. Her name is Cristina Po Wenger and was present when the first earthquake racked Nepal. She is dedicated to the reconstruction of the the country and of the school where she was a primary teacher.
They have a blog where you can follow all their updates and progress
www.circulodecooperacion.org/blog
This is the first time I am reaching out like this on a global level so I admit I may make mistakes. However, I believe in helping people and that's what I am doing. You can run at any time of the day on August 9th 2015 and share all your Run4Nepal stories. 
Confirm your participation on any social media network, get your team together and run with me. If you would like to lead a team in your city, I will add you as a team member. Contact me at run4nepaltoday@gmail.com 
Let's have some fun with it. 

Can't run but want to help?

  1. You can spread awareness by sharing the link of this page with your friends and family
  2. You can make a donation and it will go a long way
Thank you for all your help
Goldie

story:
Sustainable Food Solutions Inc. will attempt to address a national problem: 40% of food produced is wasted.

Complaints about the separate bins for plastics, paper, food waste abound. It seems ambitious to speak of a Waste Free world in 2015.

What if we loved our bins. What if they represented a collective solution to the complex challenges ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to live in a healthy community? 

 T. Kay Hamlin developed SFS’s unique Closed Loop Recovery process℠ designed to help usher in the change from waste streams and disposal, to reuse streams and recovering our resources.  Ms. Hamlin has provided thought leadership for environmental literacy and food security activities in Virginia for almost ten years 

THE MISSION:  A Better World With No Wasted Food.

In a world where millions are food insecure, Sustainable Food Solutions, Inc.’s (SFS) mission is to create efficient, economical reuse streams for food and many materials associated with food businesses, with the goal of PREVENTING waste from occurring.

Food Rescue and Composting the missing link between the upstream  processes of food production and processing and downstream distribution and disposal.  We help businesses join the ground crew for food security and sustainability by helping them keep food and compostables out of the landfill. 

Food is not Trash

 Policy and practices of landfilling and disposal are the challenges we face. We  have  pay handsomely for systems designed to throw away our dollars and resources.  We have developed the Closed Loop Recovery℠ alternative to change the Paradigm. 

Our social enterprise will make it possible to compost cost effectively in central Virginia, as well as develop reuse streams for other materials. SFS is also committed to promoting food rescue, and food security by partnering with local non-profits and schools to develop food rescue partnerships.

 If We Reach our Goal 

We believe our community is hungry for this solution. $10,000 will fund the purchase of additional capacity i.e. composting equipment. Funding will also support the back office for composting in our community(a tablet and specialty software), and developing training programs to support community employment in composting and food sustainability.  We will also train the non-profit Food Rescue Educator Enterprise, and their volunteers on the Food Cowboy app which supports pickup logistics,  tracking,  and program promotion. 

 Funds will also be used to support regulatory filings for a proposed 3 ton facility that reuses heat from the compost pile to a learning garden that  will be the at the center of  environmental literacy programs for Food Rescue Educator Enterprise, a local non-profit.  

If we do not reach our goal, Flex funding will allow us to receive what is donated.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out
  • Volunteer for food rescue where you live. 
  • Share our message

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Sustainable Food Solutions Inc. will attempt to address a national
problem: 40% of food produced is wasted.

Complaints about the separate bins for plastics, paper, food waste abound. It seems ambitious to speak of a Waste Free world in 2015.


What if we loved our bins. What if they represented a collective solution to the complex challenges ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to live in a healthy community? 
 T. Kay Hamlin developed SFS’s unique Closed Loop Recovery process℠ designed to help usher in the change from waste streams and disposal, to reuse streams and recovering our resources.  Ms. Hamlin has provided thought leadership for environmental literacy and food security activities in Virginia for almost ten years 
THE MISSION:  A Better World With No Wasted Food.
In a world where millions are food insecure, Sustainable Food Solutions, Inc.’s (SFS) mission is to create efficient, economical reuse streams for food and many materials associated with food businesses, with the goal of PREVENTING waste from occurring.
Food Rescue and Composting the missing link between the upstream  processes of food production and processing and downstream distribution and disposal.  We help businesses join the ground crew for food security and sustainability by helping them keep food and compostables out of the landfill. 
Food is not Trash
 Policy and practices of landfilling and disposal are the challenges we face. We  have  pay handsomely for systems designed to throw away our dollars and resources.  We have developed the Closed Loop Recovery℠ alternative to change the Paradigm. 


Our social enterprise will make it possible to compost cost effectively in central Virginia, as well as develop reuse streams for other materials. SFS is also committed to promoting food rescue, and food security by partnering with local non-profits and schools to develop food rescue partnerships.
  If We Reach our Goal 
We believe our community is hungry for this solution. $10,000 will fund the purchase of additional capacity i.e. composting equipment. Funding will also support the back office for composting in our community(a tablet and specialty software), and developing training programs to support community employment in composting and food sustainability.  We will also train the non-profit Food Rescue Educator Enterprise, and their volunteers on the Food Cowboy app which supports pickup logistics,  tracking,  and program promotion. 
 Funds will also be used to support regulatory filings for a proposed 3 ton facility that reuses heat from the compost pile to a learning garden that  will be the at the center of  environmental literacy programs for Food Rescue Educator Enterprise, a local non-profit.  
If we do not reach our goal, Flex funding will allow us to receive what is donated.

Other Ways You Can Help
 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Get the word out
Volunteer for food rescue where you live.  Share our message   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our goals

At HERA we work to make equality, rights and autonomy a reality for women survivors of trafficking, conflict and other forms of violence. We do this by providing a year-long entrepreneurship training programme for survivors each year to support them to realise their own career aspirations. 

“HERA is offering you a hand... It’s not just a summer course, something that is going to happen and go away... They stand with you along your journey, so that you can become the person that you dream of being.” Alice, 2015-2016 HERA student. 

Why we do what we do

There are an estimated 35.8 million people enslaved in the world. Human trafficking creates approximately $150 billion in illegal revenue annually. Approximately 80% of victims are trafficked for sexual exploitation, with 19% trafficked for labour exploitation.  

Survivors, faced with gaps in their resumes and education, face further discrimination in returning to the workforce or formal education. They risk being marginalised, forced to remain on social entitlements, and even re-trafficked. HERA works to prevent this dangerous cycle by building on women survivors' demonstrated resilience and entrepreneurial skills to achieve their own career aspirations, whether that is completing their education, securing their ideal job and/or starting their own venture.

What HERA offers

HERA is a small, cost effective charity with a big mission.  Over a decade, HERA UK has supported over 250 women survivors through cutting edge entrepreneurship training in partnership with leading business schools and ventures:

More about our HERA community

Over the past decade, over 220 people have mentored HERA students in the UK. HERA’s community of volunteers not only provides support to their mentees, but also gains valuable experience in promoting a student’s career.  Mentors report that the experience is valuable for building their own support networks and for their own personal growth.  Over 75% of the mentoring relationships continue beyond the year. 

We have also received support from a range of organisations and individuals from the corporate and academic worlds, who are drawn to HERA by our commitment and model of change. Our friends from Imperial College, Salesforce, Net-A-Porter and other leading organisations donate their time to provide training and seminars to our students. 

How you can help

Donations: In order to meet a growing demand from prospective students, the HERA team is fund raising to continue delivering and testing cutting edge entrepreneurship training and mentoring for UK-based survivors.  Our eventual goal is to raise a £2 million endowment to sustain HERA’s programme at Imperial College, which will in turn serve as a laboratory and resource for programmes in other countries (including the US, France, and countries in Central and Eastern Europe).   Your support will be the first step in scaling up HERA’s own venture to make a global difference.

HERA’s exceptionally low level of overheads is only possible through the generosity of numerous volunteers and Imperial’s philanthropy.  HERA also has only one full time equivalent staff person in the UK.  With more funds, HERA could admit more students and further decrease its average cost per student:

Join us

There are many ways that you can join the HERA community:

  • Volunteer as a mentor or organiser
  • Provide specialised business, educational, or career support to the students and their mentors
  • Host a seminar, social event or lecture for students and mentors
  • Provide advice for start up ventures and apprenticeships or internships for a HERA student

Thank you! We’d love to hear from you, so get in touch at crowdfunding.hera@gmail.com

P.S. A little anecdote about HERA that you won't hear anywhere else: For the HERA team and students, the yellow scarf is a symbol of hope and adventure. Each year one of our students is commissioned to design and make a new yellow scarf for their peers. 

Some examples of what our students have gone on to achieve:

Sarah, Textile Designer - "Having a mentor is so excellent!!"

Before HERA, I wasn’t really getting anywhere. I was always unsure and confused about what I wanted to do. Coming on to the HERA course gave me the chance to really think about my strengths and weaknesses. It opened my mind to thinking about what I enjoyed doing and what I was good at. They helped me to think about myself and learn more about who I am.

My mentor helped me build my confidence. She encouraged me and built me up.   Having someone there to talk to about my future plans was really uplifting. HERA has really helped me to think about my personal journey and they have continually offered guidance and support to me. This year I have accepted a place to study Textile and Design at Central Saint Martins. I plan to carry on with my journey, get to know my self even better and boost my creativity. I want to be as unique as possible in terms of my work and go into an MA hopefully. 

Silvia, Law Student - “A big thank you to HERA for giving me a chance to do the course”
I found the course  very exciting, fascinating and motivating indeed. The highlight when doing the course was listening to the various speakers brought by the HERA team. This opened my mind and I learned more about the skills needed to start a business. The HERA course encouraged me and gave me a kick-start to build my life. I decided to go and chase my childhood dream to be a lawyer.
I have just obtained my law degree and I’m looking forward to start a Legal Practice course in September 2014. I am also looking for a training contract at present. I have faced a lot of challenges along the way but I‘m going to continue holding on…reach my goal and be a successful lawyer one day.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

My name is Fiona. I have worked as an Outdoor Education Instructor, Paramedic, and Wilderness First Aid Instructor for the bulk of my career.  I have been known to renovate a house or two and have been found in remote communities providing medical care to those that needed it.

I currently have the opportunity to restore a beautiful old Inn that was built in 1902 and vacated in 2007. Don't get me wrong . . . IT NEEDS A LOT OF WORK, but from the moment I saw it I knew that this was an adventure that I wanted to be a part of!

My passion for sustainability and the environment began when I was a student at Warren Wilson College and I believe that with the help of friends, family and even strangers I can create something special on this 3.75 acres. My dream is to create a sustainable community offering affordable housing in the wings at the back, restore the main building back to its original charm as an Inn promoting adventure travel and tourism in beautiful Western North Carolina and offer the conference space to local organizations for meetings and gatherings.

Crashing back to reality, however, none of this will be possible unless I can add to my initial funds to cover expenses like insurance, urgent repairs, inspections, permitting, and general maintenance.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a huge project that I am sure will present me with many surprises along the way! The restoration of the original 1902 main building to bring it back its former charm will be my first project. If I can get a boost to my funds it will enable me to hire more people to help with this task and we can therefore get this project done a lot faster! What does this mean for you? My goal is to have the Inn operating by next summer so that you can enjoy the perks of your donation and come and stay!

Perks include free accommodation and tours, a brick with your name on it, the opportunity to pick a winning room design, and more!

Every little bit helps! All funds raised will go towards the property.

The Impact

Initially we need to get this project off the ground so that it can support itself while we work on the sustainable community.

Long term goals include rental assistance for those in need, meals prepared with food grown on the property, solar power with the goal of being "off the grid", compost and recycling all waste, and a work program  . . . all while creating a community with the goal of environmental sustainability.

Your contribution will help us work towards these goals.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are there: An old building holds many secrets within its walls, all ready to launch an attack on my bank account in their own special ways. This project is being created from the good will of friends and strangers and will only continue to grow if I can create a business from the main Inn. This part I can do! I have been self employed since my early 20's and I have learned a few important lessons along the way that will help grow the business side of things. I may dream big but, I will always try to help others and I know the value of hard work. I will approach each challenge as it comes along and weave it craftily into my dreams and goals, making the most of the learning that I will gain.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar will help restore this amazing Inn and create a sustainable community around it, but I understand if you can not donate at this time. Please share this link with as many people as you can as the more people we can reach the more impact we can have.

Look us up sometime down the road and see how things are going!

story: I am planning on holding a Holistic Expo in Seattle, WA at the Seattle Convention Center in June, 2016. This would include renting a 65,000 sq. ft. hall for about 400 vendors from the holistic and homeopathic community. This 2 day event Is my passion in helping people find a better way to live by applying a holistic, metaphysical and homeopathic approach to heal the Body, Mind and Soul.   Organic, Vegan, Homeopathic methods and Meridian Dance (which heals traumatic experiences), Reiki, Acupuncture, Yoga, Meditation, Massage and many more methods and teachings will be included in this expo to help you learn to live life to the fullest with peace, passion, intention and purpose.

story:
Actualización: He agregado un traducción español del texto del video más bajo en este página. ¡Gracias por todo que ya han hecho ustedes!

In short

Project Taray provides after-school activities and social support for kids in the village of Taray, and we need your help to create a safe, hygienic, and fun environment. Our three central goals: 

  1. Remove hazardous materials from the site

  2. Fix and clean the bathrooms

  3. Furnish and stock the classroom
The playground is bordered on one side by a pile of dangerous scrap, including broken glass and rusty metal, which we want to relocate. As for the bathrooms, the toilets don't function and the rooms themselves haven't been cleaned in recent memory. Our classroom  is almost completely bare: we have a few mats on the floor, a broken bureau with some art supplies, and a small collection of books. With your help, we want to purchase furniture such as shelves, tables, and chairs and supplies for activities like gardening and sports.
Every dollar you contribute makes a tangible difference--we'll be updating this page with photos of improvements as they happen!

What exactly will we do with your money?

We looked at prices for furniture and other materials (e.g. gardening tools, kits for toilet repair, etc.) at a local store, and the total cost will be about $1000. The other half of the money will go towards labor and transportation. If we don't reach our goal, we'll prioritize our spending to maximize what we can accomplish and you'll still get to see the immediate difference your money makes.

Background

Sonco Wasi, the non-profit parent organization to Project Taray, was founded in 2010 to support the children of Taray after a disastrous flood seriously damaged the village. We provide a wide variety of activities ranging from art to sports to gardening, as well as a way for international volunteers to connect with the children and experience Peruvian culture while sharing their own. For more information, check out our website.

Stretch goals

$2250: Create a small library in Project Taray!

FAQ

Q: What happens if you raise more money than your goal?

A: Our first stretch goal is to create a library in the classroom. After that, we'll put the money towards disposable supplies (markers, pencils, paper, etc.) and toward supplies for dental care, which Karol (the founder of Sonco Wasi) provides for the kids.

Q: What happens if you don't meet your goal?

A: However much money we raise will still make a huge difference. We'll simply buy as many of the materials as we can, and we'll still update the campaign so you can see what your money has accomplished!

Q: Do you take volunteers?

A: Absolutely! For more information, check out our website or contact us at

voluntarios@soncowasicusco.com

Q: Are contributions tax-deductible?

A: Unfortunately, no. Sonco Wasi isn't registered as a 501(c)(3) in the USA, so no such luck.

Traducción Español:

Hola, me llamo Matt Dole y soy el interno del verano para Sonco Wasi, un organización sin fines de lucro basada en Cusco, Perú. Uno de nuestros proyectos centrales, proyecto Taray, proporciona actividades después de escuela y apoya social para niños de edades 3 a 13 años en un pueblo pequeño una hora a fuera de Cusco, y estoy aquí hoy día para pedir ayuda para mejorar condiciones en ese proyecto. Tenemos tres metas centrales que queremos lograr con esta campana: primero, queremos quitar materiales peligrosos del sitio; segundo, queremos fijar y limpiar los baños; y tercer queremos amueblar el aula. Como puedes ver detrás de mí, tenemos mucha chatarra en nuestro patio de recreo, incluyendo cosas peligrosas como vidrio roto y metal oxidado. Queremos recaudar dinero para transportar los materiales a un lugar seguro en el pueblo para que los niños puedan tener un lugar bueno para jugar. También queremos limpiar y fijar los baños. Tenemos dos inodoros ahora y ninguno funciona; por eso queremos repararlos y limpiar todo para tener un lugar higiénico para ambos voluntarios y niños. Finalmente, queremos amueblar el aula. Ahora estamos sin muebles; tenemos esteras en el piso y un aparador roto que contiene nuestros materiales artísticos. Queremos comprar mesas, sillas, y estanterías, así como más materiales y juegos por los niños, porque es difícil a aprender o ensenar algo cuando no tiene suministros ni muebles. En total, queremos recaudar $2000 para lograr estas metas. Gracias por su tiempo y su apoyo. De todos aquí en Taray, ¡muchas gracias!

por su tiempo y su apoyo. De todos aquí en Taray, ¡muchas gracias!

story:
Hi! 

Thanks for showing interest in Bespoke Community Development Company. We are a not for profit organisation which aims to develop a radical new approach to engaging with the community in the countryside, by promoting outdoor health, recreation and learning, in the countryside around, Falkirk, Scotland.

Bespoke was founded in 2011, and has been community owned and operated since day one, developing and building a partnership with the local community and people who share our ethos of getting people into the great outdoors!

How does Bespoke do this?

To date Bespoke has created and maintained 67 km of mountain bike trails and multi-use paths closely linked to the town of Falkirk. Over the last four years a number of highly beneficial training programmes and events have been run off these trails, both by Bespoke and other affiliated organisations. Through this we have gained the endorsement and partnership of Falkirk Council, Mountain Biking Development Scotland and Callander Estate. We have also generated a large membership and volunteer body, and have now also been able to take on two permanent employees

At Bespoke, we are passionate about developing a new model of operation, which engages with the community in a self-sufficient, ecologically responsible and health promoting way. As a community company we have developed, and maintained this ethos, turning the paths we manage into a much loved and well used facility, not only for recreation but also for learning and health. 

Why we need you, internet: the sad story of the wind turbine

Bespoke has already done so much for its community, but now we need you to survive. Right from the start we were determined to develop a sustainable income stream so as not to be reliant upon public funding and grants. We embarked on an ambitious project to develop a community owned wind turbine. Bespoke relies heavily on public funding and our wind turbine was our way of becoming completely self-sufficient. Not only would the turbine generate clean and renewable energy for the local area, it would have also generated a guaranteed and sustainable  income from  the sale of electricity and receipts from the Feed in Tarrif.  100% of the income generated from the turbine would have funded the activities of Bespoke, while also keeping in line with our commitment to the sustainable and ecologically responsible management of land. After four years of work, a successful planning application, several grant applications and many hours of deliberation our wind turbine project has hit a significant barrier due to a delay in completing legal agreements. 

The delay in our project means that the turbine will be affected by changes in government policy at Westminster towards renewable energy. The income we were anticipating generated from the Feed in Tariff scheme, has been dramatically cut under George Osbourne’s recent budget anouncement. This has created uncertainty around our project and we are looking for alternative funding sources until the position is clarified.

Sadly the dream of self-sufficiency and the future of Bespoke is now looking decidedly shaky. The turbine was not only intended to ensure that Bespoke was economically sustainable, it was intended to be up and running by March 2016.  Our current funding is diminishing and we need a bit of breating space to develop an alternative long term strategy  

With no turbine, and no public funding we could be out of cash by the middle of 2016.

This means we can’t:

·  Pay the wages of our staff  

·  Maintain and develop our network of mountain bike trails

·  Pay for insurance

·  Continue to run community based events.

Without our valued staff we are no longer able to operate at anything like the level we have over the last 4 years. The community hub that the trails have become will begin to diminish, there will be no one carrying out routine maintenance, opportunities to develop and expand the network will go and yet another community based non-for profit will fall foul to our governments recent policy changes.

Over the last four years these trails have become a well-used facility in our local area. They have facilitated the promotion of mountain biking and outdoor activity and have only just begun to allow for job creation in our community. The positive change that we have just begun, could very soon be over without your help.

We need £53,689 to fund us over, while we develop new plans for funding our work.  With your help we can take this new support network and community hub of walking paths and mountain bike trails to new levels.

Where your money would be going? Toward building a stronger and happier community of course!

In total we need £53,689. A principal breakdown of our yearly costs can be divided into four categories:

·  Staff costs, £37,560. This is our most important costing, Bespoke currently employs a dedicated team of individuals who are committed to the aims and aspirations of Bespoke. Without their hard work and genuine commitment to their community Bespoke would be a shell of what it is today.

·  Insurance, £5115. Maintaining those paths and trails, working in the woods, using powerful machinery and of course, holding events for Scotland’s mountain biking community. It’s a risky business, and we need to ensure that all are activities are safe and risk accessed before carrying them out. Insurance is essential and often a legal requirement for us to operate.

·  Vehicle and tractor costs, £7783. As an organisation that maintains mountain bike trails, getting around the wooded areas in which we work is vital. Maintaining our pickup truck and alpine tractor is central to our activities.

·  Fuel costs and equipment, £3231. Bespoke is always looking for new and innovative ways to work with the land that we manage, this means occasionally purchasing equipment to ensure that our work is carried out in the most efficient and effective way possible and of course we need fuel and oil to keep or vehicles and equipment running.

These are the four main areas to which any funds generated will be going. Each plays a vital role in keeping Bespoke ticking over, and we hope you think they are as important as we do!

Our way of saying thanks 

Bespoke would like to thank those who offer a contribution to our cause by offering a reward in return. For all donations you will become a “Friend of Bespoke” and receive a regular e-newsletter with updates on our progress and information about upcoming events. In addition we will offer the following rewards depending on the size of your donantion

·  £5 you will get your very own section of trail extending to 1.2m with a certificate showing the location

·  £10 you will get your very own section of trail extending to 2.4m with a certificate showing the location

·  £50 you will get your very own section of trail extending to 12m which will include a specific trail feature such as a berm or rock drop off together with a certificate showing the location

·  £100 you will get your very own section of trail extending to 12m which will include a specific trail feature such as a berm or rock drop off with naming rights (within the bounds of decency) together with a certificate showing the location

·  £500 we will build you your very own trail feature within an existing section of trail extending to 50m which could include a berm, roller, rock feature or drop off. The design would have to accord to the grade of trail and be approved by our trail designer. You will also have the naming rights (within the bounds of decency) together with a certificate showing the location

·  £1000 we will build you your very own trail with features extending to 50m. The design would have to accord to the grade of trail and be approved by our trail designer. You will also have the naming rights (within the bounds of decency) together with a certificate showing the location

·  £5000 we will build you your very own trail with features extending to 250m. The design would have to accord to the grade of trail and be approved by our trail designer. You will also have the naming rights (within the bounds of decency) together with a certificate showing the location

What your contribution could mean

Okay so far, you already know that Bespoke has been instrumental in promoting mountain biking in our local area. But apart from that we have been involved in a whole host of community based projects that are either on going or have been seen to successful completion.

Maintaining the 67 km of mountain bike trail and multi-use paths has been our primary area of focus, but in the last four years we have always looked to expand, and diversify this responsibility, by building new trails, and linking our facility up with the wider area, as part of the John Muir Way project. The John Muir Way, is a 100 m long network, spanning from Dunbar to Loch Lomond built to celebrate the life of the famous conservationist and father of the National Park Movement, John Muir. The Way runs from coast to coast and passes various landmarks including, the Kelpies and the Falkirk wheel, and provides excellent access to some of Scotland’s most beautiful areas. Our trails at Bespoke forms a vital linking part of this network, which is now helping to invigorate a developing tourist industry in Falkirk

On top of linking our network up, since Bespoke took over management of the trails in 2011, we have succeeded in building 16 km of new trail, to add blue and red trails to an area that was largely green. What this has meant is that our trails are completely accessible, but also cater for all levels of rider. The addition of our skills course has also been a great success. All of these projects have been completed by fostering a strong working relationship with our local community, and our volunteer body is largely responsible for the construction of the trails, which are well loved and used today. 

As well as fostering strong working relationships with our supporters in the community, Bespoke has also worked closely and successfully with several professional bodies, to ensure that our facility is being fully maximised in terms of its benefit to the community.

Over the last two years for example Bespoke has been running an employment training programme, in conjunction with Falkirk Council, which provides rural skills training to young adults facing long term unemployment. This training not only helps improve life skills and the employment prospects of our participants but also helps to maintain and develop the trail networks. To date the scheme has had several success stories, with many finding full time employment including joining the Bespoke team. Bespoke also works with local schools providing taster work experience sessions and opportunities for outdoor learning

Bespoke’s activities have also helped to encouraged local business growth. Due to our development and maintenance of the area the site has now been developed as a visitor destination in its own right, with the award winning  Canada Wood Kitchen and Bar and Greenrig Cycles as new additions to the area , thriving and employing local people.

If we cannot fund our running costs Bespoke’s activities will have to be radically scaled back and these wonderful developments will also stop moving forward. Bespoke has just started and we really don’t want to stop! If you donate today, you will be helping to fund a fantastic project that works in the community, helps care for our environment and provides opportunities for employment training and work.

If you can’t donate,  but want to help?

Bespoke is always looking for volunteers! If you fancy it you can head on over to our website for further information.

We would also really appreciate it if you could share our story on any online platform with anyone who may be interested.

Thanks for reading, we really appreciate your support, and we hope you found it of interest.

Bespoke

story:
North South Baking Co. is focused on baking with integrity through utilizing local ingredients in artisan pastries and bread to build a bridge between the community and local farms. 

We are  invested in the communities we reach through the bakery via interactions with customers and local ingredient sourcing.  This allows us to build direct relationships at both ends of the spectrum- the people we source from to create the products we sell to our dedicated consumers.

The loans for the property purchase and construction were approve just in the past two weeks.  Financing is squared away for all aspects except this last chunk of money.  This has been my dream for over ten years. I am purchasing a building because I want to establish the bakery in Ludlow so we can influence positive change and keep growing the bond of the community. The building is in the most desirable area I’ve seen yet for my business and already has solid structure in place for the layout needed inside.   

Currently we operate out of the Incubator Kitchen Collective in Newport, where I rent space to bake but do not have retail sales capabilities.  We have wholesale accounts we deliver to three times a week, a Saturday farmers market and pop up plus other events we sell at which are our only retail outlets. I have started this business from the ground up, investing profits back in to help it grow and it has proven to be successful with increasing demand for the baked goods we produce. However, we are limited in our growth as a business until we acquire a retail space where we can be open for retail sales five days a week while producing all of our products in the same location. We will expand our food offerings the shop to include breakfast sandwiches and light lunch items. 

The Covington Farmers Market has been our home and is our largest retail sales outlet ever since I started this business.  We will remain there to continue our involvement in the community and keep serving our dedicated customer base.

story:
¡Hola! ¡Me presento!

Me llamo Emil Valkonen y llevo 8 años practicando Parkour y Tricking y otros 6 años enseñando con tutoriales de Youtube (muchos me conoceréis como Fury Emil) y ahora hemos decidido yo y mi grupo que, tras tanto tiempo ayudando a toda la comunidad con tutoriales y videos explicativos, queremos dar el salto a la realidad:

Abrir una escuela, Freedom Academy, para poder enseñar estas disciplinas en persona.

 

¿Qué necesitamos? ¿Qué conseguís vosotros a cambio?

  • Todo el material que hemos comprado es de primerísima calidad, tendremos uno de los mejores suelos practicables que existen en el mercado, módulos para practicar parkour, airbag... ¡sólo nos falta un foso! Necesitamos 6.000€ de presupuesto para poder pagarlo y que podáis practicar las acrobacias y trucos más locos con seguridad. Habrá plataformas con diferentes alturas desde donde poder aprender lo que queráis.
  • Todos los que apoyéis nuestra causa tendréis un beneficio ya seáis de España o de cualquier parte del mundo. Entre las recompensas tenéis pases gratuitos al gimnasio, clases, camisetas, sesiones por Skype, y ante todo nuestro agradecimiento más sincero.

 

Impacto del proyecto

Sera la primera escuela de Parkour y Tricking en Madrid y toda la comunidad lo podrá aprovechar.

  • Si eres de España, podrás venir gratis a practicar aquí (más info según las recompensas).
  • Si no puedes venir a Madrid, buscaremos la forma de agradecerte tu apoyo con sesiones privadas de Skype dando consejo con los trucos que más os cuesten.
  • Para nosotros sería un sueño poder enseñar y transmitir nuestros conocimientos a las nuevas generaciones del Parkour y el Tricking y que puedan vivir y sentir la comunidad, el buen rollo, la autosuperación y la alegría que nos han traído a nosotros estas disciplinas.
  • Además de ayudar nuevos practicantes y fomentar una vida sana, queremos que también la gente experimentada tenga un lugar donde aprender trucos avanzados.

 

Retos y dificultades

El mayor reto al que nos enfrentamos es a realizar buena gestión una vez abierto el gimnasio, pero para ello confío en:

  • Que mi experiencia como Gerente/Manager de parque de camas elásticas me ayude a que el proyecto siga adelante.
  • Que nuestra experiencia y cercanía anime a los alumnos a aprender en nuestro centro y a compartir nuestra pasión por estas disciplinas.

 

¡Otras formas de ayudar!

Habrá quien no pueda aportar dinero, de todas formas, ¡puedes ayudar!

  • ¡Compartiendo en tus redes sociales nuestra causa y ayudando a que este proyecto llegue a más gente!

¡Muchas gracias a todos por vuestro tiempo y apoyo! Sin vosotros esto no sería posible.

story:
Introduction to The Cabbage Patch

Hello! I'm Mandy Weaver, owner and operator of The Cabbage Patch. We are an upscale resale boutique located in the heart of central Pennsylvania. Nine years ago the Cabbage Patch opened in a 1650 square foot retail space; with money I had saved from working and a shear desire to help a town so desperately damaged by the 2009 recession. My vision, was to “Create The Cabbage Patch as a place where anyone who has, knows or just plain likes children can save more of their hard earned money while purchasing clothing and accessories for their children”.

As our business evolved, we realized two things very quickly.

First, the need in our community for what we did was far greater than we first imagined. In some cases, having our store available to local families was the only way they could cloth their children without forgoing other necessities like food. While a large portion of our local population received assistance, an even larger amount stayed just above the poverty line rendering them unable to get the help they needed to provide for their children.  We quickly found way to  branch from our “cloth them mentality” to a, “provide for their needs” mentality.

Second, in a world full of "fake" we were able to give our customers some place "real". A place where they could come for comfort, empathy, comradery, a shoulder to cry on, a spring board to feed passions and business ideas, or just a place to come before you got to the edge of the rope you had been hanging on to. We have fostered a community over nine years that there can never be a price tag put onto.

 

Through my business I have also been blessed to meet men and women who have created and run local non profits in our town that have told me stories of the hurdles they face in finding safe, comfortable, accommodations to grow. These nonprofits work with little to no budgets, especially youth managed organizations, so having a place to utilize for meetings, events, or simply internet access to conduct daily activities will be invaluable to them.

When the property we are purchasing became available there was no doubt in my mind that we would be able to utilize this property to further our mission to support our community through the products we sell and the culture we had created.  We are a central artery to the people of Hanover; we have supported them and their families. 

With the purchase of this new facility we will be creating a non profit hub on the upper portion of the building. It will be a self contained office and conference space where local non profits will have access to internet, electricity, bathrooms heat and air conditioning. Many of our local non profits have such small budgets that they often meet outdoors or in peoples homes which does not allow for the most proficient use of their time and effectiveness. This space, will be available to them for their use all year long.

How you can help

The costs of building out this building and having it ready to open are around $40,000. We’ve already been approved for the loan to mortgage the building and through private donations we have enough for the down payment. So now we are asking our community and their villages to rally around us to raise the rest of the funds here on Indiegogo. We’re so close to being able to make this dream a reality and we hope you can help us close the gap. Any additional funds above and beyond our goal will go to improving the physical location, things that in our current plan are phase 2 buildout.

 

The Impact

Your donation will have the potential to create a domino effect of impact. While your donation here goes towards the creation of this space, this space helps foster healthy families, healthy families create strong children, strong children have the self confidence to lead and go on to change this world we live in. At our core we not only reduce, reuse and recycle, physical products, we foster, cultivate and support our community. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk that comes with asking for funding when you are an established business is that people have trouble understanding why you can't just fund this yourself.

The thoughts that maybe the business isn't viable enough to do this, why didn't they save money over the years to fund this?

Trust me when I say, I could not be more ashamed of my 9 year ago self. I am ashamed that I did not, at that time, have the faith in myself and my ability to positively affect the world I live as much as we have.

I am ashamed that I didn't believe that my tiny store in a recession hit town could possibly be successful enough to even CONSIDER buying a building. 

But 9 years ago, I did feel those things, and so I reinvested almost every penny back into the business and thought that donating to causes and running fundraisers was where that money should have been sent.

Now, fast forward and here I am. I own those past decisions that I have made and now I will not doubt the gifts I have been given to help those around me. 

When I opened it was to serve my community it was to support people in their time of need. 

We have made it our mission to serve these people and I will not fail them.

The new vision of the Cabbage Patch will be, “To serve the needs of our customers by providing goods and services online and instore to help them provide for their ever-growing families, whole fostering friendship and community”. No man or woman is an island and in the Cabbage Patch we are all family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? That's okay! Here are a few other ways you can support us:

Please spread the word, post this to your Facebook pages for us, tell your friends and family how we have benefitted you if we have. Please know that every share, every like, helps us to get one step closer to our goal. THIS IS HAPPENING!

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate? That's okay! Here are a few other ways you can support us:
Please spread the word, post this to your Facebook pages for us, tell your friends and family how we have benefitted you if we have. Please know that every share, every like, helps us to get one step closer to our goal. THIS IS HAPPENING!

story:
EMPOWERMENT OF WOMEN PROJECT 

A Project to provide proper sanitation and ablution facilities, general healthcare and a skills programme for the women living in our homeless shelter in Cape Town.

Youth Solutions Africa currently runs a Homeless Shelter for men and women in Cape Town.

We provide them with shelter, a hot meal, a shower, and access to a Social Worker. We have just launched a Skills Programme for men where they are taught panel-beating, and are trained by us, we help them with a CV, certification, and a letter of recommendation so that they can enter the market place. We currently lack enough space and ablution facilities for the women in our shelter – who often are victims of abuse, and have nowhere else to go. The winter is an especially bad time for the women who come to seek shelter with us. We receive donations from the public and the CCID for the meals, and rely on these donations to also provide blankets and a secure place to sleep for the night. Many of the women become long term stayers at our facility, and use our Soup Kitchen during the day as a means of getting a meal.

We also assist the women, children and men of Philippi Township - we have recently built a kindergarten there - we are also hoping to put two women through Skills Training as teachers. So our focus is very much on Women, as well as children. 

We have had to make space on the floor of the shelter, where people sleep on mattresses, due to the high volume of people seeking shelter. We separate the men and women, and as such, they need to have their own ablution facilities, and day-time Skills Training Programme, as well as access to basic healthcare such as HIV/AIDS testing. 


What We Need

This project will include Material support – the building of the ablution facilities (toilets and showers).

The Skills Training Programme for women will be one such as beading (making of bracelets, necklaces, etc), basic computer skills, and nurturing their current talents. We would need basic supplies to get them started on various beading projects, and also access to computers. We would like to enlist the help of Volunteers to conduct the various Skills Training.

The Impact

The management and fieldworkers of Y.S.A. have over 10 years’ experience in working with people on the streets, some of them are former street kids who turned their backs on the street life and have been reintegrated into mainstream society as positive and productive  icons. Y.S.A. takes a holistic approach to sustainable community development by networking with other organizations and service providers. We work extensively in the Philippi Township as well, with a Children’s Programme, a Soup Kitchen in Salt River, as well as the Homeless Shelter. We provide a Social Worker at the Homeless Shelter twice a week, in order to assess each person’s situation, and how we can help them further.

The impact that will be achieved by this project, will firstly give the women in the shelter a better sense of dignity and a feeling of safety, as their ablution facilities will be separate from the men’s. With

access to basic healthcare such as HIV/AIDS testing, they can learn to manage any health issues they may have. With the skills training programme, we hope to give them a sense of worth, let them be able to contribute to society, and eventually join the job market. Our goal is to enable women to reach their full potential by providing psychological, material and social support.

The main beneficiaries will be homeless women in our shelter, in order to reintegrate them into society.

Risks & Challenges

The objective of our project is to obtain funds in order to build ablution facilities for the women in our shelter, to provide them with basic healthcare, and to start a Skills Training Programme for them to become independent and gain a sense of self-worth.

Our mission statement is Y.S.A endeavors to bring about social change through sustainable development and the empowerment of our previously disadvantaged youth, adults and children. We have a mandate to facilitate positive change in society by giving marginalized children, youth and adults hope for a brighter future.

The impact of this Women’s project, will be the empowerment of women who are currently ‘stuck’ in a cycle of despair with no resources to improve their lives. In providing them with shelter, ablution facilities, healthcare access (HIV/AIDS testing, etc), and a Skills Training Programme, they will be able to become productive members of society, and hopefully in turn, help others that come through the shelter to achieve independence through our programme.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign on Facebook, spread the word! You can also donate women's clothing, beads, anything that can help Youth Solutions EMPOWER OUR WOMEN!!!

story:
"It is precisely the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting. " - Paulo Coelho

This quote speaks volumes to my soul.  It has long been a dream of mine to open a hot yoga studio.  My passion for yoga started six years ago when I was first introduced to the practice.  I practiced regularly and it wasn't long before I enrolled myself into a Yoga Teacher Training program. I was determined to share it with others.  When I started teaching I realized how powerful yoga can be. I was overwhelmed by the response from my students.  Teaching yoga gave me the ability to really heal people and help them expand in mind, body and soul.  When I had my son I took a hiatus from teaching. I wanted to focus on him and I knew I couldn't fully commit to my students and the practice. However, the desire to teach has never left me. If anything, it has only gotten stronger. I'm following my heart and listening to my intuition.  The thought of creating a space where people can come together, without judgement, and open up both physically and mentally brings happiness to my heart. Yoga is more than just a buzz word, it is powerful and has the ability to be life changing. It has changed my life.  Yoga brings forth community, compassion, inspiration, light, love, growth, knowledge, peace, but most of all it is the journey of the Self, through the Self, to the Self. 

I would be overjoyed to have this dream come true… to share the gift of yoga gives me a chance to really make a difference in this world.  Please take a moment to check out the details and help spread the word.  Thank you.

story:
Help DateCoop

DateCoop has been providing the community and network with high quality dates at affordable pricing all over Europe. The Coop was born on the road by Ivan Bonafè, raw food pioneer & world-traveler. 

DateCoop is based on 3 simple principles:

  • we choose only products we believe in
  • we aim to create transparent & quality relationship with dates producers and communities all over the world
  • we offer an efficient, friendly and accessible service in Europe

               

THE GOAL! 

This year we want to import new varieties of dates to Europe. After having successfully launched and pioneered the dates & health movement in Europe we feel confident that the products will be VERY appreciated by our supporters! 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 20.000 US$ to raise capital for the initial funding. 
  • This will allow us to purchase part of our first stock of new variety for our warehouse. 
  • The new harvest will include organic sourced quality of dates! 

Therefor we ask our friends, you! and all members to help us in different ways: 

OPTION 1) You can donate a free amount with no string attached (we'll send you a thank you note and some surprise!)

OPTION 2) You can donate and use the perks listed. 

OPTION 3) You can give a "contribute on credit". In this case the donations will be credited as a coupon code for a future order on our site! www.datecoop.com 

(in case of OPTION 3 please comment with a note saying "contribution on credit" and we will email you the coupon code immediately!) 


The Guarantee

DateCoop has been operating with a strong customer focused reputation. Our network comprises a large amount of people that have provided us with satisfied feedback.  The idea really is to continue work for the people & by the people. Our principles are simple yet rock-solid! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute help spread the news! Its about you too! 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Be creative! :)

Cheers! 
Ivan Bonafè

www.datecoop.com 

ps. More reviews:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/support-date...

story:
Our Story

greencents™ has 30 years of experience in energy conservation for homes and businesses. We have a passion to educate consumers on how to make energy efficient choices so consumers can save money and help the environment.  Energy efficient products and regular home maintenance are being enjoyed by millions of homes across the country. These homes see the benefit of lowering their energy bills by installing energy efficient products and standard home maintenance. Reducing your energy consumption leads to a healthier home for your family and mother earth. Unfortunately, the savings and health benefits from energy efficient practices are not shared by low-income families, especially seniors across the United States. The costs associated with installing low-power products and regular home maintenance such as replacing air filters, keeps many families from experiencing the advantages of a healthy home and keeping more money in their pockets. Not to mention that most low-income seniors are physically unable to perform tasks we all take for granted such as changing a LED light bulb. greencents™ wants to bring awareness to the struggles low-income families and seniors encounter in their daily lives by working with one of the best organizations out there, Meals On Wheels Atlanta. 


greencents™ & Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home Repair Services

The greencents™ Energy Efficiency Campaign has partnered with Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home Repair Services to educate and help low-income seniors and their families with their energy consumption. The goal of our campaign is to raise funds necessary to empower families to lower their energy usage and improve the care of their homes and the environment we all share. Knowing that just one energy efficiency kit can save a family over $800 in its lifetime is a great feeling and we look forward to helping as many families as possible.  



About Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home Repair Services

Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home Repair Services keep seniors' homes safer, drier, and warmer through free and low-cost repairs and enhancements inside and out. greencents™ wants to help spread MOWA vision that no Atlanta senior goes hungry, cold, or forgotten. Their mission to support senior independence through meals, shelter, and community is one we are proud to be a part of. Last year MOWA served 230 seniors and 1,708 home repair tasks were completed. They currently have a waiting list of more than 300 seniors in need of home repair.  97% of seniors receiving home repairs are able to remain in their homes and communities six months or more after services, and 98% of seniors respond that their home was more safe and livable after services. 

How does it work?

greencents™ will donate a $99 Energy Efficiency kit to Meals On Wheels Atlanta from contributions made by you! Our mission is to raise 100 - $99 Energy Efficiency kits by December 4, 2015.  Of course we would like to do more, so if we raise more than our initial 100, we will just donate more kits. The sky is the limit! This will be one of several greencents™ Cares programs to help low-income families by partnering up with local non-profit agencies. Individuals who donate to the campaign are encouraged to take the legal tax deductions allowed.

Here's how you are making a difference…

greencents™ energy efficiency packages will include 8 LED light bulbs and helpful energy saving tips and recommendations to show low-income recipients how to lower energy usage (both gas and electric).  The tips and recommendations can save hundreds of dollars every year by reducing energy consumption and lower greenhouse gases to help heal our environment. Many of our customers find ways to save $500 or more annually! These home-delivered greencents™ energy-efficiency packages will lower energy consumption and provide real savings. Did you know... the sponsored families will save more than $1,000 over the lifetime of the bulbs? On top of that, we are all helping the environment and creating a better living for a better world. If you give the gift of “You’re an Official Green-head!” for $199, you will get your own greencents™ energy-efficiency kit so your family can also receive financial and environmental benefits. 


The Impact 

The greencents™ Energy Efficiency Campaign with Meals On Wheels Atlanta brings energy efficiency to low-income families and seniors that could not otherwise afford it. Low-income recipients save money year after year which is very important to them and they can now spend the money saved on other important necessities. Also, don't forget reducing greenhouse gases helps their local community and the environment we all share.

Please also consider other ways you can help...

Any donation is greatly appreciated and will leave a life-long impact on the families who will receive products from our greencents™ Energy Efficiency Campaign for Meals On Wheels Atlanta. If you can’t give, please use your voice to help spread awareness about our cause with Meals On Wheels Atlanta by posting on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. greencents™ would like to ask that you make time to volunteer at this wonderful organization, Meals on Wheels Atlanta. Please contact Kari Morrison, Director of Volunteer Services at kmorrison@mealsonwheelsatlanta.org or 404-605-8454 and help make their 50 year Anniversary the best year yet!

perform tasks we all take for granted such as changing a LED light bulb.
greencents™ wants to bring awareness to the struggles low-income families
and seniors encounter in their daily lives by working with one of the best
organizations out there, Meals On Wheels Atlanta. 




greencents™ & Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home
Repair Services
The greencents™ Energy Efficiency Campaign has partnered
with Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home Repair Services to educate
and help low-income seniors and their families with their energy consumption.
The goal of our campaign is to raise funds necessary to empower families to
lower their energy usage and improve the care of their homes and the
environment we all share. Knowing
that just one energy efficiency kit can save a family over $800 in its lifetime is a great feeling and we look forward to helping as many families as
possible.  

About Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home
Repair Services

Meals On Wheels Atlanta’s Home
Repair Services keep seniors' homes safer, drier, and
warmer through free and low-cost repairs and enhancements inside and out.
greencents™ wants to help spread MOWA vision that no Atlanta senior goes
hungry, cold, or forgotten. Their mission to support senior independence
through meals, shelter, and community is one we are proud to be a part of. Last
year MOWA served 230 seniors and 1,708 home repair tasks were completed. They
currently have a waiting list of more than 300 seniors in need of home
repair.  97% of seniors receiving home repairs are able to remain in their
homes and communities six months or more after services, and 98% of seniors
respond that their home was more safe and livable after services. 




How does it work?

greencents™ will donate a $99 Energy Efficiency kit to Meals On Wheels Atlanta from contributions made by you! Our mission is to raise 100 - $99 Energy Efficiency kits by December 4, 2015.  Of course we would like to do more, so if we raise
more than our initial 100, we will just donate more kits. The sky is the
limit! This will be one of several greencents™ Cares programs to
help low-income families by partnering up with local
non-profit agencies. Individuals who donate to the campaign are
encouraged to take the legal tax deductions allowed.





Here's how you are making a difference…
greencents™ energy efficiency packages will include 8 LED light
bulbs and helpful energy saving tips and recommendations to show low-income
recipients how to lower energy usage (both gas and electric).  The tips
and recommendations can save hundreds of dollars every year by reducing energy
consumption and lower greenhouse gases to help heal our environment. Many of
our customers find ways to save $500 or more annually! These
home-delivered greencents™ energy-efficiency packages will lower energy consumption and provide real savings. Did you know... the sponsored families will save more
than $1,000 over the lifetime of the bulbs? On top of that, we are all helping
the environment and creating a better living for a better world. If you give
the gift of “You’re an
Official Green-head!” for $199, you will get your own greencents™ energy-efficiency
kit so your family can also receive financial and
environmental benefits. 








The Impact 
The greencents™ Energy Efficiency
Campaign with Meals On Wheels Atlanta brings energy efficiency to low-income
families and seniors that could not otherwise afford it. Low-income recipients save money year after year which is
very important to them and they can now spend the money saved on other
important necessities. Also, don't forget reducing greenhouse gases helps their
local community and the environment we all share.






Please also consider other ways you can help...
Any donation is
greatly appreciated and will leave a life-long impact on the families who will
receive products from our greencents™ Energy Efficiency Campaign for Meals On
Wheels Atlanta. If you can’t give, please use your voice to help spread
awareness about our cause with Meals On Wheels Atlanta by posting on Facebook,
Twitter, and Instagram. greencents™ would like to ask that you make time to
volunteer at this wonderful organization, Meals on Wheels Atlanta. Please
contact Kari Morrison, Director of Volunteer
Services at kmorrison@mealsonwheelsatlanta.org or 404-605-8454 and help make their 50 year Anniversary
the best year yet!

story:
A unique way to provide restaurant meals to hungry families in minutes...


4 SIMPLE STEPS:

SUSTAINABLE 
Instant meal donations. Eliminates special food handling.

BOOSTS ECONOMY
Provides meals through local restaurants.

SOLUTION
Feeds families in need. Helps restore dignity and hope.

BUILDS GOODWILL
Restaurants, businesses and people in the community come together.  


What we do matters. What we share grows.

WE'RE CREATING A BUZZ

• CBS 1 Family 1 Restaurant report - click here


Easily promote and share community goodwill.

HISTORY & DEVELOPMENT

  • 2012 : 1F1R nonprofit established.
  • 2013 : Test concept flow and function.
  • 2014 : IT web solution developed 
  • 2015 : Live beta test with Ventura & Antelope Valley restaurants. 

HELP SOLVE FAMILY HUNGER

  • Building a Foundation to better serve the needs of food insecure families throughout our Nation.

  • Together we can!

GLOBAL LAUNCH

The plan: Build infrastructure, launch nationwide and then globally.

OUR BOARD

SPECIAL THANKS TO
CONTRIBUTING ARTIST TANA VIVIAN

Up close, the eye sees a fluid collage of color and brush strokes, but from afar, an image emerges as real and honest as the stories that inspired them. Over 50 layers of texture and color painted and repainting, only being considered finished when the essence of emotion has truly been captured. See the perks for her special limited edition, signed "Spirit of Grace" artwork being created exclusively for this Indiegogo campaign. 

I paint because I feel it's my purpose. The image is for the world; the process is my prayer for the message being shared.   - Tana Vivian

©2012-2015 1Family 1Restaurant. Recognized 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.
All contributions are tax deductible to the extent allowable by law.
