story:
The Boardwalk Rehabilitation and Enhancement Project at the Cosumnes River Preserve is a project we are very excited about! The first phase consists of rebuilding 800+/- linear feet of wooden boardwalk, 400+/- linear feet of concrete walkway, and doubling the size of the existing viewing platform to accommodate ever-increasing numbers of visitors and students. This portion of the Project is fully funded and construction will begin in August 2015. The portion of the Project that is still not funded is the addition of roof over the enlarged viewing platform to create an outdoor environmental education area for K-12th grade students, as well as an all-weather viewing and photography area for visitors.  In addition, a new 250 sq. ft. viewing platform would be installed near the boardwalk parking lot at Pond 5 to further facilitate mobility impaired visitors viewing of winter migratory waterfowl.  The new viewing platform also would be used for our volunteer “Ducks in Scopes” program that provides visitors and student with the opportunity to get close and see and learn about the many freshwater invertebrates that serve as a protein-rich diet for winter migratory waterfowl and waterbirds. 

Each year over 10,000 K-12 students and 60,000 visitors flock to the Preserve to look, listen, photograph, and learn about more than 200,000 waterfowl, shorebirds, wading birds, and songbirds that reside and/or migrate to the Preserve each year.

The Cosumnes River Preserve encompasses over 50,000 acres of prime wildlife habitat in the California Central Valley. The Preserve provides vital freshwater wetland habitat for the many birds of the Pacific Flyway that migrate from as far away as the Arctic Tundra each winter. The Preserve hosts over 250 species of birds each year, some of which are listed by the State of California as threatened with extinction including, the greater sandhill crane.


What We Need & What You Get

The Preserve has received $225,000  of the $296,000 needed in funding to replace and enhance the Boardwalk Trail. Because the project was not fully funded the project as bid will not include the roof for the outdoor environmental education platform, or a new viewing platform in Pond 5.  The Preserve cannot afford those items without additional funding.  This leaves the Preserve short $71,000 in order to complete the project. We have tapped all the partners of the Preserve and there are no more funds available!

It is our hope that the rest of the project will get fully funded with the help of supports such as you!  If our goal falls short we will use the funds for one of the pieces of the project such as just the roof or just the new platform.  If we raise more money that our goal then Interpretive kiosks, additional seating, and the use of steel structures and/or other environmentally friendly products could be installed.

To encourage you to help the Preserve in this endeavor and thank you for your support, we want to give you some really cool Cosumnes River Preserve stuff!  Many of these items have never been offered to any entity in the past! 

 

The Impact

The existing boardwalk was built in the early 1990’s when the Preserve was in its infancy and annual visitation averaged about 3,000 people.  Today, the visitation and usage of the Preserve’s boardwalk facility has outpaced the old and failing infrastructure.  Your donations will be used to help complete important portions of the Boardwalk Trail Rehabilitation and Enhancement project for the benefit of all visitors that come to experience nature at the Preserve. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Without your funding the Preserve will not be able to provide an all-weather, outdoor environmental education area to support more than 10,000 K-12th grade students and 60,000 visitors that come to the Preserve each year.  The Preserve will not add a new viewing platform to better accommodate mobility impaired visitors, and to support our highly successful Ducks in Scopes program.  As one of the Preserve’s most loved and most walked trails, it is essential to maintain, and improve, the boardwalk facilities to provide the absolute highest quality outdoor experience that we can to the visitors and students that have come to know and love the Preserve’s wetlands, waterfowl, and waterbirds. 

Other Ways You Can Help

#SupportCRP by sharing this campaign with other people who are dedicated to preserving nature and making nature accessible for current and future generations! Post it, tweet it, link it to your emails, and talk it up!  Don't forget to follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

Also, please Volunteer Your Time: Roll up your sleeves and join us in fun, creative, and meaningful volunteer activities.  Whether you like to lead guided tours, staff the Visitor Center, conduct biological monitoring, do habitat restoration, or help raise funds for future project; we need your help.  You provide the motivation and dedication and we will provide the rest.

PERKS COMING YOUR WAY!

#1  ( $25)  Bumper Sticker! Receive a Cosumnes River Preserve Bumper Sticker and a Personal Note thanking you for your Support!

#2  ($50) Dancing Sandhill Crane Poster All Previous Items PLUS a Cosumnes River Preserve Dancing Sandhill Crane Poster

#3  ($100) Cosumnes River Preserve TShirt All Previous Items PLUS a Cosumnes River Preserve T-shirt

#4  ($250) Name Engraved into a Board All Previous Items PLUS Your Name Engraved into a Board on the Trail

#5  ($500) Nature Print of your Choice Items 1-5 PLUS a Print of your Choice by photographer Diane Beaulaurier.  Wildlife photographs taken at the Preserve.

#6  ($1,000)  10x42 Brand New Binoculars Items 1 – 5 PLUS a New Pair of 10x42 Binoculars. A popular choice among nature lovers!

#7  ($2,500) Bronze Memorial Plaque (plaque to be purchased later and will differ from photo) Items 1 - 5 PLUS a Bronze Memorial Plaque on the Viewing Platform. What a great way to leave your mark on the Preserve forever!

#8  ($5,000) Plaque on a Bench on the Trail  (similar to this bench)Items 1 - 5 PLUS a Plaque with your Name on a Bench along the Trail. Thousands of visitors will see your name until the end of time!

#9  ($10,000) Name on a Rock Cairn  (similar to this one).  Items 1 – 5 PLUS your Name Engraved on a Plaque on a Rock Cairn located along the Trail.  What a statement of your support!

                       
 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Introducing InScrub

InScrub is dish washing device which gives you ability to clean inside surface.




Constructing


InScrub consists with two parts. First one/ device in which is rotating magnet and second one, sponge. There is magnet in the sponge too. 

Inside construction of InScrub

Sponges

Using:  1) drop sponge in the dish


             2) turn on magnet rotating device

             3) bring inscrub near the sponge from outside the bottle

             4) sponge with magnet inside will begin rotating

            5) with rotation sponge cleans inside surface of the dish



                                                     As Easy as on off

                                                      

        

Inside construction 


INscrub in action 


I started this project almost two months ago, whole designing engineering and inventing of the project was done by me. I have  knowledge in 3d designing 3d graphics, physics, electrical engineering and big experience in solving inventive problems.



As you see designing of the project is almost ended, but work done by me isn't professional and in these circumstance its almost impossible to manufacture good product. The biggest part of funding is needed to make lasted version of "inscrub". At the same time its very important to  well organized team to develop future business plan. Your activity will be  sign for me that, its worth to resume working on the project. 



All proceed from the inventing till testing have been done by me, at home :)


Project developing steps
1) Consultation with engineers in specific fields.

2) Consultation with business manager.
3) Creation of  lasted version of the product.


4) Making mass production model.
5) Using my apartment for testing and developing project. At the beginning , its enough to purchase some machines and materials:  compression molding, different type of plastic and small conveyor line for production. 
I can do by myself constructing and modeling but some extra help will be good for this work.


6) Most  parts of the product will be purchased with funding: electrical circuits, motor, magnets, sponges.
First Construction and aluminium molding  will be 3d printed.
There will be made casting, for hot plastic molding. I have to purchase hot pressure molding machine. Than will be created lasted version of product. After achieving goal there will be made small productioning facility at my department, it will be easy to produce inscrub, because most of the difficult parts will be purchased, there will be made only outside plastic and assembly , because assembling  in Georgia doesn't cost too much.
Product will be sold outside of country mostly with online magazines. Other part of the product will be sold locally, in Georgia.

  If funding won't be full I have decided to try out other crowd funding campaigns or ask some other interested people to fund "Inscrub" . Every cent of your funding will be spent to develop project, even if there will be partial funding I will try to purchase some parts some machines for the beginning.                                                                                       

I need your help to resume working on this project, as a student I don't have enough funds to make this project "alive" That's why I started campaign 

InScrub solves simple problem in the kitchen when you wash the dishes, you might think that there are already dish washers they can handle that problem. Yes there are dishwashers but there are still sponges, because they are cheep not everyone can purchase big dishwasher machine. There are a lot of dishes which won't feet in dish washer but they are still uncomfortable to clean. InScrub is one more step to  more comfortable world. 


Feel Free to ask questions, I want to hear from you !!!!


The biggest challenge while making project is if people will like it or not. I tried my best to make this project understandable, but I don't still know if you will like it or not. This is the biggest risk while making project, if funding will exceed and feedback from people will be good than, this will be one of the biggest reason to resume hard working and developing project.

In this project any other problems are solvable, because it has simple idea of using two magnets, product can be manufactured easily.



I am not only looking for funding, I want audience, I need every single persons thought about this project to make it better and more affordable.


If you like this  campaign please share it to people.



Every kind of help is appreciated.

About me

I am Nika  , I am  electrical engineer student. I have been successful in international and regional young inventors or scientists competitions.  After being part of scientific competitions or having a lot nice speeches from well known scientists or  successful project developers, I decided to try my best to create busyness idea that will change peoples life. Maybe a little bit, but it makes me really  happy when I see people smiling, or having pleasure  with new invention. I want to feel that happiness :)

I will try my best to make this product.

story:
The story of two veterans who are not finished serving...

I would like to introduce you to two decorated veterans who spent a combined 20+ years of active duty service, with a combined 74 months of combat on the front lines in Afghanistan, protecting each and every one of us. We have all been blessed by the service of these men and their fellow warriors and now it's time to give back.

Ryan Normandin served 4 1/2 years in the 173rd Airborne's, "Able Company" & "Chosen Company, " followed by 5 years in the Elite "75th Ranger Regiment."

Jeff Scantlin was assigned to "Chosen Company" 173rd Airborne where he spent four years in multiple leadership positions. Jeff is a Silver Star Recipient and currently serves as one of the Lead Medical Instructors for National Guardsmen at Camp Mabry in Austin, TX.  

As new veterans, transitioning back into civilian life, Ryan and Jeff knew they had to find a way to help their struggling fellow veterans prosper, as they too make the same transition, thus co-founding Ready Room GraphX LLC.

Ready Room GraphX LLC, is a company founded and operated solely by these 2 veterans, specializing in painting prosthetics, firearms and other military equipment.

The goal of both Ryan and Jeff is to take care of Veterans  by offering paint services to Amputees, as well as the firearm community.  They would like to expand their network, in an effort to open a store front, thus making it possible to offer job opportunities and support to even more veterans. These jobs may well give veterans the critical support they need as they make the difficult transition into civilian life, but they need your help.

By investing in this cause you're making a difference in the lives of struggling veterans and allowing Ryan and Jeff to have a greater ability to help bring jobs, support and aid to those who spent years of sacrifice for each and everyone of us.  They would like to give back to the great men and women that also made their freedom possible.

You can find out more and see the work they have done by searching them on Facebook @ Ready Room GraphX LLC.

The story of two veterans who are not finished serving...I would
 like to introduce you to two decorated veterans who spent a combined 
20+ years of active duty service, with a combined 74 months of combat on
 the front lines in Afghanistan, protecting each and every one of us. We
 have all been blessed by the service of these men and their fellow 
warriors and now it's time to give back.Ryan Normandin served 4 
1/2 years in the 173rd Airborne's, "Able Company" & "Chosen Company,
 " followed by 5 years in the Elite "75th Ranger Regiment."Jeff 
Scantlin was assigned to "Chosen Company" 173rd Airborne where he spent 
four years in multiple leadership positions. Jeff is a Silver Star 
Recipient and currently serves as one of the Lead Medical Instructors 
for National Guardsmen at Camp Mabry in Austin, TX.  As new 
veterans, transitioning back into civilian life, Ryan and Jeff knew they
 had to find a way to help their struggling fellow veterans prosper, as 
they too make the same transition, thus co-founding Ready Room GraphX 
LLC.Ready Room GraphX LLC, is a company founded and operated 
solely by these 2 veterans, specializing in painting prosthetics, 
firearms and other military equipment.The goal of both Ryan and 
Jeff is to take care of Veterans  by offering paint services to 
Amputees, as well as the firearm community.  They would like to expand 
their network, in an effort to open a store front, thus making it 
possible to offer job opportunities and support to even more veterans. 
These jobs may well give veterans the critical support they need as they
 make the difficult transition into civilian life, but they need your 
help.By investing in this cause you're making a difference in 
the lives of struggling veterans and allowing Ryan and Jeff to have a 
greater ability to help bring jobs, support and aid to those who spent 
years of sacrifice for each and everyone of us.  They would like to give
 back to the great men and women that also made their freedom possible.You can find out more and see the work they have done by searching them on Facebook @ Ready Room GraphX LLC.

story:
Bloom Ferments is West Michigan's first kombucha company. Bloom is proudly 100% woman-owned and woman-run. We have been providing West Michigan with raw, organic kombucha since 2013 and continue to struggle to meet the great demand here. Our goal is to make kombucha more accessible to those who need it and less of a luxury. Help us blossom in our local community and expand to serve the rest of the great state of Michigan! 


As a company, it's frustrating to not have the funds to buy tools to help us grow. We absolutely need a better way to deliver product, need a labeling machine to help speed up production, and other production tools. Here's what we need:

$28,000: Refrigerated Box Truck

$3,000: Indiegogo Rewards

$1,540: Primera ap362 Label Machine

$1,500: Indie-gogo Fees

$1,477: 20 new Sanke kegs

$1,292: Anton-Paar Snap 40 electric hydrometer

$670: Nutrition Facts Testing for 3 kombucha flavors

$366: 4 new bpa-free fermenting barrels


Outstanding Bills ($10,033)

$4,400: Back taxes

$2,433: Bottles

$1,900: Labels

$1,300: Vehicle Repairs


Our mission is Germinating Culture: Helping Communities and Bodies Bloom and Thrive. Support our project to help us serve our community!

Video production by John Hanson : vimeo.com/89275169
Music by Rachele Eve :  racheleeve.bandcamp.com

story:
The Point's History

In 1972, Judi Gerding, current President of The Point, and other local parents formed an advocacy organization to assist their loved ones with intellectual/developmental disabilities.  For Judi, what began as a personal journey to foster the best life for her son, Steve, evolved into what The Point has become today; an agency that helps children and adults reach their fullest potential. 

Over the past 43 years we’ve filled gaps in services that help people be contributing members of the community. We’ve opened ten beautiful homes in inclusive neighborhoods, created four social enterprises to provide employment training, assisted hundreds of people with life-long career support, offered social activities, and are growing programs to support children and adults in developing social communication skills.  
Our newest project will be The Point Perk, a coffee shop that will sit in downtown Covington, across from The Point offices and in front of our Learning Center.    We will use the coffee shop for paid training of individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and for a marketing tool to teach people in the community about The Point and our services.  
Check out our local new's coverage!
http://www.cincinnati.com/story/news/local/northern-ky/2015/08/20/point-coffee-shop-perk-covington-downtown/32049975/
                                                                                                       

What We Need & What You Get

We have received a grant that will help with the start-up costs.  The grant will cover renovations, plumbing, salary of baristas and trainees, some equipment and permits.  We would like to raise $5000 or more to help pay for equipment cost and renovations/art to attract customers.

In meeting with local roasters, we have found that an espresso machine costs $5000-$10,000, a coffee maker $600, and the grinders $1,000.  

We are also finding that our plumbing budget is well under what we need.  So with high equipment costs and renovation basics to get up and running, we are seeing a need for more money to be able to re-do a floor that has been in there since the 1980s, to  update counter tops, and to be able to afford the right equipment to be a full service coffee shop/espresso bar.  We would love to be able to add a little lipstick to make it an appealing space to visit. 

We would love to meet you!  If you are able to fund our campaign, please come in and we will give you a feel good cup of coffee!

The Impact

We want people in the community to know who we are.  By visiting the coffee shop, we will be able to meet like minded people who want to do good for our community.  We feel that it is important to provide jobs and training for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities(I/DD)to help them find jobs in the community.
We currently employ individuals with I/DD in our commercial laundry, print/logo company and cleaning company.  You will see those showcased in our video.  We would like to increase our paid trainees with the coffee shop and to be more visible in the neighborhood.  
Having a job and being a part of the community helps people feel a purpose and their self-esteem.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation, that's ok.  We just want you to know who we are and to know the services we provide for individuals with I/DD.  Come visit our coffee shop and have a feel good cup of coffee!  We are on schedule to open November 2, 2015.  

If you know local artists, painters, craftsmen/women who interest in showcasing their work, let us know.  We are open to ideas and creative minds.  We are also looking for local bakeries that would like to sell their goods in our coffee shop.  Feel free to contact pmurphy@thepointarc.org with referrals and ideas.

story:
Hi! My name is Dmitry

I’m GIS developer

and I want to share

with you

What is Mapfont

I work with online maps a lot, and I don’t like raster icons, they look bad on mobile devices and high resolution displays. I've been trying to find modern icons, but found nothing that I like.

I decided to use vector icons and now I use a font that you can connect to the site and that can be used on almost any online and desktop GIS.

I create symbols and support the site independently. Anyway, sooner or later I will finish this project. However, to recover labor costs and to my work quick and pleasant, I would like to raise $5000.

I want to create the following sets:

  Transportation   Culture & Emtertaiment
  Tourism   Road Signs
  Indoor Navigation   Industry
  Naval   Animals & Hunting
  Plants & Agriculture   Military Infrastructure
  Weather & Cataclysms

I'm working on this project in my spare time and plan to create about 500-1000 different icons
Also, I want to make several options for raster icons

You can download these right now on the website http://mapfont.org/ and use them for free
All new icons will appear on the website and you will immediately be able to download and use them with Google Maps, OpenLayer, Yandex Maps and many other online services and GIS

Work process

Transportation

Culture & Emtertaiment

Tourism

Road Signs

Indoor Navigation

Industry

Naval

Animals & Hunting

Plants & Agriculture

Military Infrastructure

Weather & Cataclysms

Funding progress

0 Transportation
250 Culture & Emtertaiment
500 Tourism
1000 Road Signs
1500 Indoor Navigation
2000 Industry
2500 I will make more than 5 icons per week
3000 Publish raster icons in different resolution
3500 Naval
4000 Animals & Hunting
4500 Plants & Agriculture
5000 I will make more than 10 icons per week
6000 Military Infrastructure
7000 Weather & Cataclysms
8000 Script on website to make icon font with you options
9000 Script on website to make raster icons with your options
10000 I will make more than 20 icons per week


Thank you for your kind attention. If you have suggestions and comments, please write to me on Facebook, VK, or e-mail or leave comments here

story:
This is our third crowdfunding campaign for Canberra’s very first Cat Café.  All perks purchased from all 3 of our crowdfunding campaigns will be fully honoured.

Campaign 1: Starting in December 2014 our first campaign ended on 3 Feb 2015 with $710 raised.

Campaign 2: After much background work, planning, preparation, premise sourcing, estimated costings and discussions with relevant areas of government, we launched our second campaign in June. It ended on 9 July 2015 with $5944 raised.

Three’s a Charm?  Best out of Three? Third Time Lucky? We hope SO!!!

We are 100% determined and maybe a little bit crazy! We will make the Capital Cat Café happen, we just need your help! 

This is not just a business to us! We both come from working in the community sector and we want to be able to give back to the community as much as we can. We will definitely be paying forward your generosity and support.

Unlike any other cat cafe, we decided early on that we wanted to personally know all the individual cats and their personalities, issues, habits, likes and dislikes. For over 6 months we have been sourcing, rescuing and working with cats for the Capital Cat Café. All the current cats have been, and future cats will be, brought through our home and worked with prior to going into the Capital Cat Café. We believe this approach is in the best interests of the individual cats and will ensure their long term happiness in the cat café. Advice we have sought from experts also supports this, as the cats will be more settled, relaxed and will have pre-developed relationships with the other café cats.


What is needed...

We are starting completely from scratch in a building that is a blank concrete canvas with external walls only.

These are approximate costs of what is required:

  • $100,000: To fit out a full coffee shop/cafe and build the exclusion zone between the food area and the cat area.

  • $30,000: To build at least 3 toilets – male, female and a disability/ambulant toilet as regulations require this.

  • $20,000 (possibly): For separate ventilation systems for the café and the cat’s area.

  • $15,000: To build a separate kitchen/laundry area where the cats can be fed, bathed, groomed etc.

  • $10,000: Legal fees and Accounting fees.

  • $20,000: minimum amount required for materials and furnishings to fit out the cat area including paint, floorings, furnishings and equipment etc.

In addition to this, we also have further costs including:

  • Rental costs for the premise which include having a security deposit of 3 months of rent being available.

  • Completion of the Online Booking System for the cats area.

  • Permits and Approvals.

  • Cat adoptions and care expenses.

  • Staff recruitment and training.

We have ourselves invested a great a deal into Capital Cat Café and will continue to do so. We have sacrificed a lot both professionally and personally to make this happen. We are committed to opening the Capital Cat Café as soon as possible and are doing everything within our power to make that happen! If for some reason, we could not open the cat café, we would return all funds raised through the crowdfunding to the contributor and in the case that we could not make contact with a contributor, we would donate those funds to animal welfare/rescues within the Canberra area.


Not just another Cat Cafe...

So you know what a Cat Cafe is?  Yep, lots of cute cats to cuddle and relax with whilst enjoying a cup of coffee or tea! You probably also have seen a crowdfunding campaign like this one for a Cat Café as most have been set up through the generous support of crowdfunders. So you are probably thinking what makes the Capital Cat Café any different?

Well for starters, the Capital Cat Café cats are not mere felines... They are all Prime Ministers of Australia, Australian Governors General and ground-breaking Australian Federal Parliamentarians!

At the Capital Cat Café you will be able to meet Eddie aka Mr Edmund Barton, Australia’s very first Prime Minister! You will also get to interact with Australia’s first female Prime Minister, Ms Julia Gillard... ok, so not the real Julia Gillard, but our Julia is also an intelligent, ginger-haired leader! They will be joined by many other Kitty-Parliamentarians who are putting litter-wars aside and are forming their own government at the Capital Cat Café and want to take on Parliament House as Canberra’s must-see tourist attraction!

The Capital Cat Café will be completely unique to Canberra and like no other Cat Café in the world! The cafe will be fitted out to reflect the Australian Nation’s Capital and Canberra’s many tourist attractions. The Kitty-Parliamentarians will have their own Prime Minister’s Office and Cabinet Room along with a mini Canberra decked out with all the facilities and equipment a cat could ever want or need!


Who are we?

We are two sisters, animal lovers and now full time crazy cat ladies! We have both worked in the social welfare and community sector for many years and are passionate about helping people and animals! The idea of a starting a Cat Café came from seeing the happiness that our own cat Zanda brought to people’s lives via his social media. Our goal is to make the Capital Cat Café something that Canberra and Australia are proud of. We have been working very hard all year to make the Capital Cat Café a reality. It has not been an easy journey, but we are finally getting there!


What you get...

We are soooo thankful for your support and for every single dollar contributed! We have a whole bunch of Perks we hope you will take advantage of!

We think the best Perk is our “Wall of Honour” Perk! Imagine your name and location fur-ever on the walls of the café? That’s right the coffee shop part of the Capital Cat Café will be covered forever with the names of the amazing people that supported us! We would love to have people from all over Canberra, Australia and the rest of the world! And we want you to be part of it!!

Here's what it is going to look something like...


We also have an exclusive offer especially for our Crowdfunders! A Cat Play Date Perk gets you pre-paid entry to visit the cats at a special discounted price!


Cat welfare is our top priority!

The welfare of the café cats is of the upmost important to us. All the cats will be rescued or rehomed cats that reside permanently in the Cat Café.  We are working hard to find and personally choose cats with the right temperaments and personalities to enjoy and actually thrive in a Cat Café environment. It is important to us to know the cats individually, their needs and their quirks, prior to the Cat Café opening and to do this we are currently building the team of Capital Cat Café cats. Our commitment to our cats is for their life and to be responsible pet owners to each cat we will provide for them for the duration of their lives, even after they may need to be retired from the Cat Café.

The cats will live in kitty-wonderland created just for them.  The Capital Cat Café will be their home. The cats will not be available for adoption, however we will be supporting local animal welfare and rescue groups and doing everything we can to promote animal adoptions and responsible pet ownership.

We are working with a local Vet who is advising us on how to provide the purr-fect environment for the cats. The Vet will visit the cats at least monthly to check on the health and wellbeing of the cats. We are also working with the local Pet Ambulance Service, who be available to rush our cats to emergency treatment should ever the need arise (Hopefully Never!)

We want to make the Capital Cat Café an attraction and place Canberra is proud of! We want to support local business, promote local products and give back to the community as much as we can.


FAQ's

How much will it cost to visit the cats?

A 1 hour visit with cats will cost $12 once the Cat Cafe open. Pre-paying your visit via a ‘Cat Play Date’ Perk will ensure you secure the exclusive price of $10 per 1 hour visit.

Can I bring my own cat?

Unfortunately no. This could potentially be distressing for the Cat Café cats as well as your cat.

Will the cats be available for adoption?

No, the Café Cats will be permanent residents of the Capital Cat Café . We will do everything we can to support local rescue and animal welfare groups and will promote and advertise cats available for adoption.  Having cats coming in and out of a multi-cat environment can be unsettling and stressful for some cats. In our experience, cats often take time to adapt to new environments so we believe it to be in the best interests of the cats to have a secure, bonded group.  The individual cats own personalities and needs are most important to us and we want to provide a safe, secure, relaxed and happy environment for our cats to live in.

I have heard other Cat Cafe’s rotate cats in and out of the cat’s area so they don’t become too tired or overwhelmed, will you be doing this?

No, the Capital Cat Café  will be the cats own home. The cats will be able to come and go whenever they please in and out of the rooms in the cat area. They will also have access to their own special room away from visitors. Visitors will not be allowed to disturb or wake a sleeping cat. Qualified staff will monitor the cats and if needed remove a cat if it became distressed. (We will be rotating the humans instead!)

Are you qualified to care for the Cats?

We have been completing specialist courses in feline behaviour and are undertaking further studies in Animal Care. All staff will be trained in animal welfare and will know our cats individually and be able to assess their needs. Furthermore our Vet will attend the Cat Café at least monthly to check on the health and welfare of the cats and we will continue to consult with them in regards to welfare, behaviour and what is needed to provide the purr-fect kitty wonderland.

Cats near food, isn’t that unhygienic?

All food will be prepared in an area away from the cats and staff handling food will not be near the cats. The cats are will be separated from the Café by walls and glass partitions. Visitors will be required to walk through an exclusion zone to enter the cat’s area.  It will be the individual person’s choice if they choose to take their food into the cat area.  Café staff will not serve food in the cat area.

Will there be good coffee?

YESSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!! The Capital Cat Café will have a full coffee shop with real coffee as well as teas, hot chocolates and lots of other yummy things!

Will you have a cat named Tony Abbott?

No not at this stage... maybe once he retires.

Will you have jobs available?

Yes! All jobs will be advertised on our Facebook page in the first instance so please stay tuned to that!

Are you looking for corporate sponsorships?

Yes! Please contact us via email.

Can I contribute via direct bank transfer or check?

Yes, please contact us to discuss via email or Facebook private message.

I can’t contribute financially, but would still like to help. What can I do?

Please follow us on social media, share this campaign and tell your friends and family about it. The more people that hear about Capital Cat Café the better!

I have another question, how can I ask you?

We are more than happy to answer any questions. We can be contacted via Facebook, Twitter or email. We will endeavour to respond to you as soon as possible, but we receive many questions so please be patient.


Other ways you can contribute...

We are so thankful for all the support and encouragement we have received and we appreciate every dollar contributed to this campaign! If you can’t afford to contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and family and sharing this about this campaign via social media and the internet.

Here’s a few ways how you can help:

LIKE us on FACEBOOK

Follow us on TWITTER

Share our link http://igg.me/at/capitalcatcafe2 with your friends, family and everyone you know!

Write a blog or online article

Comment and tell us your ideas! We want you to be part of this journey with us!

contributor, we would donate those funds to animal welfare/rescues within the
Canberra area.Not just another Cat Cafe...
So you know what a Cat Cafe is?  Yep,
lots of cute cats to cuddle and relax with whilst enjoying a cup of coffee or
tea! You probably also have seen a crowdfunding campaign like this one for a
Cat Café as most have been set up through the generous support of
crowdfunders. So you are probably thinking what makes the Capital Cat
Café any different?
Well for starters, the Capital Cat Café
cats are not mere felines... They are all Prime Ministers of Australia,
Australian Governors General and ground-breaking Australian Federal
Parliamentarians!
At the Capital Cat Café you will be
able to meet Eddie aka Mr Edmund Barton, Australia’s very first Prime Minister!
You will also get to interact with Australia’s first female Prime Minister, Ms
Julia Gillard... ok, so not the real Julia Gillard, but our Julia is also an
intelligent, ginger-haired leader! They will be joined by many other
Kitty-Parliamentarians who are putting litter-wars aside and are forming their
own government at the Capital Cat Café and want to take on Parliament House as
Canberra’s must-see tourist attraction!
The Capital Cat Café will be completely
unique to Canberra and like no other Cat Café in the world! The cafe will
be fitted out to reflect the Australian Nation’s Capital and Canberra’s many
tourist attractions. The Kitty-Parliamentarians will have their own Prime
Minister’s Office and Cabinet Room along with a mini Canberra decked out with
all the facilities and equipment a cat could ever want or need!Who are we?
We are two sisters, animal lovers and
now full time crazy cat ladies! We have both worked in the social welfare and
community sector for many years and are passionate about helping people and
animals! The idea of a starting a Cat Café came from seeing the happiness that
our own cat Zanda brought to people’s lives via his social
media. Our goal is to make the Capital Cat Café something that Canberra and
Australia are proud of. We have been working very hard all year to make the
Capital Cat Café a reality. It has not been an easy journey, but we are finally
getting there! 
What you get...
We are soooo thankful for your support
and for every single dollar contributed! We have a whole bunch of Perks we hope
you will take advantage of!
We think the best Perk is our “Wall
of Honour” Perk! Imagine your name and location fur-ever on the walls
of the café? That’s right the coffee shop part of the Capital Cat Café will be
covered forever with the names of the amazing people that supported us! We
would love to have people from all over Canberra, Australia and the rest of the
world! And we want you to be part of it!! 
Here's what it is going to look
something like...

We also have an exclusive offer
especially for our Crowdfunders! A Cat Play Date Perk gets you pre-paid entry
to visit the cats at a special discounted price! 
Cat welfare is our top priority!
The welfare of the café cats is of the
upmost important to us. All the cats will be rescued or rehomed cats that reside
permanently in the Cat Café.  We are working hard to find and personally
choose cats with the right temperaments and personalities to enjoy and actually
thrive in a Cat Café environment. It is important to us to know the cats
individually, their needs and their quirks, prior to the Cat Café opening and
to do this we are currently building the team of Capital Cat Café cats. Our
commitment to our cats is for their life and to be responsible pet owners to
each cat we will provide for them for the duration of their lives, even after
they may need to be retired from the Cat Café.
The cats will live in kitty-wonderland
created just for them.  The Capital Cat Café will be their home. The cats
will not be available for adoption, however we will be supporting local animal
welfare and rescue groups and doing everything we can to promote animal
adoptions and responsible pet ownership. 
We are working with a local Vet who is
advising us on how to provide the purr-fect environment for the cats. The Vet
will visit the cats at least monthly to check on the health and wellbeing of
the cats. We are also working with the local Pet Ambulance Service, who be
available to rush our cats to emergency treatment should ever the need arise
(Hopefully Never!)
We want to make the Capital Cat Café an
attraction and place Canberra is proud of! We want to support local business,
promote local products and give back to the community as much as we can. 
FAQ's
How much will it cost
to visit the cats?
A 1 hour visit with
cats will cost $12 once the Cat Cafe open. Pre-paying your visit via a ‘Cat
Play Date’ Perk will ensure you secure the exclusive price of $10 per 1 hour
visit.
Can I bring my own
cat?
Unfortunately no.
This could potentially be distressing for the Cat Café cats as well as your
cat.
Will the cats be
available for adoption?
No, the Café Cats
will be permanent residents of the Capital Cat Café . We will do
everything we can to support local rescue and animal welfare groups and will
promote and advertise cats available for adoption.  Having cats coming in
and out of a multi-cat environment can be unsettling and stressful for some
cats. In our experience, cats often take time to adapt to new environments so
we believe it to be in the best interests of the cats to have a secure, bonded
group.  The individual cats own personalities and needs are most important
to us and we want to provide a safe, secure, relaxed and happy environment for
our cats to live in. 
I have heard other
Cat Cafe’s rotate cats in and out of the cat’s area so they don’t become too
tired or overwhelmed, will you be doing this?
No, the Capital Cat
Café  will be the cats own home. The cats will be able to come and go
whenever they please in and out of the rooms in the cat area. They will also
have access to their own special room away from visitors. Visitors will not be
allowed to disturb or wake a sleeping cat. Qualified staff will monitor the
cats and if needed remove a cat if it became distressed. (We will be rotating
the humans instead!)
Are you qualified to
care for the Cats?
We have been
completing specialist courses in feline behaviour and are undertaking further
studies in Animal Care. All staff will be trained in animal welfare and will
know our cats individually and be able to assess their needs. Furthermore our
Vet will attend the Cat Café at least monthly to check on the health and
welfare of the cats and we will continue to consult with them in regards to
welfare, behaviour and what is needed to provide the purr-fect kitty
wonderland.
Cats near food, isn’t
that unhygienic?
All food will be
prepared in an area away from the cats and staff handling food will not be near
the cats. The cats are will be separated from the Café by walls and glass
partitions. Visitors will be required to walk through an exclusion zone to
enter the cat’s area.  It will be the individual person’s choice if they
choose to take their food into the cat area.  Café staff will not serve
food in the cat area.
Will there be good
coffee?
YESSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!
The Capital Cat Café will have a full coffee shop with real coffee as well as
teas, hot chocolates and lots of other yummy things!
Will you have a cat
named Tony Abbott?
No not at this
stage... maybe once he retires.
Will you have jobs
available?
Yes! All jobs will be
advertised on our Facebook page in the first instance so please stay tuned to
that!
Are you looking for
corporate sponsorships?
Yes! Please contact
us via email.
Can I contribute via
direct bank transfer or check?
Yes, please contact
us to discuss via email or Facebook private message.
I can’t contribute
financially, but would still like to help. What can I do?
Please follow us on
social media, share this campaign and tell your friends and family about it.
The more people that hear about Capital Cat Café the better! 
I have another
question, how can I ask you?
We are more than
happy to answer any questions. We can be contacted via Facebook, Twitter or
email. We will endeavour to respond to you as soon as possible, but we receive
many questions so please be patient. Other ways you can contribute...
We are so thankful for all the support
and encouragement we have received and we appreciate every dollar contributed
to this campaign! If you can’t afford to contribute financially, you can still
help by telling your friends and family and sharing this about this campaign
via social media and the internet. 
Here’s a few ways how you can help:

LIKE us on FACEBOOK
Follow us
on TWITTER
Share our
link http://igg.me/at/capitalcatcafe2
with your friends, family and everyone you know!
Write a blog or online article
Comment and tell us your ideas! We want you to be part of this
journey with us!

story:
Help Radio Free Sarawak (RFS), the independent station which is dedicated to the concerns of the rainforest peoples of Borneo, continue to provide an alternative and independent source of news during the upcoming state election. RFS is the only independent platform where these forest dwellers, who are struggling against state-backed logging, land grabs and indigenous rights abuses can let their voice be heard. 

WHO WE ARE

Malaysia has long been recognised as country where media freedom is heavily  restricted and where government linked figures have monopoly ownership over the mainstream media. It was in this context that Radio Free Sarawak was set up by Sarawak-born investigative journalist Clare Rewcastle Brown and indigenous Iban radio DJ Peter John Jaban in 2010. Radio Free Sarawak broadcasts via shortwave predominantly in Iban language to cater to the largest indigenous group in Sarawak and in Bahasa Malay. 
Sarawak remains one of Malaysia's richest states in terms of natural resources (timber and oil extraction), but its people are among the country's poorest. Many rural communities are still without access to adequate healthcare and education - some are even considered stateless and without identification documents, despite the fact that their lands have been plundered for billions of dollars worth of timber and resources. 

Violent land grabs, illegal logging, conflict palm oil, mega-dam construction, resource extraction, vote buying and thousands of illegal foreign workers...these are just some of the issues plaguing Sarawak, but do the rural communities normally get a chance to say what they really think about them or hear voices that do not tow the government line? 

Radio Free Sarawak gives the ordinary folk of the East Malaysian state of Sarawak their voice back and the chance to raise their own agendas and even to criticise the plans being made on their behalf. 

FREE MEDIA

Since 2011, the Malaysian government have led a well-funded campaign to discredit our show including arresting activists who tried to distribute CDs containing our programmes, using mainstream media to accuse us of 'sedition' and 'poisoning minds' and by jamming us over the airwaves. Such interference with freedom of expression has been condemned by international organisations such as Human Rights Watch, Reporters Without Borders and ARTICLE 19. 

Our social media platforms have also been an important tool for sharing news from the jungle interior with urbanites and the international community. In 2013 and 2014, we went on to win awards from the International Press Institute for 'Pioneering Free Media' and Queensland University for 'Communication For Social Change'. From 2012 onwards we have provided listeners with the opportunity to call in via our hotline and share their news with us. We have been amazed at the response and encouraged to hear empowered native communities bravely speak out on issues such as environmental destruction, land grabbing, violence, corruption and election bribery. 

GRASSROOTS SUPPORT

"Political awareness is on the increase in Sarawak, and Sarawakians are beginning to speak up for democracy and fair elections. The rural communities are letting go of the fear and helplessness that had held them hostage for so long. Sarawakians owe a huge debt of gratitude to RFS." - Nicholas Mujah, Chairman Sarawak Dayak Iban Association (SADIA) 

"For us, RFS is a very important channel to reach the rural population where all the mega dams could be built. In most of rural Sarawak, the only contact with the outside world is the government owned radio and television broadcast. The information from those channels are bias and heavily censored. RFS is a channel we can use to broadcast information about the environmental and social impact of mega dams to Sarawak." - Peter Kallang, Chairman SAVE Rivers 

WHY WE NEED YOU!
With an important state election coming up we desperately NEED YOUR HELP to keep our show on the airwaves. We are the only alternative voice to the mainstream media in Sarawak and provide an important platform to the rural forest-dependent communities who live there. Without us there is no alternative news and no platform for them to air their grievances. 
Your support will enable us to cover the costs of:
- Broadcast fees
- Staff

WANT TO KNOW MORE?

Check out Radio Free Sarawak's sister project, Sarawak Report, an investigative news portal uncovering corruption linked to the destruction of the Borneo rainforest and our Baram Dam Blockade Support Page for an update on the community led action. 

Please support us by:
1. DONATING to this project.
2. EMAILING this page and videos to your friends and family.
3. SHARING this page and videos on Facebook, Twitter and other social media.

LISTEN TO OUR SHOW:

VIDEO ABOUT RADIO FREE SARAWAK:



RADIO FREE SARAWAK WINS THE COMMUNICATION FOR SOCIAL CHANGE AWARD FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF QUEENSLAND:

story:
Here is an idea of one of the seven categories.

This video shows another category, and a real testimony that usually happens in the game.




We all know there's a huge difference between an empty life and a life that has Jesus. Jesus is revealed to us in the Bible, a book inspired by God. (2 Tim 3:16) so when we are sharing time around the Bible, we are actually sharing many blessings that will change lives, because that's what he said on Isaiah 55:11, "so is my word that goes out from my mouth: it will not return to me empty, but will accomplish what I desire, and achieve the purpose for which I sent it"




Reading the Bible is really fun and now with this game, it will be easier. In a really fun game every player will discover great verses that will let everybody know who Jesus really is.


This is a board game, really different from other biblical games. This is not a trivia game. It's not made to probe your knowledge. It's been made to make the Bible, fun.

Every single person that has played with The Bible Supergame, wants to play again and to share it with more people. That's why we have to take it to the big leagues of games.

We made it really pro. It's ready so everyone can play.

if you have other board games like the one about life, or the one with hotels and stuff, you must have THE BIBLE SUPERGAME.




My name is Cristian Becerra. I used to be a youth pastor, and some day, I tried to do my best to capture the attention of my kids into the Bible. That's when I came up with The Bible Supergame. 

We ( me and my family) realized that this game is perfect for every family that wants a relationship with the Bible. In that moment God sent us a great team: designers, producers, creatives, experts in marketing, logistic, and more.

Right now, I'm the pastor of a new church, and the inventor of The Bible Supergame.

story:
ZenShed:   The Little Building That Could

It all started when I wanted to build myself a tiny cabin on a tiny piece of land.  It appeared affordable; plus, I revelled in the simplicity of it and in the feeling of security it gave to me.  However, as I started to investigate how to go about making this idea a reality I was astonished at the restrictions I came across.  I was told the words "you can't" - more times than I liked. So, in response, I decided to create "the little building that could" - what I now call the ZenShed.

In 2015 my first unit was built. Over several weeks I watched the thoughtful completion of "the little building that could".  This tiny building (8'x12') with high ceilings (10'), great insulation for year-round weather conditions (good sound insulation as well), a bright and cheery demeanor and an excellent cross-breeze, came into reality.  

This was a collaborative process with my monk friends at a local Monastery and was ultimately donated to them. This opportunity provided me a chance to explore  the logistics of the build and the angles of my business idea. For instance I  established the weight at approximately 2200 lbs, the best delivery method for the panels, the special cutting it entailed plus ways to simplify the process.  Most of all though, it gave me my hoped for insight into how it could be tidily  FLAT-PACKED like an IKEA product with "easy" assembly instructions.


Meditation Postures

I'm well aware of the fact that in most municipalities in North America and also many other places in the world - you need a permit if you are building something to live in or sleep in.  I understand the need for rules and regulations so that we aren't all living in dangerous Shantytowns;  but, the "control factor" seems a little out of hand to me.

This product will be sold primarily as personal space for meditation. There are four official meditation postures. The first one is the sitting posture. The second is standing, The third posture is walking. The fourth meditation posture, as taught by Siddartha Gautama...the man we call the Buddha ...that fourth posture is the lying position. IT'S TRUE! 


What's Your Cave or "Zen" ?

ZenShed is being touted primarily as a Meditation ZenShed but the point is that it's a personal cave for whatever is your "Zen".   Everybody has their own special need for private/personal space - a place just for them. So, as the video encourages you to explore...what's YOUR Zen? Maybe it is meditation but it could be yoga, music, movies, reading, writing, painting... It could be anything - the possibilities are endless.


The Social Impact

I would love for my efforts to contribute to the limited number of dignified shelter options that exist for the homeless - both people on the streets and refugees.  As well, I feel that this type of space could help relieve the over-crowding issues that so many of our First Nation's people are experiencing. These units being fully and highly insulated, quick to erect, legal to transport and permit-free to build could, at the very least,  be temporary solutions in crisis situations.  


Tiny Home

The unit does not have plumbing and it is not a tiny home. It's...well...it's a ZenShed.  Saying that, though it is not being sold as a tiny home - putting two of them together does actually make quite a nice little space and plumbing is easy to add. Permits are required. 


What's Next?

I want to see how I can make it simpler and even more affordable. It's already well under $10,000 but I know I can do better. I want to refine the process so that it can be closer to finished yet still efficiently flat-packed  and with "easier" to follow assembly instructions for both exterior and interior components.  As well, even though the foundation and deck won't be included, I would like to have some plans put together that people could use. 

I want to create models for off-grid usage (solar power and heat), and an out-door lifestyle unit (wrap-a-round deck options, putting two units 4' apart with a roof between them covering the outdoor kitchen, extra storage, a compost toilet  and perhaps even a sauna!).  Finally, I am connected to an amazing artist, Gregori Robinson, who I would work with to create an "Art Nouveau" unit with more curves and funk to it all - inside and out. 


Campaign Goal$

The goal set out here is to help financially support the on-going research and development that's needed to refine the idea and product. I've ascertained that the amount  requested will allow at least one more unit to be both built and experimented with for off-grid, outdoor lifestyle, art nouveau and possibly a trailer option.


For You!

I've tried to be creative by putting together an unusual array of perk packages. Some are fun (stickers) and some are from other projects I've been involved in through an earlier company called Lila. The novel Solar Stove/BBQ plus $$ coupons, at the high end, are there so you can try to get ahead of the crowd with a unique solar product PLUS use it eventually when you purchase your own ZenShed!  


The coupons are for use against the products coming out of this next phase of R & D which is expected to take place over the summer.

I am grateful for your interest.  Even if you are not able to contribute financially, any sharing of this campaign would be most appreciated.  
Thank you!!

The coupons are for use against the products coming out of this next phase of R & D which is expected to take place over the summer.



I am grateful for your interest.  Even if you are not able to contribute financially, any sharing of this campaign would be most appreciated.  


Thank you!!

story:
Welcome, We are With Respect, LLC

Creating a culture of respect and equity is not as easy as you may think.

Our process was developed using the research from several sources and training techniques developed over years of practice.

The development of Policy, Procedure,and Practice

with focus on

Community, Communication, and Conflict.

We provide solutions through tools and strategies designed to create and support equity and respect in organizations and business. We help businesses that want to do more good in the world put those intentions into action. Our programs are able to help organizations avoid and heal from many of the issues and their symptoms that disrupt productivity, create poor community relations and decrease profits.

Symptoms that show up in organizations include workplace bullying & harassment, drama & gossip, as well as high employee turnover and litigation. These symptoms are the beginning of larger issues that include racism, sexism, violence, and suicide. Ultimately, our work prevents these symptoms and their issues from reoccurring.

With our research-based programs we have been able to help small programs and organizations improve their cultures and practices to be able to meet and expand their goals. This work has been effective, well-received and life changing for the individuals and organizations that have had access.

Their support and enthusiasm for the changes we have helped them make and the results felt throughout their programs were the impetus for the development of bigger programs. This campaign will allow us to expand our reach with the tools and skills needed to support equity and respect. 

We work hand in hand with organizations to empower them to create positive impacts in our communities and our world.

We look at and address each organization's policies, procedures and practices through the lenses of respect and equity.  Our research-based strategies help those organizations build culture and processes that sustainably support their goals.

All of the tools and programs that we have developed are based on research from several internationally known sources. The tools and strategies have been created and used in our own company.

What We Need & What You Get

We are painfully aware of how little we understand B2B (business to business) marketing.

We need your help!

Our research shows that the best use of money, energy and time is to hire professionals who do B2B marketing. We also need the time to create training for more staff and materials for larger organizations.

This is where your financial contributions will go:

Marketing – hire & produce campaign. This is the expected cost to hire a B2B marketer and afford the recommended campaign they design. Our research indicates this will cost a minimum of $20,000.00 to get started with a B2B marketing company. That includes branding and developing strategies of exactly how we will represent With Respect, LLC and get the information in front of our target audience.

Software & Tech Upgrades. This is a correlated cost to the marketing costs. It represents our anticipated cost for ensuring we have the necessary software and technology to effectively create, utilize, and track our new marketing experience. 

Program/Product Development. It will require time and production costs for the expanded program and product development. This is the paid wage for those working as well as printing and producing of the forms, materials, and consumables.

Indiegogo Campaign Costs. These are the fees incurred through the programs and credit card companies as well as the cost to develop and distribute the perks items.

In addition to helping us reach out to organizations who want to support the growing movement towards respect and equity, you will receive our eternal gratitude!

R.E.S.P.E.C.T.!

Find out what it means to me!

And you can show how much it means to you too with our t-shirts, posters and bumper stickers that proclaim your support.

      


Change the World

We all want to change the world, With Respect can give progressive organizations and companies the tools and skills to truly do just that.

Your contribution will allow us to reach out to organizations and collaboratively start building cultures of respect and equity that will positively impact not just the organizations themselves, but the communities they serve, having a global impact.

Your contribution will literally help change the world!

    Risks & Challenges

    If our program and services are not marketed well, we will not be able to reach the progressive companies that need and want our services. If we do not have the time to vet the program on larger organizations there is the possibility of missing important considerations. Those are the risks we run without the support of this campaign.

    Regardless of whether we reach our campaign goal or not, we will continue to further our work, putting the monies we do receive towards a minimal marketing campaign and completing the training for new staff as we roll forward (building the plane while it's flying). This will limit our impact.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can not contribute, or have already committed yourself elsewhere, and would still like to do something to support us , or even if you have already contributed here,

    please share our campaign, or the website or the Facebook page, or the linked-in page...

    Talk about us, tell people what we are doing and help generate excitement in building respect into our culture!

    And as always, you have our Gratitude for your support!

story:
What Are We All About?

At Eco-Lux we want to make it as easy as possible for our customers to reduce plastic waste in their home by selling alternative renewable products, while educating people on how they can easily reduce plastic. Eco-Lux will donate to non-profit organizations that are against plastic waste(for more info read down below)   

How Can You Help Reduce Plastic?

Simple, help me meet my goal and I will show my appreciation by always dedicating a certain percentage of my funds to help reduce plastic worldwide.

1) If the goal is met within 48 hours we will dedicate 10% of the funds forever to help reduce plastic.

2) If the goal is doubled within a week we will dedicate 15%of our funds to help reduce plastic.

3) If the goal is tripled within two weeks we will dedicate 20% of our funds to help reduce plastic and educate our consumers about the effects of plastic.

(If we aren't funded on the first 48 hours that doesn't mean that the others two options are no longer viable)

How Eco-Lux Got Here, And Why We Aim To Help Others Reduce Plastic!

Hello, my name is Jouke Nijnens and I am so dedicated to reducing plastic for three main reasons.

Primarily, it was my father that inspired me to reduce, re-use, and be mindful of our ecosystem. He always insisted that we turn off the lights and to never use plastic bottles or bags because they are here for much longer than we are.

My education in school, specifically in environmental science class, because it taught me how plastic pollution damages our environment and our earth as a whole. (Tons of it are in the ocean)

Lastly, it was my life changing trip to Ghana. I went to Ghana to volunteer and help build a composting toilet. The trip was amazing and one of Ghana's biggest problems is plastic waste.

If you don't believe me see what www.ghanaweb.com had to say about it!

Once I looked around a bit I noticed that it was not just Ghana's problem but it is universal. (Like here in Manila)

I decided I had to research more about plastic pollution and it soon consumed much of my time and I felt like I had to do something.

I decided I had to create a company that's aim is to reduce as much plastic as possible. I would make it as easy as possible for people to reduce plastic by offering great content that aims to help you live a life with less plastic in it, and offering ways to make it fun!  

That Just Was Not Enough For Me!

So I decided to run this campaign and give a portion of company's equity to help reduce plastic actively, educate our consumers about the harms of plastic in a way which appeals to them! This will help assist those who use endless amounts of plastic to become more environmentally conscious and eventually using less plastic. It all begins with small steps!  

How Could It Still Not Be Good Enough For Me?

I am glad to state that these dark bamboo sunglasses are indeed hand made by a small manufacturing plant. So your money will be supporting the artisans that made them!

What Will You Receive?

You will receive the Indiegogo edition pair of Dark bamboo sunglasses that come with a hard traveling case, a microfiber pouch, and a lens cleaning cloth. - See perks for more details!
Or you can choose to buy our stainless steel bamboo bottle with a bamboo cap!  
You will feel great knowing you have helped fund a company that will bring many eco-friendly products to the market and help many in the future reduce plastic.

The Impact It Will Have

We will help our consumers reduce their plastic consumption. If we change one person than they can change others. This is how we change the world. One step at a time.


Risks & Challenges

A risk could be getting your products later than expected. If we are flooded with orders than you can expect to get your sunglasses later than expected. This all depends on how much we raise. Though we are prepared to handle a large amount(thousands) of orders, and everything should be fine.

    Return Policy

    If you wish to return your product you may do so, simply contact me at
    officialecolux@gmail.com and tell me what state/ country you live in and where you can send it. You will be refunded in store credit with the refunded money! It is a fundraiser after all.
    For those of you that read here is a 10$ off pair of Eco-Lux sunglasses to the lucky first 5. Hurry https://goo.gl/varj7Q

    Other Ways You Can Help out!

    "Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!"

    This could not be more accurate! If you do not want to donate or are currently not available to then you can help by sharing this with friends and family on social media. Find us @officialecolux

story:
Our story

If you like the idea of less waste and more relove, read on...

relove was created in 2013 by Suzanne Hickey & Steve Anderson. After giving up our day jobs, our goal was to transform our true passions into a lifestyle business that followed our own ideas of what it means to live a life of bliss in a kinder, gentler world.

Passion for interior design and carpentry, mixed with our love of mid-century modern, vintage & retro design led us to building a small business that creates one-of-a-kind upcycled items and handcrafted, custom designed furniture.

We are proud of our business and the impact we’ve made in rebuilding, upcycling, reusing and salvaging. By keeping items out of the landfill, by giving things a new life to be loved again, by building new pieces from old material that is usually wasted, we are positively contributing to our community, and in our own small way, to the state of the world. And, by using our creative talents in this way, we are also proud to offer our customers more sustainable & beautiful design. 

Be sure to check out the "Gallery" tab above to take a peek inside our workshop, a look behind the scenes, and  see a small selection of our finished items!


What we need

After upcycling, rebuilding and reloving 726 items (and counting!) in our space, we are bursting at the seams with larger projects and bigger salvage trips.

It’s time for us to grow! 

We want to bring you more relove. More upcycled pieces we’ve saved, more builds using reused/reclaimed/salvaged materials, more midcentury, vintage & retro design. To do this, we need more space. More storage space and more cargo space.

Our goal is to DOUBLE the number of upcycled and rebuilt pieces we offer each year. (Yup, that’s an average of almost 400 items/year!)  

So, we are reaching out to our fantastic community -- family, friends, customers, supporters, allies, champions, cheerleaders, design junkies, the furniture-obsessed and relovers of all kinds -- who are both local and international (and all very near to our hearts!) to help us reach our goal.

Our crowdfunding campaign for less waste, more relove will help us continue to grow responsibly and support our financial stability so we’re around for a very long time.

Over the first three years, we’ve renovated our garage into a great workshop, turned our basement into a much-used studio and built an additional storage shed. We’ve put the proceeds of the recent sale of our Honda Fit into purchasing a larger vehicle. 

After three crazy, wonderful years of business, we’ve happily invested our love, time, creativity and energy into chasing our dreams and putting our passions out into the world in the form of relove. We are incredibly grateful every single day, in so many ways, to be able to do this and we are blown-away by what the universe brings back to us.


The impact of your donation

Help us reach our goal...of less waste, more relove by doubling the number of relove items we offer each year.

Help us buy a used Ford Transit wagon that...

  • has HUGE cargo space 
  • is fuel efficient
  • is not fancy, it’s just practical and makes daily operations smoother

Help us expand our storage space so we can...

  • properly store and dry reclaimed wood and salvaged materials
  • increase our inventory of items to be upcycled
  • work on expanding our designs & custom furniture line


How you can help

All donations, no matter the size, will be received with a heartfelt thank you and a “cargo van load” of good karma sent your way. 

If all you can manage is to tell your friends and forward the link to the campaign through your social media sites, we’d be tickled. Get the word out. Make some noise.

Be sure to check out the great rewards that come with your donation...and get your hands on some relove goodies right now!

Want less waste, more relove? Let’s make it happen.

Xo Suzanne & Steve

      



What people are saying

"[my husband] surprised me yesterday with the two side lamps that you repurposed. I was thrilled! We bought those lamps ten years ago. I am so pleased to be able to continue to use them. They look brand new and very “high end”. We both feel that we are so lucky to have such talent like Relove in our city." -- C.H., Dartmouth, NS


"You are so welcome,  I'm thrilled that a lot of it will be "reloved" instead going to the dump or the burn pile!" -- D.C., Indian Harbour, NS


"[I]  couldn't wait to get to the school to see the revlove pieces. They are AMAZING!! You guys did a fantastic job! Armbrae will be a cooler, classier place because of your creative talents."-- G.O., Armbrae Academy, Halifax, NS


"You know how sometimes at night when people have their lights on but haven't closed their blinds yet and you can "accidentally" see into their homes and check out their style? I don't even mind if i leave my blinds up all night because I think if people look into my living room and see my piece of your Mixed Wood Art they'll think: "oooh... Those people look really cool and modern and interesting." -- E.S, Dartmouth, NS


"As if it were more possible to love @relovehalifax (they're the ones who built our front desk AND retail section), [they] popped in with this beautifully handcrafted sideboard. Please file this under "things I want to buy for myself" -- L.M, The Floatation Centre, Halifax, NS


"Received my bookcase today. It was very well packaged and in perfect condition. I can't believe it looks even better in person then it did online. Thanks so much. -- J.M., Toronto, ON



As seen in:

Homes Halifax -- "Forget Me Not", annual edition, 2016
East Coast Living Magazine -- "Finders Keepers", summer edition, 2015
Sea & Be Scene (Aliant Community Channel), S&BS.com, spring edition 2015 Halifax Magazine -- "Local Discoveries", winter edition, 2015
East Coast Living Magazine -- "Roadside Assistance", summer, 2014
Homes Halifax -- "One Relove", annual edition, 2014

I don't even mind if i leave my blinds up all night because I think if people look into my living room and see my piece of your Mixed Wood Art they'll think: "oooh... story:
Short Summary

OpExpert was founded in March 2016. We are a woman-owned business based in Wyomissing, Pennsylvania.  We provide Talent Acquisition services to clients all over the world. Our consultants have leading industry experience and have worked with many of the world’s largest companies. Our mission is to provide our clients with world class service and to exceed their expectations. There are some large staffing projects we would like to bid on. However, we don't have the capital to bid on these projects.  We will be profitable in 3-6 months. We just need a boost to be able to grow. It has been challenge.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Building a lean team to be able to support large projects.
  • Capital to continue to be in business.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still use the funds to continue with the company. Any funds would help us. 
  • We are planning to build an office to employee Veterns as well for a special project we will be running in 8 months.

The Impact

  • This project is about helping people find jobs. We are planning to do a lot of community outreach and training programs for the unemployed as a company project.

Risks & Challenges

  • Myself and members of the team have left corporate jobs to start this project. We are living off of savings. We believe that we will be able to be profitable and help others in less than 3 months. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't spend the money to help, please let people others know that we can help them find jobs.
